story:
Lost Sol follows the life of a spaceship's crew near the Earth. The crew needs to explore the remnants of humanity to improve their chances of survival. In order to achieve this, you need to research new technologies, scavenge, mine resources, manage your crew, and rescue other survivors, sometimes even dismantle parts of your own ship in an effort to keep your ship afloat.

Throughout the game, you need to make careful decisions how to build your ship, and manage your crew.

 

 The Storyline

By year 2499 humanity had extended its reach to the Moon and Mars, with a network of stations spread throughout the solar system, each serving their own purpose. Travel times between the planets were still long and space travel ever treacherous. However, a new technology was developed, one that promised to change everything – two colossal gates, constructed between Earth and Mars.

These gates represented the cutting edge of scientific research, capable of creating stable wormholes between the planets. While the gates promised to dramatically reduce the cost and time of space travel, concerns were raised over the instability of the technology. In spite of these concerns the project was pushed through in order to have the gates ready for the start of the New Year, a momentous event that marked the beginning of the new century and it was hoped, a new era for humanity.

Tragedy struck on the eve of the New Year. While each gate was powered up successfully, it was not long before the gates began emitting increasingly powerful waves of gravitational energy. The effects were devastating: all ships and stations in the vicinity of each gate were crushed in an instance. Those further away suffered less damage but the immense gravitational forces soon caused the gates themselves to collapse. Within minutes, Earth, the Moon and even Mars began to disintegrate.

After a while the anomaly became unstable, and collapsed in a violent explosion. The wave of destruction it left behind was unimaginable. The Earth, and Mars were no longer habitable, and the space around was filled with massive debris fields. The ships, which survived this apocalyptic event were now left stranded, and many of them did not have the facilities to survive more than a few hours.

However, a glimmer of hope remained. Important data from the event was shared throughout the Solar system. This valuable information might be used to develop new technological breakthroughs. There were still surviving smaller colonies like the Europa Science, and Mining Colony near Jupiter, and many smaller station colonies around the asteroid belts beyond Mars. Normally, the majority of these colonies relied on the central planets. Moreover, the communication network collapsed after the disaster. Only time will tell if the survivors are able to stay alive.

 

 Gather Resources

You need resources to build your ship, but your equipment need also specific resources to function. Some of these resources can be looted, refined from asteroids, or even fabricated from raw materials.

In Lost Sol, gathering resources can be accomplished in various ways. As long as your ship has enough storage, the collected resources will be stored in your ship, and they can be used to improve, and maintain the ship.

 

 Control Your Crew

At its core, Lost Sol is a ship management game, and your crew is an essential part of this experience. Everything from building structures to exploring wrecks is done by commands given to your crew members.

While playing the game, depending on your preferences, some commands can be given automatically. You can also manually assign or manage tasks by opening the action menus. Your new orders take priority over automatically given ones, ensuring that the next available crew member will follow your orders. You can also give direct orders to crew members by having them selected while giving your order.

You have various options available, under different conditions, in your action menu.

 

 Fight for Survival

Depending on the difficulty setting in the start of your story, the game will generate events like asteroid storms, in different magnitudes, numbers, and speeds, which will test the capabilities of your ship, and crew. 

You will also face other ships, some of them will be wrecks, and might not have any active defenses, while the others will fight back. It's up to you to decide if you want to risk your ship for the rich spoils you may come across.

 

 Structural AI

When I look at a typical battleship, I am amazed by the amount of crew each ship requires to function, because essentially it is the crew that keeps the ship running. I wanted to create a dynamic ship where the crew is kept busy doing important things, like keeping the ship in a good condition, repairing or operating equipment. This turns the game into a small strategy game on itself.

Lost Sol uses a special engine to assess each of your ships modules, checking information like how often they are maintained or how long they stayed damaged. It also makes calculations on how well the structure will continue to perform, if it is going to break down in a glorious explosion, or it will simply die down. It waits a handy crew member to tinker with it, because just like a neglected car is more likely to face serious problems sooner than a well maintained one, so is your ship.

This mechanism deepens the relationship between the importance of having a good crew to complement your ship, and the struggles you will be facing when designing such a large ship.

 

 Game Views

Lost Sol gameplay is divided into two different views, the ship view, and the space view. In the ship view, you will have a fixed view of your ship with building options enabled. You are able to plan new structures, control existing ones, manage your crew, and assign or control various tasks. In the space view, you will have an outside view of your ship, and you will be able to view objects all around, take direct control over weapons, and use special ship modules.

 

 UI Customization

Both game views feature things like radar display (bottom right), and crew status (upper right), which can be toggled on/off. The ship status screen can be switch to full cargo view or both toggled off (upper left).

 

 Icon Based Interface

While designing the UI, I tried to avoid a text wall as much as possible. Consequently, I made most of the UI design from icons.

 

Deeper Control

Some structures have unique panels for interacting with the structure controls. These can be anything from selecting what resources to refine, to picking new research projects. Every powered structure, which handles processes like research, refining, assembly etc. has an intuitive double hexagon design. This allows for quick overview of what's going on, how much of the progress is completed, and whether the structure is working, idle, or finished.

 

Time Dilation

Control the speed of the game. Speed it up, or slow it down. Give your self the time to think.

 

 Design, And Share

I think what makes a game great is also the power it gives to the players, who want to take it a step forward. Therefore, I made a powerful asset editor inside of the game for those, who want to have the core ship design experience. The in-game editor makes possible to build ships, wrecks, stations, and asteroids. For making file sharing easy for platforms like Steam workshop or forums, the editor has different options for importing, and exporting your designs in a single file format in JavaScript Object Notation. The players are able to present different starting challenges, and designs to show their skills, and techniques to the community.

When you die in the game, what is left of your ship is saved into the Relic Schematics Library as a wreck, so you have a chance of coming across your old ships in new games.

 Is It Ready ?

It has been a year since I started working on Lost Sol, and it is right now in the Pre-Alpha stage. At the end of this Indiegogo campaign we will enter the Alpha stage. Anyone, who has bought the game, or signed up for a backer tier above colonist, will be able to participate in the Alpha stage, and any update that happens afterwards. My goal is to grow our community, and make it possible for everybody to become a part of it by leaving their own personal marks on Lost Sol. I hope Lost Sol will become a great 2D spaceship survival game together with all of you. 

 

 

 Future Plans

As the game continues to develop, I want to improve the game content, add new features, and improve user experience with better audio, and art. 

These listed ideas below are subject to change as the project continues in Alpha stage, depending on the community response. The most demanded features will be prioritized.

  • More Structures : Increasing the variety of structures that can be built on the ship. 
  • Extensive Research : Discover new structure options, and improve the current ones.
  • Higher Tier Structures : More structure variations, which are tied to the research system.
  • Character Learning : Allowing your crew to learn skills as they do tasks over time.
  • Deep Characterization : Addition of traits for characters, and a backstory.
  • Limited Modding Support : Allowing for aspects of the game to be tuned, and changed.
  • Space Regions : Different properties for different regions of space, all the way to Europa.
  • Bookmarks : Similar to EvE-Online, can be used for marking out, and naming points of interest to return later.
  • Endgame Storyline : Completing the story arc for those who want to pursue it.
  • Your Imagination : Contact me by email, PM, comments, comment underneath game updates, comment under YouTube videos, make a Reddit post, share them in Steam, comment under blog posts about what you have in mind. This is not a one-way street, you will affect the development of Lost Sol with your feedback, and ideas. 

 

 Stretch Goals

These goals will be worked on after the initial goals of the alpha stages are completed. These large-scale expansions will be unlocked depending on the total funds collected.

Stretch goals will be active even after the campaign ends. When the campaign enters InDemand on Indiegogo.

About Stretch Goals :

  • Trade Convoys & Stations : Trade convoys are cargo ships with several escorting ships working together to defend what they have. They are not friendly, and will shoot on sight. They will provide good loot for those that are brave enough to take them on, and survive. While stations will exist in the actual game, these stations are not mobile, so their only chance is to be neutral to any new arrivals, and trade to survive.
  • Fighters & Hangars : Fighters' expansion will introduce hangars into the ship building, and crew members' manning fighters. For this feature, the editor will also be modified to allow the design of fighters.
  • Factions & Pirate Gangs : Pirates are active small, and medium attack ships roaming, and looking for targets of opportunity. There are three planned factions, inspired from the TV-Series The Expanse. The factions will give you access to the bookmarks, which mark out faction stations nearby.
  • Instanced Multiplayer : Lost Sol is actually designed to be integrated into a multiplayer game with ships easily packed, and shared. Aside from that, the multiplayer in Lost Sol can work in multiple models.
    • Co-op : Host plays the captain, while the clients take direct control over one or several crew members.
    • Fleet-op : The host player, and every client connected will play with separate ships. The ships will be able to trade, and support each other depending on the host's settings.

 

 Campaign Perks

Name in Credits : We thank you for supporting us, and as part of our appreciation, your name will be forever in the credits of the game.

Lost Sol [Alpha] Digital Copy : You will get the Alpha release of the game when its available in mid-2017, and if we are available in Steam, you will receive a Steam key for the game.

Lost Sol [Pre-Alpha] - NOW : You will get the Pre-Alpha within about a week, and if we are available in Steam, you will receive a Steam key for the game.

Name in Character Library : Your selected name, and surname will be placed into the character library, and you will have a chance to appear as a crew member or in any number of encounters, which can be tied to factions, and trade stretch goal.

Your Ship in Official Game : Your ship will be part of the game, and it will have a chance to appear to others. If factions stretch goal is achieved, this will also include your character name (bio, and portrait if unlocked).

Add Portrait, and Bio in Game : You can add a special character name, which will come with a special bio, and an unique portrait you will design.

I will edit your picture to fit into this form of template to appear in the game, and make the background transparent if requested. If the Factions & Pirate Gangs stretch goal is achieved, your character has a chance of appearing as the captain of your submitted ship, or a random ship, belonging to one of the factions.

Design an Official Station : When the official structures, which are intended for the Alpha release are completed, I will add your station into the game. The players will have a chance to find it, and fight against it. The stations can come in multiple forms, which you can decide (science/military/supply). This will also include trade stations, if the Trade Convoys & Stations stretch goal is achieved.

Design a Module : Lost Sol building options will feature many different fictional modules for stations, asteroids, and spaceships. We will sit down, and talk about what kind of things we can add, just tell what you have in mind. The module must fit the narrative of the game.

Design a Unique In-game Event : Space is scary, and we already have events like different varieties of asteroid storms, and ship encounters. You can also add to the dangers, or to the opportunities in this universe. We will talk together, and work out how your imagination can come to life.

Become Part of the Storyline : This is a special event chain that leads to the Endgame Storyline. By becoming a secret deity you will be directly influencing what will happen in one of these chain missions. I will present the storyline I have planned, and we will decide how your influence will play out for the players.

 

 Join the Crew

Are you an artist with a burning passion for science fiction, talented, and looking for a possibility to make some awesome art, sounds, or soundtracks for Lost Sol ? If so, we should talk. I will use the Indiegogo funding to provide the players of Lost Sol the visual, and audio experience they deserve. I'm looking forward to hear from you.

Multilingual Lost-Sol

If you want to support the game by translating Lost Sol to your own language, you can translate the "Res_Language_English" file, and send it to me. I will add it into the game. 

 

 About Me

Hi! My name is John Özgönül. I'm a computer engineer, and I worked as a software specialist for two years. I left my work to attend military service in the Finnish Defense Forces around mid-2015. After my service, I began working on Lost Sol full time since early 2016.

I'm a part-time gamer in the games like EvE-Online, Planetside 2 , Battlefield Series, and Arma 3. My online footprint is mostly based on my alias “Davelantor”.

You can contact me about the game at davelantor@lostsolgame.com.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetai...

When the campaign enters InDemand on Indiegogo.About Stretch Goals :

Trade Convoys & Stations : Trade convoys are cargo ships with several escorting ships working together to defend what they have. They are not friendly, and will shoot on sight. They will provide good loot for those that are brave enough to take them on, and survive. While stations will exist in the actual game, these stations are not mobile, so their only chance is to be neutral to any new arrivals, and trade to survive.

Fighters & Hangars : Fighters' expansion will introduce hangars into the ship building, and crew members' manning fighters. For this feature, the editor will also be modified to allow the design of fighters.

Factions & Pirate Gangs : Pirates are active small, and medium attack ships roaming, and looking for targets of opportunity. There are three planned factions, inspired from the TV-Series The Expanse. The factions will give you access to the bookmarks, which mark out faction stations nearby.

Instanced Multiplayer : Lost Sol is actually designed to be integrated into a multiplayer game with ships easily packed, and shared. Aside from that, the multiplayer in Lost Sol can work in multiple models.

Co-op : Host plays the captain, while the clients take direct control over one or several crew members.

Fleet-op : The host player, and every client connected will play with separate ships. The ships will be able to trade, and support each other depending on the host's settings.


 
 Campaign PerksName in Credits : We thank you for supporting us, and as part of our appreciation, your name will be forever in the credits of the game.Lost Sol [Alpha] Digital Copy : You will get the Alpha release of the game when its available in mid-2017, and if we are available in Steam, you will receive a Steam key for the game.Lost Sol [Pre-Alpha] - NOW : You will get the Pre-Alpha within about a week, and if we are available in Steam, you will receive a Steam key for the game.Name in Character Library : Your selected name, and surname will be placed into the character library, and you will have a chance to appear as a crew member or in any number of encounters, which can be tied to factions, and trade stretch goal.Your Ship in Official Game : Your ship will be part of the game, and it will have a chance to appear to others. If factions stretch goal is achieved, this will also include your character name (bio, and portrait if unlocked).Add Portrait, and Bio in Game : You can add a special character name, which will come with a special bio, and an unique portrait you will design.I will edit your picture to fit into this form of template to appear in the game, and make the background transparent if requested. If the Factions & Pirate Gangs stretch goal is achieved, your character has a chance of appearing as the captain of your submitted ship, or a random ship, belonging to one of the factions.Design an Official Station : When the official structures, which are intended for the Alpha release are completed, I will add your station into the game. The players will have a chance to find it, and fight against it. The stations can come in multiple forms, which you can decide (science/military/supply). This will also include trade stations, if the Trade Convoys & Stations stretch goal is achieved.Design a Module : Lost Sol building options will feature many different fictional modules for stations, asteroids, and spaceships. We will sit down, and talk about what kind of things we can add, just tell what you have in mind. The module must fit the narrative of the game.Design a Unique In-game Event : Space is scary, and we already have events like different varieties of asteroid storms, and ship encounters. You can also add to the dangers, or to the opportunities in this universe. We will talk together, and work out how your imagination can come to life.Become Part of the Storyline : This is a special event chain that leads to the Endgame Storyline. By becoming a secret deity you will be directly influencing what will happen in one of these chain missions. I will present the storyline I have planned, and we will decide how your influence will play out for the players. 
 Join the CrewAre you an artist with a burning passion for science fiction, talented, and looking for a possibility to make some awesome art, sounds, or soundtracks for Lost Sol ? If so, we should talk. I will use the Indiegogo funding to provide the players of Lost Sol the visual, and audio experience they deserve. I'm looking forward to hear from you.Multilingual Lost-SolIf you want to support the game by translating Lost Sol to your own language, you can translate the "Res_Language_English" file, and send it to me. I will add it into the game.  
 About MeHi! My name is John Özgönül. I'm a computer engineer, and I worked as a software specialist for two years. I left my work to attend military service in the Finnish Defense Forces around mid-2015. After my service, I began working on Lost Sol full time since early 2016.I'm a part-time gamer in the games like EvE-Online, Planetside 2 , Battlefield Series, and Arma 3. My online footprint is mostly based on my alias “Davelantor”.You can contact me about the game at davelantor@lostsolgame.com.http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetai...

story:
English version - German one follows.      Englische Version - deutsche folgt.

WE WILL MAKE IT HAPPEN!


My name's Daniel Stenz and I'm a passionate gamer ever since - just like Lilly!
I was a shift worker and played on the strangest times but mostly just found people are drunk or whatever.. I was happy when I worked a weak on regular times so a few of my friends were online but even tho I sometimes just leaked of the right gaming-buddy... This was the point ExaQueue was created!
After days and weeks of developing the concept, algorithm, GUI and more of this amazing project I built up a hyped team as well. We are now together on this project and hyped about so many features will be included in this free software for the desktop and smartphones!

To make it as short as I can:

  • GUI comparable with Tinder -> just to find your individual gaming-buddy! An amazing algorithm which searches, depending on your skill set, play stile but also personal aspects as well, to find your perfectly fitting mate and present them to you!
    Check out our Website for the Designs up to now! www.exaqueue.com/demo
  • Tournament organizer tool to use your grown community and network for amazing competitive fun! At every game we support! Select your game, map, team size, fall out system, rules, themes and voluntary participation fees and thus the rewarding system and invite all your friends to create a team and join this amazing experience with you!
    ExaQueue will handle everything else for you!
  • YouTube for interactive entertainment/gaming? Developers have got a hard time to receive feedback - we want to solve this and give the ExaQueue community the chance to try out up-coming games and submit their suggestions to get the games we all want!
    United. As. Gaming-Community!

We will support every online Game but the sequence is:
League of Legends -> Overwatch -> CS:GO -> Dota2 (February, Alpha release)
Call of Duty ->  Battelfield -> Minecraft -> GTV V (May, Beta release)
All further supported games will be chosen after the Supporter voted in the Bakers-Forum!
- We aim to include monthly a new game!

 For more information just visit ExaQueue !

 

 What you might give us & what you are going to get!

 

To be honest: ExaQueue will be released anyway. Someday. That's the point.
I am simply that into this idea I won't stop no matter what happens, but I need your help to create it as THE GAMING APPLICATION! Without you it may need several years to release ExaQueue properly but with your support in any kind of way we are going to release ExaQueue with the main-features already in February, 2018! Want to make this happen? So support us and let the Gaming-Community unite!

And this amazing support shall be rewarded, rewarded with amazing and exclusive Perks! 

To take a closer look at these obtainable rewards visit: ExaQueuePerks
I am sure, there's something for every true gamer!
But also share this project because that's mostly as important as direct support!

 

 

But what do we want to do exactly with this raised fund?

 

We want to keep this project clear for everyone supports us and this idea!
That's why we will list everything we can't afford at our current situation.

  1. We're not a big team, just a few gaming friends (know each other since decades) are hyped about an amazing idea. We haven't got the man-power we need. And we need to work also.
    Thus we want to have the possibility to work 16/24h on this project!
    We're only ~6h/day viable at the moment :(
  2. To launch the alpha properly and quickly we need more man-power! 
    We want to hire a little developer team and that's probably the most expensive part.
  3. Even tho we've all saved money and are already using it to pay for hardware as server and software for developing purposes we can't keep it like this for ever.
    Our capital is limited as well. 
  4. Especially at this project it is very important to have a goo marketing strategy and the budget to realize it. ExaQueue needs on the first day on a user base is able to interact together! Or do you want to get paired with someone you don't even understand?
    We've already got a partnership with a big network will support ExaQueue (and also use), but it is just European focused up to now and our American and African friends need a community as well!

And that's it!
We're already a well educated team and are able to take mostly all tasks on our own hand.
But we need help anyway and why not funding a project for the community with the community?

 

 

And what is the long term goal of ExaQueue?

 

You know already: we want to get this community as united as the gaming community should be. Gaming makes more fun together as alone and we want to spread this kind of love into the gaming community! 
But that's far now all! What do you think happens when everyone is able to organize tournaments?
Exactly! There will be many more events and maybe also weekend tournaments for every city out there!
It may take time but we believe that gaming might get a profession as a soccer player is one.

We think everyone has got a passion and just needs to be able to make this passion into a profession. So why can soccer player survive (and even get rich) by just making what they love but gamer not even tho it is mostly the same! The one just needs the body, the other needs more the brain.. And while the organization and the society might be a problem, which the tournament organizer will solve. The other problem is you need a well fitting team! And ExaQueue will be created exactly for this purpose!
So get in action and help us make gaming what it should be!

 

Thanks in advance for every kind of support!

Kind regards,
Daniel Stenz - team ExaQueue


CLICK HERE FOR A FEW APP PREVIOUS (JUST GAMING-BUDDY FINDER PART)


Deutsche Version.    German version.

WIR SETZEN ES UM!


Mein name ist Daniel und ich bin ein passionierter Gamer - genau wie Lilly!
Ich war ein Schichtarbeiter und habe zu den verrücktesten Zeiten gespielt  und was fand ich? Betrunkene oder sonstige Trolls.. Ich war so glücklich mal eine Woche normal zu arbeiten, da dann wenigstens ein paar freunde online sind aber trotzden fehlte mir des öfteren einfach der richtige Gaming-Buddy... und das war der Moment in dem ExaQueue geboren wurde! 
Nach Tagen und wochen an  Ausarbeitungen des Konzepts, des Algorithmus, der Benutzeroberfläche und mehr über dieses richtig spannende Projekt habe ich ein genau so gehyptes Team aufgebaut, wie ich es bin. Jetzt sind wir alle zusammen fokusiert an diesem Projekt und richtig aufgeregt in anbetracht an allen Funktionen die wir konzeptionell bereits ausgefeilt haben,welche in dieser kommende Software, vorrangig für den Desktop, beinhaltet werden.

Um diese so kurz wie möglich zusammen zu fassen:

  • Eine Benutzeroberfläche vergleichbar mit Tinder -> Bestimmt um deinen individuellen gaming-buddy zu finden! Beruhend auf einem ausgeglückeltem algorithmus, basierend auf hunderte getätigt Umfragen, welcher anhand deines Könnens, deines Spiel-Stils aber auch persönlichen informationen (freiwillig) den perfekten Gaming Kollegen zu ermitteln und sie dir dann vor zu stellen. Für eine Designvorschau besuche: www.exaqueue.com/demo
  • Turnier organisations tool um mit deinen Freunden oder community ein riesiges competitives Spielerlebnis zu managen und natürlich erleben! Und das in jedem Spiel, dass wir supporten! Wähle dein Spiel, die Map, Team grösse, Ausscheidungsverfahren, regeln, Thema und freiwillig auch Teilnahmegebühren und die Preise sowie das Zuweisungsprinzip ganz nach deinem belieben. Dann nurnoch all deine Freunde einladen ein und Teams zusammen stellen um diese Herausforderung an zu nehmen und ein custom Turnier, ganz nach eurem beliebn, zusammen zu erleben!  
  • YouTube für interaktives entertainment/gaming? Spielentwickler haben eine schwere Zeit um feedback und wünsche zu bekommen. Wir wollen dieses Problem lösen und eine Win/Win Situation erschaffen in der die Spieler schon früh mit entscheiden können und somit für alle früher ein super geniales neues Spiel entwickelt werden kann!
    Vereint. Als. Gaming-Community!
 

Wir werden jedes online Spiel supporten aber die Reihenfolge sieht so aus:
League of Legends -> Overwatch -> CS:GO -> Dota2 (Februar, Alpha release)
Call of Duty ->  Battelfield -> Minecraft -> GTV V (Mai, Beta release)
Die künftige Reihenfolge wird von den Supporten im ExaBro (Bakers) Forum gewählt!
- Gepant ist monatlich ein neues Spiel!

 For more information just visit ExaQueue !

 What you might give us & what you are going to get!

 

Um ehrlich zu sein: Wir werden ExaQueue so oder veröffentlichen. Irgendwann. Das ist auch der Punkt. Ich bin einfach viel zu gefesselt von diesem Konzept um von irgendetwas oder irgendjemandem vom Gegenteil überzeugt zu werden aber wir brauchen DICH um daraus wirklich DIE SPIELE SOFTWARE zu kreiren die Team-ExaQueue und unsere Fans mit und ausgetüftelt haben! Ohne dich kann dieses Vorhaben viele Jahre benötigen um endlich öffentlich gemacht zu werden. Vorallem um es so zu erschaffen, dass wir auch stolz sein können! Aber mit deinem Support wollen wir die App bereits im Frühjahr 2018 als open Alpha mit der Hauptfunktion der Spielersuche veröffentlichen! und keine sorge, denn ab diesem Punkt wird es uns auch viel leichter sein externe Gelder zu erhalten und spätestens im Sommer 2018 die Beta veröffentlichen können mit allen Funktionen die wir uns so ersehnen!

Und dieser unglaubliche support soll auch belohnt werden - garkeine Frage!

Gönn dir einen tieferen Einblick in die exklusiven Belohnungen für frühe Supporter des Traums namens ExaQueue auf unserer Website: ExaQueuePerks
Wir sind uns sicher, dass sich da etwas für jeden echten Gamer tummelt!
Aber was genau so wichtig ist, ist, dass du dieses Projekt teilst und damit auch anderen die Möglichkeit gibst die Zukunft des Gamings zu unterstützen!

 

 

Aber was wollen wir eigentlich genau mit dem Support alles finanzieren?

 

Wir wollen dieses Projekt so transparent wie nur irgend möglich gestalten und listen damit alle Ausgaben auf, welche wir nicht aus unserer eigenen Tasche und der Sparskontis der Kindheit umsetzen können.

  1. Wir sind nur ein kleines Team aus begeisterten Kindheitsfreunden die sich diese Pläne zum Ziel gesetzt haben und arbeiten auch um unsere Mieten zu bezahlen. Deshalb wollen wir die Möglichkeit haben effektiv 16/24h am Tag an ExaQueue zu arbeiten. 
    Momentan leider nur ~6h/Tag möglich :(
  2. Um die Alpha, so perfektionistisch wie wir auch veranlagt sein mögen, dennoch schnell veröffentlichen zu können brauchen wir mehr man-power! 
    Deswegen wollen wir ein kleines, grösseres Team zusammenstellen und vorallem unseren einzigen Programmierer etwas entlasten.
  3. Obwohl wir unser Erspartes für Hardware und Software verwenden, so wollen wir dennoch reserven haben, sollten diese in unserem Dauerbetrieb schäden von sich tragen um sie auch ersetzen zu können. Ebenfalls müssen wir die Server auf die Menge an Usern vorbereiten und auch hier reserven haben, solltet ihr uns überaschen. ;)
  4. Besonders in diesem Projekt ist das Marketing wichtig um gleich zu beginn einen Bekanntheitsgrad und Benutzerbasis auf zu bauen um nicht am schluss doch keinen perfekten Mitspieler für dich finden zu können! Oder möchtest du mit jemandem als "perfektes Team" gematched werden, der nicht mal deine Sprache(n) spricht? Wir haben zwar bereits unterstützung von einem Netzwerk zugesprochen bekommen, welches sich aber hauptsächlich im deutschschprachigem Raum aufhält. Und denkt doch nur mal einer an die armen Amerikaner und Nordafrikaner!

Und das ist es schon! And that's it!
Wir sind bereits ein breit und gut ausgebildetes Team mit Fähigkeiten in den meisten Bereichen die wir benötigen.
Aber dennoch nicht komplett und wieso ein Projekt für die Community nicht mit der Community erschaffen?

 

 

Und was ist das Weitreichendere Ziel von ExaQueue?

 

Du weisst ja bereits: Wir wollen die Gaming-Community so wie sie auch sein sollte und zwar vereint! Zocken macht einfach mir spass mit guten Freunden und wir wollen diese Art der Liebe und Zusammenkunft in der gesammten Community verbreiten!
Aber das ist bei weitem nicht alles. Was denkst du passiert wenn jedem, egal mit welchen hintergründen, ermöglicht wird Turniere zu organisieren und gestalten?
Genau! Es wird offensichtlich viel mehr Turniere in allen Spielen geben, egal ob Dorfturnier, Frauenturnier, Turnier der Neueinsteiger oder der Primarschüler! Gaming wird etabliert und immer mehr von der Gesellschaft akzeptiert und zwar als soziale interaktion mindestens genauso wie es auch Sport oder Filme sind! Denn Gaming, als interaktives entertainment, ist die Zukunfts des entertainments! So sehen wir das zumindest.. du auch?
ExaQueue soll alles bieten um dieses Unterhaltungsmedium auf die neue Stufe zu führen!

Ps: Jetzt stell dir vor, wie das bei fortgeschrittenerem Virtual Reality ist? oder Augmented Reality? Es wird so viele unglaublich berauschende events geben aber dafür muss nicht nur die technische gegebenheit wachsen sondern unsere Community genau so!
Und wenn du so denkst wie wir und ExaQueue genauso ersehnst wie wir:

Mach es möglich und supporte! Jetzt direkt hier und/oder indem du es teilst und der öffentlichkeit mitteilst!

 

Danke im vorraus für jede Art der Unterstützung!

Freundlichste Grüsse,
Daniel Stenz - Team ExaQueue

Wir sind nur ein kleines Team aus begeisterten Kindheitsfreunden die sich diese Pläne zum Ziel gesetzt haben und arbeiten auch um unsere Mieten zu bezahlen. Deshalb wollen wir die Möglichkeit haben effektiv 16/24h am Tag an ExaQueue zu arbeiten. Momentan leider nur ~6h/Tag möglich :(

Um die Alpha, so perfektionistisch wie wir auch veranlagt sein mögen, dennoch schnell veröffentlichen zu können brauchen wir mehr man-power! Deswegen wollen wir ein kleines, grösseres Team zusammenstellen und vorallem unseren einzigen Programmierer etwas entlasten.
Obwohl wir unser Erspartes für Hardware und Software verwenden, so wollen wir dennoch reserven haben, sollten diese in unserem Dauerbetrieb schäden von sich tragen um sie auch ersetzen zu können. Ebenfalls müssen wir die Server auf die Menge an Usern vorbereiten und auch hier reserven haben, solltet ihr uns überaschen. ;)
Besonders in diesem Projekt ist das Marketing wichtig um gleich zu beginn einen Bekanntheitsgrad und Benutzerbasis auf zu bauen um nicht am schluss doch keinen perfekten Mitspieler für dich finden zu können! Oder möchtest du mit jemandem als "perfektes Team" gematched werden, der nicht mal deine Sprache(n) spricht? Wir haben zwar bereits unterstützung von einem Netzwerk zugesprochen bekommen, welches sich aber hauptsächlich im deutschschprachigem Raum aufhält. Und denkt doch nur mal einer an die armen Amerikaner und Nordafrikaner!

Und das ist es schon! And that's it!Wir sind bereits ein breit und gut ausgebildetes Team mit Fähigkeiten in den meisten Bereichen die wir benötigen.Aber dennoch nicht komplett und wieso ein Projekt für die Community nicht mit der Community erschaffen?

 
 Und was ist das Weitreichendere Ziel von ExaQueue?
 
Du weisst ja bereits: Wir wollen die Gaming-Community so wie sie auch sein sollte und zwar vereint! Zocken macht einfach mir spass mit guten Freunden und wir wollen diese Art der Liebe und Zusammenkunft in der gesammten Community verbreiten!Aber das ist bei weitem nicht alles. Was denkst du passiert wenn jedem, egal mit welchen hintergründen, ermöglicht wird Turniere zu organisieren und gestalten?Genau! Es wird offensichtlich viel mehr Turniere in allen Spielen geben, egal ob Dorfturnier, Frauenturnier, Turnier der Neueinsteiger oder der Primarschüler! Gaming wird etabliert und immer mehr von der Gesellschaft akzeptiert und zwar als soziale interaktion mindestens genauso wie es auch Sport oder Filme sind! Denn Gaming, als interaktives entertainment, ist die Zukunfts des entertainments! So sehen wir das zumindest.. du auch?ExaQueue soll alles bieten um dieses Unterhaltungsmedium auf die neue Stufe zu führen!Ps: Jetzt stell dir vor, wie das bei fortgeschrittenerem Virtual Reality ist? oder Augmented Reality? Es wird so viele unglaublich berauschende events geben aber dafür muss nicht nur die technische gegebenheit wachsen sondern unsere Community genau so!Und wenn du so denkst wie wir und ExaQueue genauso ersehnst wie wir:Mach es möglich und supporte! Jetzt direkt hier und/oder indem du es teilst und der öffentlichkeit mitteilst!
 
Danke im vorraus für jede Art der Unterstützung!
Freundlichste Grüsse,Daniel Stenz - Team ExaQueue

story:
The Problem...

Artificial Intelligence is coming soon.  And then what next?  KILLER ROBOTS!

Here’s a chart that explains it:

Lots of really smart people agree that we're screwed:


Sounds hopeless, right?

We think we have a solution but need your support to make it a reality.  It's so simple that we can’t believe nobody has thought of it before:

The Don't Kill List


We’re going to create a list of all the humans that Robots aren’t allowed to kill.  We call it, the DON’T KILL LIST, and it will be posted on the DontKillList.com website in a variety of Robot friendly formats.

Problem solved, but we need your help to make it a reality.

Check out our awesome perks on the right ------>

(please note: these are sample designs only and the size, placement and color of the graphics might change)



Save yourselves!!!!!  And thank you for your support.

story:
Find our cards now at: http://gamesfortheplaya.com/ as this campaign has ended. Thank you for all the support!

 

Short Summary

We've all played Cards Against Humanity, and we love playing on the playa, but we'd love to share our love for the Playa in the best way we know how: Through custom Cards Against Humanity expansion packs themed around the camps, people and customs of the Playa.

Radically participate! Submit your card ideas here:

Card idea submission form.

Please make sure that your fill in the blank or question cards can work with nouns and gerunds as fill ins. Example:

"Did you hear about the couple who_______ in the Orgy Dome?" would require a past tense verb. So instead it could be "The couple was _________ in the Orgy Dome" where you can put gerunds or a noun if you wanted to be surreal.

What We Need & What You Get

We're offering hand-written thank you notes, PDF files of the cards for at-home printing and of course fully printed cards delivered to your door:

  • We need to make at least 100 decks to support the printing and deck assembly costs
  • We'd like to have decks in our supporters' hands in-time for the burn
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we'll ship as many decks as possible given the number of decks purchased. 
  • Proceeds from this sale will benefit the theme camp at Burning Man: Miso Horny.
  • In the spirit of gifting, the whole deck will be released for free via PDF by the end of August (stay tuned for updates).

 

 

The Impact

Miso Horny focuses on exploring consent culture through interactive workshops and homemade miso soup:

  • We need funds to purchase the Sake, Miso Soup, Bowls, Glasses and new infrastructure upgrades for our bar needed to serve hundreds of hungry burners.
  • Miso Horny has been operating for 3 years and bring 50 people from around the bay area to celebrate the culture and culinary delights of the Playa

Risks & Challenges

Making the cards takes quite a bit of work to make sure the content is 100% up to par, we are unsure if we can mass-produce the boxes

  • We are a hardy bunch, able to take on any challenge with a dose of grit, elbow-grease and the combined efforts and skills of the members of our awesome camp.
  • We are working on sourcing the boxes!

Aren't you the same guys who made Cards Against Humanity?

No! This expansion is unofficial and unlicensed. The people who made the original are brilliant and deserve all that credit. We're only complimenting their awesome game with an awesome expansion. The license for the original game is CC BY-NC-SA 2.0 . The cards can be printed at home through the PDF version of the deck here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/jl0u9ke8ss4xy2q/Cards...

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this campaign with other friends who support Playa culture.
  • You can always contribute to get a hand-written thank you note from our camp.

And that's all there is to it!

story:
Match Queue is a new social platform for League of Legends players, giving them the opportunity to connect with other players in the game as well as outside in the real world. Whether you just want to find someone with the skills to play with meet new friends with the same interests. 

Creating a Match Queue account is quick and easy! Just fill out the form on the homepage and answer some basic questions. 


After your account is created you can begin your search! Our search system will allow you to find other players local to your area using your zip code or within the same server. You can filter your search by rank, preferred lane, and much more to narrow down potential partners.

Once you select someone’s profile you’re interested in you can hit the “Request to Play” button and send a brief message. If they accept, you’ll be able to communicate back and forth to schedule a time to play together.

We’ve also implemented Riot’s API to compare yourself with any profile by pulling their stats including match history, most played champions, win/lose rate % and more.


You can switch between two layout styles in your settings from either dark or light.

We plan to optimize Match Queue for mobile devices to ensure your ability to login anywhere at any time.




1. What is Match Queue?

Match Queue is a new social platform geared towards League of Legends players, giving them the opportunity to connect with other players in the game as well as outside in the real world. 

2. How does it work?

You start by filling out the form on the homepage and answering some basic questions to create your profile. After your account is created you can begin your search! Our search system will allow you to find other players local to your area using your zip code or within the same server. You can filter your search by rank, preferred lane, and more to narrow down potential duo partners.

Once you select someone’s profile you’re interested in you can hit the “Request to Play” button and send a brief message to that person. If they accept, you’ll be able to communicate back and forth to schedule a time to play together.

3. How much does it cost to join?

Match Queue is FREE to sign up!

4. Why join Match Queue?

There isn’t many matchmaking platforms that are as specific to League of Legends as we are. Our platform provides the chance for gamers to connect in many ways, whether you're looking to build a team, meet new friends or find someone with the skills to play with.

5. How do I get started?

We’re currently in the process of raising funds to begin the development of the site. We know not everyone is able to contribute financially but spreading the word of Match Queue to your friends and social media would be a HUGE help and very much appreciated. 


We've receive many questions and continue to update our FAQ section on our website: http://matchqueue.com/faq

As with any major development project such as ours, there are always the chance off unforeseen roadblocks, complications, bugs and a many other things that could come up and ultimately delay the release of the platform. You will be the first to know if anything were to happen as we work hard as possible to try and get back on schedule. We'll be here to support our community as much as we can.

Through funding on Indiegogo, we'll be able to develop and add more features faster. We'll be able to test the platform and produce a quality product for you. The goal is flexible to due the off chance we don't meet the initial goal, there is a possibility to fund the rest of the site out of my own pocket depending on how close we get.

I've already devoted a lot of my own time and resources to get Match Queue started. I sacrificed a lot because that is how much I believe in this. Just like you, I want to create something that gamers want and make it the best it can be. Help us create an amazing social platform!

CONTACT

If you have questions during or after the campaigns have closed, you can always reach us at support@matchqueue or on our social media. I'll respond as fast as possible!

For press inquiries please contact press@matchqueue.com

story:
MAIN ADVANTAGES OF OUR CARD GAME: 

  • An original fun and educational card game. It's familiarized players with remarkable, often unknown  historical heroes, generals, armored units, war soldiers from various nations.  
  • Glow-in-dark game cards (!). You or your kids will be amazed with this exciting sight in full darkness!
  • Universal and funny game rules. Also you can use "Witty Wars" 54-cards deck with any classical card game.
  • High quality paper and print.
  • This is our first "Witty Wars" card game and we are going without any profit. Just for bringing in the world new brand and glow-in-dark cards trend. It will be your first such UNIQUE card game you ever played. Any savings from production due to the number of orders allow us to go forward and make our web-portal. Worldwide shipping is free!
  • 10% from all collected amount will go to the charities for peace without real wars. 

WITTY WARS IS EDUCATIONAL CARD GAME:

We present to your attention our unique card game! Your interest of playing will be warmed by the fact that among the heroes of the card you will find a variety of warriors from different eras of our civilization. Among the cards heroes there will be the Aztecs and the Indians, Vikings and Samurai, the English archers and medieval knights. 

More detailed list: Julius Caesar, Wyatt Earp, Chris Kyle, Mary Tudor, Napoleon, Karl the Glorious, William Marshal, Leonid, Hannibal, Alexander the Great, Tigranes the Great, Genghis Khan, Tamerlane, Attila, Alexander Nevsky, Mikhail Kutuzov, Saladin the Victorious, Spartacus, Frederick Barbarossa, Joan of Arc, George Washington, Simon Bolivar, Giuseppe Garibaldi, Isoroku Yamamoto, Bernard Montgomery, Dwight D. Eisenhower and various war soldiers from different nations!

 


 

You or your children will be very informative to have in their hands so many different heroes and warriors of all the time! Besides playing cards is a fun way to teach kids basic skills such as counting, taking turns, strategy and being a good sport, of course! With the internet, videos, Nintendos and so on around these days, it's easy to forget that you can have fun and a relatively quiet time by playing cards. Perfect for sitting in the shade in the garden or under the table in a den when it is raining, card games are suitable for children from 5 onwards, and great fun to play with grandparents, friends or as a family. Playing this card game is a fun way to spend some time together and can also be a great way to help your child improve his or her math skills!

Witty Wars 54-cards deck can provide hours of entertainment for players of all ages. Card games are more than a rainy day past time. They refine mental skills like logic, observation, and memory. 

Each warrior has its own characteristics and unique features. Here you can look at example of card charasteristics.

 
Our game with cartoon characters and graceful humor in the description of cards is for all ages! Your children will discover a wide variety of soldiers from different countries and eras, different types of weapons and the greatest heroes and generals! Each game card will be attached a detailed description of interesting historical notes. Do you or your child know who is Leonid? a sheriff of the US Dwide Earp? Napoleon? the legendary knight William Marshal? Tudor Princess? Playing our game you will know everything!
Have a fun and inexpensive family night by playing this card game! Make family time learning time with these fun, educational card games to play with your child.
 
GLOW-IN-DARK EFFECT:

The originality of the card game Witty Wars is  not only in its simplicity and having a good time, but that it can be played in absolute darkness. Have you ever been gaming when the lights go out? Maybe the power went out because of a storm or some accident. Or perhaps you’re out camping and the fire’s dying. Or maybe you just like playing games in the dark (not those types of games, you perv!). Well, even without light, you can play Witty Wars because these cards glow in the dark. All cards will glow in the dark  with all colors of the rainbow ! It will be very fascinating sight!

 


Any self-respecting fan of board games simply must have in his collection so unique card game like ours!

 
RULES:

The aim of the game is the defeat of the opponent by bringing him points of damage. The game cards are multi-function. There’s a special game that you can play with them, where you try and attack your opponent using the actual historical warriors that grace the front of the cards. They are also marked as a regular Poker deck of cards, so you can use them that way as well. Depending on what cards fall into your hands, and of course how well you use them, the outcome of the battle depends! Good cards are only 60% of success in the game and you should think qualitatively of your game strategy also!

Players attack each other in course. On what attack power has your card and what defence power has opponent's card depend whether or not the attacker can bring damage points to the defender. Dice will increase the power of attack and defence from 1 to 6. If attacker win in his turn, defender gain damage points. More damage points you will bring to the opponent - more chances to win the global battle before cards will end in the deck. Defender can choose what card will resist of the attacker card. It is better if it will be same era card (border color). If it will be another era's card, so attacker can add more attacking cards from same era and it will be more difficult for defender avoid damage points.

It will be double interesting to play in a jolly crowd as the most characters require some humorous actions from your opponents if you successfully win your battle using such card.

Our card game can be played with any number of players. You can even play one with a fictional opponent if there is no one to play!

All rules will be printed and inluded in the box.

 

WITTY WARS GAME BOX INCLUDES:

  • 54-cards deck.
  • Game rules handbook.
  • Booklet with every game card historical biography and facts.
  • 1 glow-in-dark dice 


OUR CAMPAIGNE GOALS (WHY WE NEED $3000):

We need this money to make our web-portal where we can update our fans with all news and future releases. Also we need to purchase some equipment for printing our cards game in order to avoid high costs for local print-services. With yours support we can reduce the cost of each package, and to establish ours own production. Thank you for any dollar!

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

Don't hesistate to talk about our card game to others around you and share it on social networks! Maybe some of yours friends or followers like this unique game, espeially who have kids and likes to play board and card games! This would be an huge help! Thank you!

With yours support we can reduce the cost of each package, and to establish ours own production. Thank you for any dollar!
OTHER WAYS TO HELP:
Don't hesistate to talk about our card game to others around you and share it on social networks! Maybe some of yours friends or followers like this unique game, espeially who have kids and likes to play board and card games! This would be an huge help! Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

This is a mini games I planned to develop in web or mobile platform. All you need to do is using the trolley to bounce the ball back & hit the bubble in order to make them burst.


The Challenges We Can Face Together

To be honest, I'm a terrible Artist & bad Game Developer. But the world of minigame changes rapidlly & dramatically, we cannot just spend 10 years creating a minigame. So I need to raise fund for establishing a Game Studio & make an opportunity for other Artists/Game Devs to cooperate without sacrifice their foods.

The fund would be used for below needs in 1 year:

  • Hire an office in Singapore
  • Setup IT infrastructure (hardware, software, development license...)
  • Form a team (~3 mem + me + CFO)


Hidden Game

As a supporter of minigame Bigbang (& NaiveCat Studio), you would:

  • Have early-access to this game (& other minigames of NaiveCat Studio)
  • Give feedback to the game and/or vote for the new feature (& many things else) and/or have special edition, themes for supporter
  • Automatically unlock  in-game Supporter achievement & Honor badge...

We'll use email or Indiegogo account for identification purpose. So please leave your contact information or forward your Indiegogo receipt to us for claiming your full benefit.

On the other hand:

  • Any Artist/Game Developer/Game Studio/CFO would like to cooperate with us, please kindly add us in LinkedIn.
  • If you just want to stop by & grab an idea for your new game, feel free to do it. In fact, I was inspired by many people I don't remember or don't even know.

For further information, please refer to our homepage: http://naivecat.com


Many thanks in advance.

story:
Who We Are

World United Game Studio is a development team formed exclusively by hardcore sim racing enthusiasts. We are the developers of F1 Simulator, ReVision 3 Super Game Mod

As those familiar with our title can attest, we spare no efforts in developing our racing sims - we have pushed relentlessly to make them as realistic as we possibly can, while also building our content base with an exceptionally diverse variety of cool racing cars & tracks. So far we have managed to provide this at no cost.


Why are we launching this Campaign

While this deal is intended specifically for the development of our next project, it also presents us with tempting possibilities for our current titles - an opportunity too good to pass.

The main goal of this campaign is to boost the development budget for the existing games in order to develop them further: adding new features, producing even more cars & tracks, and establishing a structure for online racing for these titles. 

The Current Sim in development of our current free of charge F1 Simulator Mod that is available for free download link is provided below.  It is a playable demo with two F1 Cars and 7 tracks, currently built on the CodeMasters F1 2014 Game.

Download the ReadMe file, Very important that you read before installation

Download by clicking HERE

Download the demo here, and see what we are capable of, 

Download by clicking HERE

You can View the video below, to see the sim in action, Raw Game Footage.


Backer will also receive the final release and all builds.


A new sim! Can you tell us all about it

Unfortunately not yet - in fact development & raising funds for the new game is not supposed to be the focus of this campaign. 

We are however opting to present some preliminary information here (as well as offering the chance for people to get onboard) for 3 main reasons: 

  1. Our cumulative development approach means there is substantial overlap in the development of the current titles moving on to the next; 
  2. We believe increasing access & interaction with the community at this stage will have a positive effect in our decisions for the next project.

To ensure this is not a complete leap in the dark, below are some of the main  points already stablished for our next project:

  • PC Racing Simulator on Steam, to be developed, expanded & supported for years after initial release;
  • Release price estimated at US$ 39,99 (base package, not including DLCs); 
  • Initial release planned for Q1 2017;
  • All new official licensed content & international tracks;
  • Built using the CryENGINE "game engine"; 
  • Extensive audio & physics developments;
  • Dynamic weather & track conditions.

Please understand however that at this time we do not plan to provide further in-depth details about this next project, nor make any precise estimation as to when more info will be available. If you do decide to invest on perks that include a copy for our next game, we urge you to do so only if you feel comfortable giving us that vote of confidence. 


What is being funded here

This campaign intends to raise a budget for continuing developing the F1 Simulator, ReVision 3 Mod further, allowing us to best exploit the resources we now have for a substantial short-term evolution.

While there are limits as to what can be done on the short term, we believe our current sim provides an extremely realistic & satisfactory driving experience and a great platform for offline racing. Our objective is to strengthen this platform for our users to enjoy over the next year and a half while we focus on the development of our new game.

To this end, content & features planned within this campaign include (but are not limited to) the following:

Features

  • Graphics & audio enhancements;
  • Physics developments to include true damage, tire damage, realistic drive-train modelling, enhanced true to world graphics.
  • Support for long distance races;
  • Automatic steering ratio adjustment + Support for more controller inputs & new hardware;
  • Custom championship tool so users can build their own seasons for online and offline racing.

Keep in mind this list is restricted to items we have already estimated - it is possible we could go even further as we progress provided the resources are in place.

Official Multiplayer Structure 

  • 4 dedicated servers running 24/7 under a defined scheduled featuring all our series, aiming to provide a go-to place for public multiplayer racing;
  • A Hot-lap ranking fed from the servers;

Some of the cars & tracks


Barber Motorsport Track


Watkins Glen International Track


Road  America


Some of the Cars


Modable Car Skins


Want Even More? You Can Choose!

Is there a particular track (from past or present) you really want us to do? Contributors will have a say in choosing a couple of bonus cars & tracks to complete the package. These will also be carried on to our next project.


Who will benefit from these developments?

If we meet (or exceed) the campaign funding goal, all F1 Simulator owners will enjoy a further batch of free updates (beyond those already planned) to include the items described above within 4-5 months of wrapping the campaign. 


Why should I contribute?

If we don´t succeed raising these extra funds, we unfortunately can no longer financially justify continuing updating these games free of charge. Contributors will be playing a fundamental role in making these games become a reality.

And of course, you will receive the games to play! 


What if the funding goal is exceeded?

All funding raised here goes into development of our titles, current and future. Everything we do now will be the base of our next title. The more you help us, the further & faster we can go!

I'm sold, How do I contribute

This campaign presents an unique opportunity to join the World United Game Studio bandwagon by contributing & earning copies of future games with very special conditions in one go. 

We have options for all tastes & pockets!

story:
"Roads? Where we're going, we don't need roads." Dr. Emmett Brown

Remember this classic quote from Back to the Future?  And he was right, why have roads if we  can ride on hoverboards? 

If you go back to your childhood days how did you imagine the future? Just like many of us you probably saw  flying cars, jetpacks, and .... hoverboards


As one of the movie classics, Back to the Future   incited people's fantasies about hoverboards  and made them a cultural phenomenon at the time. They have been  featured in many other art and entertainment works ever since.



Seeing the tremendous potential of hoverboards  our  team of engineers has decided to go back to the future as well and and create one for real. We don't want to come out with yet another Segway spinoff! We are in this to really make something special.

In preparation, we have  put together a list of  basic product features. Our hoverboard will be able to hover over any surface for at least thirty minutes at a time, carry at least a 70-kg load, and weigh around 15 kg. Users will steer the hoverboard by leaning on the sides, the same way that they have been steering skateboards for decades. This hoverboard will be portable and it able to push itself by moving forward and backwards. In short,  this will be a real hoverboard, the sort of fantastic invention that we dreamt about when we were young.


Our hoverboard will be able to hover over any surface for at least thirty minutes at a time, carry at least a 70-kg load, and weigh around 15 kg.

In short, this will be a real hoverboard, the sort of thing that we dreamt about when we were young.


Why Indiegogo ?

We have come to you with a quest to help us raise  funds for this ambitious plan. The money raised will be used  to cover the costs of the following: an electrical schematic, circuits, 2D assembly drawings, simulation / analysis of the design, a first prototype and  the initial mass production, your pre-orders,

So, let's join forces and  bring the world of tomorrow into the 21stcentury!

story:
The Teeny Tiny Backstory

I made The Most Addicting Sheep Game because it was a game I wanted to play. I was playing a lot of Indie side-scrollers on Xbox with simple graphics and cool music, and it struck me that it would be super awesome if pressing a button to jump was synchronized to the beat of the music. I started mucking about with some code, got a prototype up and running, and was immediately hooked. The Most Addicting Sheep Game was born.

Since then, TMASG has received rave reviews on XBOX, iOS and Windows Phone 7 and now, it's finally time to get EWE running and jumping on Android.

But supporting this campaign is not just about getting TMASG onto Android. It's about keeping it there and keeping it alive on iOS as well. Two things have happened recently that I thought spelt the end for TMASG: Apple released iOS 9 which was not compatible with my code and Microsoft announced the retiring of the Xbox 360 Indie Games section. As a pet project with just one person in charge of everything, from coding to graphics and music, I did not think I would ever have the time again to make the necessary updates. But I am determined! I have been working hard on a new cross-platform version of the game which I've already submitted to Apple for approval (which should go live within a week or two) and which lays the groundwork for the Android port.

In short, your support will aid enormously in getting The Most Addicting Sheep Game onto Android as well as securing its future on iOS.

Reviews for The Most Addicting Sheep Game

Even though I've always personally thought TMASG is a great game, at the end of the day it was just a pet project and so I was somewhat surprised when multiple YouTube videos started popping up showing people playing it. And not just playing it, but raving about it. The iPhone port has had similarly positive feedback and the version for Windows Phone 7 won first prize in Microsoft’s Windows Phone Application Development competition in South Africa, my home country and, incidentally, the source for all sheep sounds you might hear while playing it.

Here are just a few of the nice things some wonderful people have said about it.

Xbox:

"8/10: Extremely simple, yet awesome, innocent and challenging." - casuallyhardcore.com

Window Phone 7:

"★★★★★: Loved this on the Xbox, and it's even better with touch controls!" - homr

"★★★★★: The addicting part is quite accurate. I cannot put it down. Very entertaining and it does reward practice." - pty muscle oho

iOS:

"Simple to grasp, hard to master (★★★★★) One of the most enjoyable games I've played from the app store. Extra challenges (Infinity Bonus) and modes (Super Sheep Mode) keep you playing far past basic completion. Great game!" - pugsinkayaks

"Great rhythm app (★★★★★) This app is fantastic to help anyone learning/playing a musical instrument to develop a good sense of rhythm. Have recommended to my students to purchase." - bnapsbysandi

"Awesome and addicting! (★★★★★) Wow, this game is such fun and madly addicting!!! Nice tunes too!" - rvcdbn

"I am piano teacher and this was my students' favorite game. Please update this to be compatible with iOS 9! I would pay to buy it." - Mamainnj

The Unexpected Educative Aspect

I created The Most Addicting Sheep Game as a game. The rhythm aspect, whilst arguably the most important feature of the game, was part of just that: a game. I was therefore pleasantly surprised to see reviews popping up from music teachers and music schools around the world praising TMASG for its ability to teach rhythm to young music students without them even realizing it. When Apple released iOS 9 and the game crashed on iPhone and iPad devices, it was the music teachers who started posting on the game's Facebook page asking when the update was coming out and telling me that their kids were devastated to lose a favorite music app.

I am absolutely thrilled that TMASG can provide fun and enjoyment and serve a useful purpose at the same time. I would love to develop this further in the future. If you're a music teacher and have ideas or feedback, I'd love to hear from you.

Where Does the Money Go?

Your contribution will help keep TMASG alive by both ensuring its continued existence on iOS as well as funding the port to Android.

The funds from this campaign will be used primarily in two ways. Some of the funds that I raise from this campaign will help pay for my time spent on porting TMASG to Unity. Because I believe in the project, I will continue to work on it whether I am able to raise the funds or not, but being successful in the campaign will allow me to focus my time on completing the task quickly.

Secondly, an Android port has always somewhat scared me due to the vast number of devices that are available with greatly differing specs, both in terms of screen dimension and processor capability. Despite being a pet project, it is of utmost importance to me to release a product of exceptionally high quality. To do that, I need to test it, and to test it a lot. I would like to spend some of the funds raised on test devices and emulators.

Some Coding Challenges

First and foremost, TMASG is a rhythm game. Side-scrollers are a dime-a-dozen on virtually every platform and while I think TMASG stands on its own two feet as a side-scroller, it's the musical timing of the actions to the beat that really sets it apart. And it seems such a simple idea to me now after creating the game that I've spent a lot of time wondering why more developers haven't created more of them. One of the reasons: it's hard.

Getting the images, the game logic and the music to all sync up perfectly turns out to be a rather complex, albeit fascinating, problem. From a technical point of view the pieces of hardware responsible for drawing things to the screen and for playing a sound run on different clocks and even the slightest temporary lag in one of them has a catastrophic effect on the synchronization. Each platform (Xbox, iPhone, etc.) handles these elements slightly differently, so each new port of TMASG so far has required re-solving the problem.

A second interesting challenge for me is that of player controls. When I created the game for Xbox, the player pushed buttons on the Xbox controller to perform various jump and roll actions. In time to the beat, of course. It was fun and challenging to play. And pushing buttons in time to the music felt right. When I ported the game to iOS it was important to me that it didn't just feel like a console game ported to a touch screen. A good touch screen game makes use of the touch screen! There are no buttons on a touch screen and creating the illusion of them sometimes just feels wrong. It took a lot of time and experimentation to settle on "tap", "two finger tap" and "swipe" as the replacement controls for the three actions in TMASG. But with these controls, TMASG feels like it belongs on a touch screen: playing it feels right. In retrospect it seems like such an easy and obvious choice, but such an important one. I've seen countless great console games turned into very average touch screen games because the developers simply emulated the buttons on the screen.

These challenges; the problems that require solving along the path to developing a game, are one of two primary reasons I love to make them and will continue to do so. The second reason? You. The person who plays them. If you'd like to support me in my campaign to keep The Most Addicting Sheep Game alive and get it onto Android, I thank you. If you've played it on Xbox or iOS or WP7 and enjoyed it, I thank you even more. And if you've never played it, check it out!

The Most Important Closing Remark

Spread the beat. Tell your friends. Share the campaign on Facebook and Twitter and get The Most Addicting Sheep Game onto an Android near you.

But with these controls, TMASG feels like it belongs on a touch screen: playing it feels right. In retrospect it seems like such an easy and obvious choice, but such an important one. I've seen countless great console games turned into very average touch screen games because the developers simply emulated the buttons on the screen.
These challenges; the problems that require solving along the path to developing a game, are one of two primary reasons I love to make them and will continue to do so. The second reason? You. The person who plays them. If you'd like to support me in my campaign to keep The Most Addicting Sheep Game alive and get it onto Android, I thank you. If you've played it on Xbox or iOS or WP7 and enjoyed it, I thank you even more. And if you've never played it, check it out!
The Most Important Closing Remark
Spread the beat. Tell your friends. Share the campaign on Facebook and Twitter and get The Most Addicting Sheep Game onto an Android near you.

story:
Add a little Trump Cheer to your holidays! 

Political. Humorous. Elegant. 

These FIVE cards, featuring Donald Trump running for Santa Claus 2015, are everything you could want in a Christmas greeting. PLUS, bring Christmas back to your red coffee cup (or anything else) with our "official" Trump for Santa campaign stickers.

           

                    

                

                

               

So, what do you get? 

Lovingly hand-drawn images, made into high-quality, glossy cards. The cards are full color, front and back, include envelopes and a 'Trump for Santa' campaign sticker. 

Choose one card, or check everyone off your list and order a full set! Do you want direct delivery to your loved ones? Choose the "include a message" perk and we'll write a short message of your choice, and send the card right to their door. (Be sure to include THEIR address).

Risks & Challenges

These cards are finished and ready to ship-- just in time for Christmas. Please let us know which card(s) you would like, so we can get everyone's orders out QUICKLY.

Other Ways You Can Help

Check out Caitlyn Harris Illustration at www.facebook.com/caitlynharrisillustration

Thanks for your support!
