story:
Recurrence is the name of our first major title, a first and third person, supernatural survival MMO, set in a post-apocalyptic world!

The Story

There once was a time, thousands of years ago, where peace reigned across the land. The land, where humans and a collective of supernatural species known as ‘Circumspectors’ were selfless and compassionate, perhaps, even friends…

Together, they were controlled by an assembly of high ranking religious leaders known as ‘Druids’. Druids were notoriously renowned for their peaceful preaching and advice, although, it was rumoured that not all Druids fulfilled their destiny, and were ultimately exiled to a place darker than the fiery pit of hell itself. These few, were known only as ‘the fallen’. They were separated by a ‘living veil’, a filter, setup by the Druid high command, dividing the humans and Circumspectors from the fallen.

The fallen were vile and debauched. Life on the other side of the veil just further encouraged this ghastly regime with witchcraft and sorcery being practiced daily and was rapidly becoming ungovernable for the ruling Druids. Among all this chaos, there was a hopeful prospect. Archanus, a young son of the most powerful Druid of all. Archanus was a strong, intelligent child. He also had an extraordinary power. Archanus had the ability to foresee impending events, days before they happened. This special power meant Archanus was highly sought after, with the humans, Circumspectors and Druids all fighting for the young prodigy. The fighting was taking an overwhelming effect on him, until it all became too much. The combat drove Archanus insane and his father, under crushing pressure, had no choice but to exile his own son to the other side of the veil, to protect the gift inside his son. The news of Archanus’ exile rang across Earth and the fighting for Archanus’ gift ceased, shortly thereafter.

The veil controlled the fallen for many centuries, becoming a prison governed by the Druids, sentencing any supernatural creature found guilty of breaking the Druids strict religious rules. The veil was overpopulated and the fallen were rapidly forming a revolution which was vastly assisted by the discovery of Archanus. With no mental capability to defend himself, Archanus was turned to the side of the fallen. For the next four-hundred years, the fallen worked on a spell which allowed the two worlds to combine and the destruction of the veil. This horror was shortly lived.

That was then. 

This is now. 

At its peak, Recurrence was voted as the 91st most anticipated indie game!

Our inspiration for Recurrence was inspired by our collective want to see a truly epic, large-scale, supernatural survival MMO which encompasses realistic survival aspects such as the need for water, food, shelter, protection and transport to name a few.

Recurrence is huge... Our game is an open world which offers a vast environment which totals out at 386 km squared! That's roughly the distance that the International Space Station is from earth! 

Rendered in 4K Recurrence boasts high end, realistic looks and feel.

With features such as full weather cycles, day & night cycles and lifelike reflections, lighting and water effects that are comparable to current AAA titles.

Players have to survive in this boundless world filled with all kinds of supernatural enemies. including demons, vampires, werewolves and many more. Varying methods are required to vanquish different foes, with preparation and planning required to ensure your survival!

Players can choose to defend themselves against the array of powerful supernatural enemies or explore the expansive world in order to track and hunt the more powerful enemies in supernatural lore either alone, or as a team.

Account System:

All player login data is securely created from within PHP client, which is securely sent and stored on a server side SQL database.

Networking:

Server allocation is random but based on ping and server population with randomized player spawns across the entire map. We utilize Photon Unity Networking as our networking middleware and have ensured that our client server networking is at the highest scalability.

We will also implement an in game text chat system to allow players to connect with friends.

Player: 

Players will be in control of high quality, fully rigged, animated and textured character models. With a wide variety of characters being available for choice along with the choice of both first and third person views in game. 

Audio:  

The audio will be important in supporting the realistic feeling of suspension and fear in Recurrence, with detailed environmental sound effects such as footsteps and movement, ambient sound effects, voice overs and a high quality a full soundtrack, Recurrence will sound just as good as it feels to play.

Environment: 

Recurrence is host to a massive world that is currently 386km squared, filled with detailed foliage and architecture that truly brings it to life. Real life physics are present throughout along with a brilliant weather and time cycle.

Gameplay:

Recurrence is a game that will have you on the edge of your seat. Our game sets a suspense filled atmosphere fueled by a mix of PVP and PVE gameplay, a vast world filled with range of enemies, jump scares and realistic lighting flickers, among many other features.

We will include drone's in the game to allow players to plan ahead, use for reconnaissance and ensure they don't walk into a trap. Drones can be customized along with the characters. 

Characters can be customized by using items that they have crafted in the game or through the purchase/trading of items on the "black market" a player driven economy built to sustain the large scale in-game ecosystem.

Why Is Recurrence So Special? 

For us, Recurrence is our pride and joy, with years of planning and over a year of production, there are so many new and innovative features included with Recurrence that evolves the horror-survival genre to a never before seen level. Recurrence also takes on multiple RPG elements and many MMO elements including massively online gameplay, a constantly evolving world, and regular content updates which gives us the ability to learn new skills, explore a never before possible level of production and of course gives us the thrill of creating such a community driven game. Complex and Casual Gameplay: Recurrence aims to target both casual gamers and the more competitive players. Always getting better: Recurrence will never be a ‘finished game’ there will always be something new to enjoy, whether this is a new addition to the world or just a few new vehicles to collect.

The Future:

Recurrence will be continually updated for as long as possible. We have no intention to ever stop the development of Recurrence. We have many more ambitious and exciting ideas that when the time is right can be transported into the world for you to further enjoy your Recurrence experience. However, for the purpose of keeping the goals realistic we have listed only a few of the game’s core features above. With the support from you and the community we will ensure Recurrence continues to grow.

  • Providing a fun and engaging experience to our players.
  • Creative social and competitive gaming environment.
  • Fan based, open and transparent studio.
  • Put our players at the forefront of our decisions
  • Creating player driven in game economies

From the start, we knew what we wanted to do, we knew that we had the skills to achieve our goals and we knew that one of our main aims is to bring our game to life on a smaller scale budget whilst maintaining the highest level of quality.

So far we have self funded the entire project and given our time & dedication to its development. We want to make sure that we make the most of the pledges we receive, we want to stay true to our goals and we want to make sure that our players get the best experience possible. To do this we need a helping hand to complete Recurrence to the standard that it deserves. 

We have managed to develop an expansive, realistic world with great features and we mainly require the help to bring on our character modelling and rendering.

We appreciate all of the help we receive and we want to make sure that all of our backers know that they, along with our players, are at the front of our minds and we love you! 

We are all avid gamer's and with a little support, along with the experience of our team, we believe we can produce a final product that it is of exceptional quality.

 More Game Information

Q. What program / programming language is Recurrence made in?

A. Unity3D version 5.0 and is programmed in the JavaScript programming language

Q. What networking solution are you using?

A. Photon Server by Exit Games. Alongside a custom PHP back-end

Q. You say your game account system is secure? How so?

A. We use the latest in PHP security protocols, with our login system from within the client utilising AES data encryption, MD5 hashed passwords with built-in anti-SQL injection. Passwords are also hashed by unity and are in a secure hidden text field.

Q. How will you combat piracy?

A. Our account system uses an advanced PHP game versioning system which in out of date builds will block the user account from continuing. This results in the player having to download the newer versions small ‘patch’ from a legitimate store to regain access to Recurrence.

Q. How will your company respond to hack attacks?

A. We have full cloud flare protection on both our web and game servers defending us against most common sources of attack including DDOS or DOS attacks.

Q. How many players can you get on a server?

A. We have run successful network stress tests and saw successful results for upto 500 players on one single server instance.

Q. What are the minimum system requirements?

• CPU: Intel Pentium D or AMD Athlon 64 (K8) 2.6 GHz.

• RAM: 1GB. (2GB recommended)

• GPU (Integrated): Intel HD Graphics or AMD (formerly ATI) Radeon HD Graphics with OpenGL 2.1.

• GPU (Discrete): Nvidia GeForce 9600 GT or AMD Radeon HD 2400 with OpenGL 3.1.

• HDD: At least 200MB for Game Core and Other Files. • Internet Connection



Stretch Goals!

If we are lucky enough to reach a goal further than our expectations, we plan to reward our backers with exciting results.

£7,500 - Mobile app with cortanna support

£25,000 - Game competition with huge prize!!!

£50,000 - XBOX ONE Port

£100,000 - Extreme Supernatural Manhunt Party!!

We utilize Photon Unity Networking as our networking middleware and have ensured that our client server networking is at the highest scalability.We will also implement an in game text chat system to allow players to connect with friends.
Player: Players will be in control of high quality, fully rigged, animated and textured character models. With a wide variety of characters being available for choice along with the choice of both first and third person views in game. 
Audio:  The audio will be important in supporting the realistic feeling of suspension and fear in Recurrence, with detailed environmental sound effects such as footsteps and movement, ambient sound effects, voice overs and a high quality a full soundtrack, Recurrence will sound just as good as it feels to play.Environment: Recurrence is host to a massive world that is currently 386km squared, filled with detailed foliage and architecture that truly brings it to life. Real life physics are present throughout along with a brilliant weather and time cycle.Gameplay:Recurrence is a game that will have you on the edge of your seat. Our game sets a suspense filled atmosphere fueled by a mix of PVP and PVE gameplay, a vast world filled with range of enemies, jump scares and realistic lighting flickers, among many other features.We will include drone's in the game to allow players to plan ahead, use for reconnaissance and ensure they don't walk into a trap. Drones can be customized along with the characters. Characters can be customized by using items that they have crafted in the game or through the purchase/trading of items on the "black market" a player driven economy built to sustain the large scale in-game ecosystem.Why Is Recurrence So Special? For us, Recurrence is our pride and joy, with years of planning and over a year of production, there are so many new and innovative features included with Recurrence that evolves the horror-survival genre to a never before seen level. Recurrence also takes on multiple RPG elements and many MMO elements including massively online gameplay, a constantly evolving world, and regular content updates which gives us the ability to learn new skills, explore a never before possible level of production and of course gives us the thrill of creating such a community driven game. Complex and Casual Gameplay: Recurrence aims to target both casual gamers and the more competitive players. Always getting better: Recurrence will never be a ‘finished game’ there will always be something new to enjoy, whether this is a new addition to the world or just a few new vehicles to collect.The Future:Recurrence will be continually updated for as long as possible. We have no intention to ever stop the development of Recurrence. We have many more ambitious and exciting ideas that when the time is right can be transported into the world for you to further enjoy your Recurrence experience. However, for the purpose of keeping the goals realistic we have listed only a few of the game’s core features above. With the support from you and the community we will ensure Recurrence continues to grow. Providing a fun and engaging experience to our players.Creative social and competitive gaming environment.Fan based, open and transparent studio.Put our players at the forefront of our decisionsCreating player driven in game economies From the start, we knew what we wanted to do, we knew that we had the skills to achieve our goals and we knew that one of our main aims is to bring our game to life on a smaller scale budget whilst maintaining the highest level of quality.So far we have self funded the entire project and given our time & dedication to its development. We want to make sure that we make the most of the pledges we receive, we want to stay true to our goals and we want to make sure that our players get the best experience possible. To do this we need a helping hand to complete Recurrence to the standard that it deserves. We have managed to develop an expansive, realistic world with great features and we mainly require the help to bring on our character modelling and rendering.We appreciate all of the help we receive and we want to make sure that all of our backers know that they, along with our players, are at the front of our minds and we love you! We are all avid gamer's and with a little support, along with the experience of our team, we believe we can produce a final product that it is of exceptional quality.  More Game Information
Q. What program / programming language is Recurrence made in?A. Unity3D version 5.0 and is programmed in the JavaScript programming languageQ. What networking solution are you using?A. Photon Server by Exit Games. Alongside a custom PHP back-endQ. You say your game account system is secure? How so?A. We use the latest in PHP security protocols, with our login system from within the client utilising AES data encryption, MD5 hashed passwords with built-in anti-SQL injection. Passwords are also hashed by unity and are in a secure hidden text field.Q. How will you combat piracy?A. Our account system uses an advanced PHP game versioning system which in out of date builds will block the user account from continuing. This results in the player having to download the newer versions small ‘patch’ from a legitimate store to regain access to Recurrence.Q. How will your company respond to hack attacks?A. We have full cloud flare protection on both our web and game servers defending us against most common sources of attack including DDOS or DOS attacks.Q. How many players can you get on a server?A. We have run successful network stress tests and saw successful results for upto 500 players on one single server instance.Q. What are the minimum system requirements?•	CPU: Intel Pentium D or AMD Athlon 64 (K8) 2.6 GHz.•	RAM: 1GB. (2GB recommended)•	GPU (Integrated): Intel HD Graphics or AMD (formerly ATI) Radeon HD Graphics with OpenGL 2.1.•	GPU (Discrete): Nvidia GeForce 9600 GT or AMD Radeon HD 2400 with OpenGL 3.1.•	HDD: At least 200MB for Game Core and Other Files. •	Internet ConnectionStretch Goals!If we are lucky enough to reach a goal further than our expectations, we plan to reward our backers with exciting results.£7,500 - Mobile app with cortanna support£25,000 - Game competition with huge prize!!!£50,000 - XBOX ONE Port£100,000 - Extreme Supernatural Manhunt Party!!

story:
(italian version at the end)

Hi,  we are an italian company based in Milan and Catania (SaturnLab), we are developers and graphic designers, and our main dev, Ricardo Antonio Piana, created (almost 12 years ago, and still active!!) Wardrome, a text-based browser game. 

Now, we decided to give Wardrome a new life, developing something new, something old (and something blue maybe!), and we need your help.

Wardrome 3.0 will be a 3D adventure MMORPG within a galaxy of 400,000 stars that can hold tens of thousands players simultaneously. It will be available in English, Deutsch, Italian, French, Spanish, Portugues and Dutch.

The game will be released in any case (and the perks accomplished) and the goal is to be ready with the open beta by the end of July 2015.
Some game's scenarios will be simplified in the first period and subsequently fully implemented.

It will be played through a browser WebGL compatible and with any mobile device supporting the same technology. Apps will also be developed for the most common devices. Everything will be free to play with the possibility to buy benefits with a coin called "Gold".

Players will be able to fight, dig, trade, do missions in space and in the atmosphere, colonize planets, live adventures with their personal character, interact with others.
Here is a list of same game scenarios:

In Space
Players aboard their customizable spaceship can:

- fight
- trade between planets spaceports for goods needed by other players
- dig in asteroids or in the solar crowns to find needed materials
- recover goods scattered in space thanks to tractor beam
- explore the solar system  jumping from one planet to another in minimal time with the warp jump
- explore all the galaxy through a wormhole system
- escort missions
- carry goods and people
- recovery missions 
- hunting pirates or aliens
- speed races with other system's commanders
- treasure hunt with other system's commanders
- missions to clean space orbiting debris
- cooperation with other players in the system to improve the common facilities (capacity and level of spaceport's technology, wormhole generator's efficiency)

Spaceport
After approaching at a spaceport you will be able to:

- participate in auctions to get power-ups, weapons, goods, equipment and different spaceships
- rent research laboratories to produce UTEC (research points) to be used for improvements of ships and structures
- hiring crew members based on the available capacity of the ship
- trade goods
- receive missions to accomplish in space, both automated and made up by other players
- train with other players in combat  in the armory
- explore the rooms of the spaceport, making espionage missions, investigation, even fighting in Quake style
- access information of the galactic encyclopedia
- win upgrades, money, Gold at the spaceport's lottery

Wormhole generator
Allows you to:

- Cross the galaxy moving in the branches leading to the neighboring systems in minimal time
- Improve the generator to make it lead systems at a lower cost- Improve the capacity of the generator to reach more distants stars

Planets
It will be possible:

- Create colonies on the planets, with buildings such as laboratory research, housing, spaceport, planetary defenses etc.
- Land in the colonies of others players to trade- Fighting in atmosphere- Explore with the character  the buildings, make quests, PvP battles.- Races between spacecraft in atmosphere

The characters will have their own cash of credits, research points called UTEC, and a special coin game called Gold that you can obtain paying or completing special missions.

The game will be initially implemented by simplifying some of the scenarios described or leaving them on hold and gradually making them 100% working. 

The new deployments will be indicated to the players through a history of galaxy evolution.

The ships in the first phase of game development will be:

The Maasym will be the starting ship.

Spaceships move, shoot, and defend through the cells of energy that can be charged at fee of credits in spaceports, periodically through a building on planetary colonies, with the sun in space (nearer it is, better it charges)

Players will normally start from neutral faction: attacking a representative of the neutral faction makes hostile all other factions to a certain percentage, attacking another faction makes hostile only that faction. The player of the neutral faction will evolve in the galaxy and will be able to choose one of the factions to belong to after a training period in the game, and then he can change it if it has reached the requirements for a different faction.
The factions are:

- Neutral (red livery) for beginners
- Mining (magenta livery) for players who digged more raw materials
- Traders (green livery) for players who traded more goods
- Military (blue livery) for players who have made more attacks
- ELITE (yellow livery) for players who excels above all factions members. The ELITE faction will have a limited number of players and the last will be expelled  and sent back to neutral based due to the results of a monthly ranking.

The Golds allow the following functions:

- Purchase of additional lottery tickets at the spaceport (you can win credits, ship upgrades, UTEC, etc. Every day the system assigns one free lottery ticket) 25Gold
- Charging energy of the ship "on the fly" in difficult situations (1gold for each cell to recharge)- Immediate construction of buildings in the colonies (depending on the time remaining for the construction)-Bet at an auction before it starts (25 gold)



VERSIONE ITALIANA

Ciao, siamo una società italiana su Milano e Catania (SaturnLab), siamo grafici e sviluppatori, e il nostro "main dev", Ricardo Antonio Piana, ha creato (quasi 12 anni fa, ed è ancora attivo!!) Wardrome, un browser game testuale.

Abbiamo deciso di dare a Wardrome nuova vita, sviluppando qualcosa di nuovo, qualcosa di vecchio (e magari qualcosa di blu!) e abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto.

Wardrome 3.0 in 3D sarà una avventura MMORPG all’interno di una galassia di 400.000 stelle che potrà ospitare decine di migliaia di giocatori contemporaneamente. Sarà disponibile in Italiano, Inglese, Francese, Tedesco, Spagnolo, Portoghese e Olandese.

Il gioco sarà rilasciato comunque (e i perk consegnati) e l’obiettivo è di essere pronti con la open beta entro la fine di luglio 2015.
Alcune parti del gioco saranno semplificate nel primo periodo e implementate successivamente.

Si giocherà attraverso un browser compatibile con le WebGL e con qualsiasi dispositivo mobile che supporti la stessa tecnologia. Saranno anche sviluppate app per i dispositivi più comuni. Tutto sarà free to play con possibilità di acquistare benefit in gioco tramite una moneta chiamata “Gold”.





Il gioco consentirà di combattere, scavare, commerciare, effettuare missioni, sia nello spazio che nell’atmosfera, colonizzare pianeti, creare avventure personali col proprio personaggio, interagire con gli altri. 

Ecco un elenco degli scenari di gioco:

Spazio aperto
Qui a bordo della propria astronave personalizzabile si potrà:

- combattere
- commerciare tra spazioporti e pianeti i beni necessari  agli altri player
- scavare negli asteroidi e nelle corone solari per ottenere i materiali necessari
- recuperare merci disperse nello spazio col raggio traente
- esplorare il sistema solare di cui si fa parte saltando da un pianeta all’altro in tempi minimi con il salto warp
- esplorare la galassia attraverso un sistema di Wormhole
- missioni di scorta
- missioni di posta
- missioni di recupero merci o persone
- caccia a pirati o alieni
- gare di velocità con altri comandanti del sistema
- gare di recupero oggetti con altri comandanti del sistema
- missioni di pulizia rifiuti spaziali
- cooperazione con gli altri player del sistema per migliorare le strutture comuni (capienza e livello di tecnologia dello spazioporto, efficienza del generatore di Wormhole)

Spazioporto
Una volta approdati ad uno spazioporto sarà possibile:

- partecipare ad aste per ottenere potenziamenti, armi, merci, dispositivi e astronavi differenti
- noleggiare laboratori di ricerca per produrre UTEC (punti ricerca) da utilizzare per migliorare navi e strutture.
- assumere membri dell’equipaggio in base alla capienza della nave a disposizione.
- compravendita di merci all’emporio dello spazioporto.
- compravendita di merci contrattando con altri personaggi nei locali comuni dello spazioporto.
- andare al bar dello spazioporto per ricevere missioni da compiere nello spazio, sia automatizzate che inventate da altri giocatori.
- allenarsi con altri giocatori nel combattimento con laser e corpo a corpo nella sala d’armi.
- esplorare le sale dello spazioporto, compiendo missioni di spionaggio, investigazione, anche con combattimenti in stile Quake.
- accedere alle informazioni dell’enciclopedia galattica.
- vincere potenziamenti, denaro, Gold alla lotteria dello spazioporto.

Generatore di Wormhole
Permetterà di:
- attraversare la galassia passando nei rami che conducono ai sistemi vicini in tempi minimi
- migliorare il generatore in modo che conduca nei sistemi a costi minori
- migliorare la portata del generatore 


Pianeti
Sarà possibile:
- creare colonie sui pianeti, con costruzioni quali laboratorio di ricerca, alloggi, spazioporto di terra, difese planetarie etc.
- atterrare in colonie altrui per scambi commerciali
- combattimenti in atmosfera
- esplorazione col personaggio degli edifici, missioni, combattimenti pvp.
- gare tra astronavi in atmosfera

I personaggi avranno una propria cassa divisa in crediti, punti ricerca chiamati UTEC, e una moneta speciale di gioco chiamata Gold che sarà possibile ottenere con acquisto in-app o svolgendo missioni particolari.
Il gioco verrà implementato inizialmente semplificando alcuni degli scenari descritti o lasciandoli in sospeso e via via rendendoli completi al 100%. 
Le nuove implementazioni verranno segnalate ai giocatori attraverso una storia della galassia in evoluzione.

Le astronavi della prima fase di sviluppo in gioco saranno le seguenti:



La Maasym sarà la nave iniziale.



Le astronavi si spostano, sparano e difendono grazie a delle celle di energia che possono essere ricaricate mediante crediti negli spazioporti, periodicamente tramite un edificio sulle colonie planetarie o col sole nello spazio (più è vicino e più veloce è il caricamento).

I giocatori iniziano normalmente dalla fazione neutrale: attaccare un rappresentante della fazione neutrale inimica tutte le altre fazioni di una certa percentuale, attaccare una fazione inimica solo quella fazione. Il giocatore della fazione neutrale potrà a seconda del suo operato nella galassia, scegliere una delle fazioni a cui appartenere dopo un certo periodo di training in gioco e successivamente cambiarla se ha raggiunto i requisiti per una fazione diversa.
Le fazioni sono:

- neutrale (livrea rossa) per i principianti
- mineraria (livrea magenta) per i giocatori che hanno -scavato più materie prime
- commerciale (livrea verde) per i giocatori che hanno scambiato più merci
- militare (livrea blu) per i giocatori che hanno compiuto più attacchi
- ELITE (livrea gialla) per i giocatori che si sono elevati sopra tutte le fazioni precedenti eccellendo in tutto. La fazione ELITE avrà un numero limitato di giocatori e gli ultimi verranno espulsi e retrocessi alla neutrale in base ai risultati di una classifica mensile.

I Gold consentiranno le seguenti funzioni:

- acquisto di biglietti addizionali della lotteria presso lo spazioporto (si possono vincere crediti, potenziamenti navali, UTEC, etc. Ogni giorno il sistema ne assegna uno gratuitamente ( 25gold)
- ricarica dell’energia della nave “al volo” in situazioni difficili, (1gold per ogni cella da ricaricare)
- costruzione immediata di edifici nelle colonie (dipendente dal tempo restante per la costruzione)
- offerta ad un asta prima che inizi (25 gold)

Il giocatore della fazione neutrale potrà a seconda del suo operato nella galassia, scegliere una delle fazioni a cui appartenere dopo un certo periodo di training in gioco e successivamente cambiarla se ha raggiunto i requisiti per una fazione diversa. Le fazioni sono:- neutrale (livrea rossa) per i principianti- mineraria (livrea magenta) per i giocatori che hanno -scavato più materie prime- commerciale (livrea verde) per i giocatori che hanno scambiato più merci- militare (livrea blu) per i giocatori che hanno compiuto più attacchi- ELITE (livrea gialla) per i giocatori che si sono elevati sopra tutte le fazioni precedenti eccellendo in tutto. La fazione ELITE avrà un numero limitato di giocatori e gli ultimi verranno espulsi e retrocessi alla neutrale in base ai risultati di una classifica mensile.I Gold consentiranno le seguenti funzioni:- acquisto di biglietti addizionali della lotteria presso lo spazioporto (si possono vincere crediti, potenziamenti navali, UTEC, etc. Ogni giorno il sistema ne assegna uno gratuitamente ( 25gold)- ricarica dell’energia della nave “al volo” in situazioni difficili, (1gold per ogni cella da ricaricare)- costruzione immediata di edifici nelle colonie (dipendente dal tempo restante per la costruzione)- offerta ad un asta prima che inizi (25 gold)

story:
Short Summary

 You have arrived too late. The attack has already wiped out every human on earth. Now it's up to you and your team to rebuild civilization. Explore and survive on an empty planet with your team. Build shelter, scavenge the city, climb mountains, the possibilities are endless. Do whatever you want in this post-apocalyptic world.

The Ground Division aims to give a realistic and enjoyable survival experience that can be shared with friends in the Co-op mode, or you can test your skills alone in the wilderness and be the sole survivor of the attack if you choose. Combining photo-realistic graphics, complex and immersive gameplay systems, and support for various VR platforms we can achieve the most realistic and immersive survival experience yet. While these systems are complex and immersive, we have made them as user friendly as possible so just about anyone can be fully immersed in The Ground Division without worry of complex systems and interfaces.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding mainly to expand our team to include Environment Artists, Networking Programmers, Gameplay Programmers and hopefully more developers to make this project great. Currently, the project is under development by a single dev, but with your support and funding we can hire more devs onto the team to help speed up development.

What's in it for you? We want to get the community as involved with the development of this project as possible, that's why we are giving all our backers immediate access to early alpha test at the conclusion of this campaign so we can get your reactions and feedback as early on in development as possible. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to get additional perks such as naming buildings in-game and digital wallpapers and the soundtrack to the game depending on what perks you select.

What if we don't reach our funding goal? This project is important to us and we will make sure to do as much with whatever we get to continue to make this project great and get it into your hands.

The Impact

With your support, we can make this project not only a reality, but we can make this great and make this the game we have all been waiting for.

We have all been waiting for the perfect open-world survival game, while I can't guarantee this will be perfect, we will put the work in and make it as close to perfect as we can.

Risks & Challenges

As you may have seen before with projects of this scale in early development, there is a very real possibility of failure. However, we are confident in our ability and believe we have demonstrated our dedication and skill to this project to make The Ground Division a reality. With your support, we are certain we can finish this project and get it into your hands.

To maintain your trust and support, we have decided to give the community a larger role in development than most projects like this. We are doing this by making the early alpha builds of the project available to supporters at the end of this campaign for immediate reactions and feedback so we can continue to build a game that you, the community, want to play. Not only that, but we will also continue to put out monthly development vlogs showing off the current development progress.

Lastly, we will never delete comments or silence the voices of our community. The core of this project is community-driven and we never want to take that away from you. Not only do we want to use these platforms to communicate updates on development, but most importantly we want to be sure your voice is always heard.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't, or aren't yet comfortable backing this project, please share this project as it will really help us continue working on it!

story:
Short Summary

I'm a 12 year old boy, living in Fareham, England.  I'm interested in coding, and retro-gaming (especially the tycoon games of the 90s).   I am looking to raise the money to create my dream game, Rail-Roads!.

The Game

The Idea is to create a tycoon game, based on the ones of the 90s, (Like Transport Tycoon). Rail-Roads! will be a calm and soothing game, all about trying to create your own rail system, and spread for miles on end.  Start with a lumberjack, hire a miner, construct your first track. The tech tree helps to advance and grow, creating quicker trains and better resourcing. Thank you. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!  Word of mouth will really help this grow!

story:
A Quick Note: Everything on this page is from the pre-alpha version of the game. The screenshots have been taken over the course of a few months of development so some more look different to others. It may or may not change and the game may look graphically different as development continues.

What is Labyrinthine?

Labyrinthine is a horror game that can be played solo or co-operatively online that may just make you never want to enter a hedge maze again. As you navigate the dark corridors, you will be faced with puzzles, scares and Horrifying monsters with unique AI's designed to hunt you down.

Together with up to 4 players online (or even alone if you're feeling brave!) you must solve the mystery of the happisburg hedge maze while escaping the clutches of the denizens within.

As multiplayer fans and horror fanatics, we noticed a bitter lack of cooperative horror titles out there. Being fairly well versed in the market, it appears that a lot of the games that do allow for cooperative horror are gimicky and lack any real depth/immersion. Many are seemingly from indie studios that don't really focus on producing a creepy atmosphere and focus more on cheap jumpscares. We want to change that. We have made it our goal to build a worthy title to appease those longing for something new and exciting.

Labyrinthine is our answer to a severely lacking genre and we have done extensive research and learning into what makes people feel uneasy, scared and downright terrified. There's an emphasis on the emotion of terror over horror (see Horror vs Terror) as we feel it creates a more memorable fear. Teamplay is encouraged as we have built the game from the ground up as a co-op centric game.

Before We Continue, Make Sure To Visit These Links:

Joining our discord is a great way to watch development and interract with the developers directly. We post updates, answer questions and take suggestions. We would really appreciate you joining us, even if you mute the server and only check it now and then!

Make sure to wishlist us on steam! It costs you nothing, is only a single click and helps us out massively. Steam recommends unreleased games based on their wishlist count so every one matters!

 

 

Gameplay within Labyrinthine can be broken down into several smaller gameplay loops.

Searching

At certain sections of the game, you will be tasked with finding items to progress. This will involve good navigation skills as the item spawnpoints will often be randomised and the hedges can disorientate you. Having an organised party will help make these sections much easier to handle!

Puzzles

Puzzles play a large role in the game. You will be presented with various puzzles that hinder progress until completed. Don't worry if you're not a fantastic puzzle solver, while some will test your perception, none of them are too difficult to decipher for the average person. Again, teamplay is promoted as more minds on the puzzle will solve it quicker.

Fleeing

You are not alone in the maze. Various monstrosities are active within it's walls and they aren't going to take your presence positively. You will have to run, hide and use other tactics to escape from the horrors that pursue you.

Teamwork

 As mentioned, our game has been built from the ground up with teamplay in mind. We want to promote teamplay as much as possible while still maintaining a solo-available experience. You will have access to items that help teams organise themselves and find each other. These include Glowsticks, a Compass and more.

Story / Lorefinding

Labyrinthine has a full set of lore built behind the scenes that explains the who, what, why when and where. We aim to make this discoverable by piecing together various bits of in-game lore. From audio tapes to notes; The story hunter can find the truth behind the happisburg hedge maze!

 

 

The environment in Labyrinthine is key to creating a truly unnerving atmosphere. We have put a lot of effort into creating an atmospheric darkness which leaves you feeling disconnected and subdued. 

To keep everything feeling flush and immersive, nearly all of our major assets are created in-house. You may be surprised to hear that the environment in Labyrinthine isn't all just hedges either! We realise that too much of the same thing is unstimulating, so we have worked hard on changing things up within the maze. You will have the chance to visit various environments within the confines of the maze, including indoor locations, underground and a forest...

Environment scares will also play a large part in-game. We have a plethora of scares hidden around the maze which can often be chance-based so going down the same path twice can have very different results! Testing and our pre-alpha demo have shown the scare placements to be very effective and we intend to build upon them! 

The Hedge Maze at ol Jonny Honk’s Fair has been there as long as anyone  can remember, but it's never been open. The rumor is, a kid named  Charles got lost in it, went in and never came out. When a cop went in  after them they went missing as well. No one’s entirely sure, but the  locals tend to keep away from it claiming it to be a curse upon the land. The maze lives right on the edge of the Local Fairgrounds, and this year, they are hoping to open it up as an attraction.

Built on the land of Ethel Fir, a twice widowed woman who died in 1935 leaving no will and no heir. It's said the maze was a  crazed project she had worked away at for years before her death. She had fervently planted and shaped the trees muttering about looky loos and nosey brats as it grew bigger each year, surrounding her house and  grounds, and slowly growing taller and taller. After nearly 8 years without anyone seeing her, the local authorities assumed her dead, and  entered the maze. They found her home in a state of disrepair, food  clearly long rotten, and it appeared no one had lived in it for quite a  long time. They searched the home, and what they could of the maze  itself, but failed to find her body or any information regarding her  death. Without a will in place, her property was left to the state, and  turned into a local park, open to the fair when it visited town. It's  said that from time to time kids will wander in on a dare, or couples  will enter trying to find old Ethel's home as a quiet place to be together. Often they come out safe and sound, if a little excitable, but the town has always had a higher than normal rate of missing persons. No one has ever been found in the maze. In the light of day it's simply an overgrown hedge, and a dilapidated home from the late 1800s. This  year the maze has been designated as an attraction and the Fair needs some help setting up after previous employees have either quit or disappeared...

 

Valko Game Studios is an independent game development company formed in the UK. At the time of writing, we have a team of seven core people from all over the world plus a few additional helpers.

Zach Dankowycz [UK] - Zach is the lead developer and the one who handles most of the background stuff, like setting up kickstarter. He has been developing games from a young age and is credited on several large and successful games. The majority of the code for Labyrinthine has been done by him.

Lonnie Ralfs [Canada] - Lonnie is the Lead artist and the one who creates nearly all of the organic assets such as the characters and monsters. He is a professional 3D artist with a history of making games and art. He is a huge (HUGE) blender advocate.

Cindy Tanguay [Canada] - Cindy is a versatile artist who handles both organics and hard surface. She has done some of the bigger environment props such as the gate and cryptex foundation. She is currently finishing up her degree in 3D Art. She is a potential crazy cat lady...!

Dave Watts [UK] - Dave is our resident hard surface artist. He creates a lot of the small and medium size props in game. Dave is our most recent team member but has fit in well. He has worked on numerous indie titles in the past and is a fan of the PSX-style that has recently been revived.

Julian Shields [UK] - Julian is our composer and audio technician. He has worked alongside Zach on numerous projects and was around for the creation of Valko. Julian has created nearly all of the music in game and has also provided the majority of the sound effects. Aside from music composing, he is also an avid chemist and holds a degree in Chemistry.

Tim Webb [Canada] - Tim is our social manager, discord users will likely know him as Quack. Tim joined us to help manage requests and questions from the community. He is a streamer-turned-manager who has worked with a lot of stream groups and gaming communities to revamp their socials. He is quite fond of ducks!

 Jonny Ro [USA] - Jonny is our artist, voice actor and motivator. He is the youngest of the team and initially had only joined to help build his portfolio for university. Since then, he has become a valued team member and provides lots of laughs during meetings.

Additionals ------------------

Luke Dooley [Australia] - Luke joined to provide development of graphics and optimiziation when his time allowed. He is a former employee for a few large names in game development such as Procedural Worlds. He had previously worked with Zach on another project where they had become friends.

Geoff Gollmer [Canada] - Geoff is a long-term friend of Lonnie and a Software Engineer Manager for a well established game company. Geoff is more of a consultant and provides us with innovative ideas from story pieces to in-game systems.

The main reason to fund us, is of course, that you love the idea behind the project and game. By funding us, you are directly helping development of the game and it may only cost you the price of a big mac!

Labyrinthine has been in considerable development for a little over 12 months now. We are a very open, close-knit team. We have made a huge amount of progress from how it looked 12 months ago to now:

12 months ago~

~9 months ago

1 month ago:

 

While we have made significant progress, we know we can do so much more!

As this is our first project as a team, we are having to finance it ourselves. That also means that we unfortunately have to work around our day jobs. With a successful kickstarter, we will be able to work full time on the project and purchase additional assets where required. This will speed up development and allow us to add more features into the game!

We are developing into a neglected genre, one that provides tons of laughs, scares and countless hours of youtube content, yet rarely sees any worthy releases. We made it clear earlier in the post that we have come to release a game that will satiate the hunger for a cooperative horror title and help bring a fresh perspective to the genre.

Even if you yourself do not enjoy horror games, it can be a great chance to enjoy someone else's suffering. We discovered during closed-testing that watching people play the game is absolutely hilarious and we looked forward to each play test for this very reason!

We have listened to everyone's feedback during playtests and our steam festival demo and have consistently made changes to improve. We listen and we adapt to what our players want. 

We are a community-driven studio. We want to make games people will enjoy and we aim to build a positive image that resonates in our community. We have big plans for future titles and supporting us during our early days is the best way to help them come to light.

Our goals are based around getting the game out, we aren't asking for more than what we need!

Join our discord using the links at the top and come chat with us if you are still unsure of whether we are worth funding; You will quickly see we are all very down to earth people!

Where Will My Funding Go?

We have no publisher, no investors and company equity is held solely by us. What does that mean? It means all of the funding will go directly to the costs of developing the game. Whether that's covering time as a freelancer, implementing new features or purchasing assets, the funding is all directly linked to developing or promoting the game. We don't do shady business, we just make games!

What Do I Get From Funding?

As you know the rewards are on the right and most of them are pretty self-explanatory but we felt it would be worth talking about what you, as a funder, actually get. 

First off, let's be clear, the gratitude part is genuine. We appreciate every last person who helps fund in our project. For some people it may not mean much and they just want a copy of the game, for others it's a symbol of faith in us. We don't know who is who, so we must assume it's faith for everyone and do our best to deliver. By Funding us, you are telling us "I want this!" and we are replying "Say no more!".

The digital developer diary. This item will be an ebook (PDF) that contains snippets of development from the start all the way through to release. It will include random comments on the discord, screenshots of drawings, work in progress art etc and will be aimed at giving you a behind the scenes look into what we do in the private development.

The private dev stream. From time to time, we plan on hosting developer streams where backers of that level can pop in, watch production and chat with the devs there. The direct contact nature of these streams are why they are included at such a high level.

We discovered during closed-testing that watching people play the game is absolutely hilarious and we looked forward to each play test for this very reason!We have listened to everyone's feedback during playtests and our steam festival demo and have consistently made changes to improve. We listen and we adapt to what our players want. We are a community-driven studio. We want to make games people will enjoy and we aim to build a positive image that resonates in our community. We have big plans for future titles and supporting us during our early days is the best way to help them come to light.Our goals are based around getting the game out, we aren't asking for more than what we need!Join our discord using the links at the top and come chat with us if you are still unsure of whether we are worth funding; You will quickly see we are all very down to earth people!Where Will My Funding Go?We have no publisher, no investors and company equity is held solely by us. What does that mean? It means all of the funding will go directly to the costs of developing the game. Whether that's covering time as a freelancer, implementing new features or purchasing assets, the funding is all directly linked to developing or promoting the game. We don't do shady business, we just make games!What Do I Get From Funding?As you know the rewards are on the right and most of them are pretty self-explanatory but we felt it would be worth talking about what you, as a funder, actually get. First off, let's be clear, the gratitude part is genuine. We appreciate every last person who helps fund in our project. For some people it may not mean much and they just want a copy of the game, for others it's a symbol of faith in us. We don't know who is who, so we must assume it's faith for everyone and do our best to deliver. By Funding us, you are telling us "I want this!" and we are replying "Say no more!".The digital developer diary. This item will be an ebook (PDF) that contains snippets of development from the start all the way through to release. It will include random comments on the discord, screenshots of drawings, work in progress art etc and will be aimed at giving you a behind the scenes look into what we do in the private development.The private dev stream. From time to time, we plan on hosting developer streams where backers of that level can pop in, watch production and chat with the devs there. The direct contact nature of these streams are why they are included at such a high level.

story:
About the Project

flirtStack is about ‘hitting on’ someone, and most of the time someone not of your choice!

‘Flirting is FUN!  And we all know flirting takes place in almost every situation… between friends, co-workers, or even total strangers.  Many times it’s the mechanism that increases the bond between two people.  For instance, when two people start dating they flirt with one another all the time to express their interest. Not only is this natural, but it is fun & it is what attracts you to that person in the first few moments.  Welcome to flirtStack, an adult card game for 4-12 people that brings everyone together for fun, laughter & excitement! 

flirtStack is a combination of social networking and traditional card games - all wrapped up in a single package!

This game was designed (to cater to both techno geeks and old fashioned card/and/or board-gamers) because we felt the need to increase social activity without total loss of mobile interaction!  The social aspect is still there, & so is the technology interface, and besides that, a social network specifically designed for flirters!  The QR code below takes you directly to flirtStack Home, so why wait!  SCAN the code, SIGN UP & START FLIRTING today!   


flirtStack is all about taking a chance!

If your choice is to play the extended social network interface version (Mobile Net Version), thereby incorporating the internet extension, your mobile phone becomes an important part of the game as there are rules in the game that allow for you to follow a QR coded link to the flirtStack website where you will  'Take a Chance' & ‘Roll the Dice”!  This game is made to be played anywhere where you may or may not have mobile reception. However, where you do have mobile reception, do play the extended social network interface version, as it adds an added dimension of fun and laughter!


flirtStack is all about selfies - groupie & individual!

flirtStack.com not only allows an added dimension where flirters are in accordance to the rules able to “Roll the Dice” and either win big in game related stakes (that is in number of cards gained), or lose big, dependent on the fall of the dice, it also provides you and your Team with a complete ‘Flirting’ social network where your team can create a group - either private or public - and where you could boast your skills as ‘Master of Flirt’ by initially being recognized by your Team in the ‘Gallery’, and later, if you are really, really good at ‘Flirting’, by flirtStack in the ‘Wall of Fame’. Or join in an individual capacity and let the flirting begin. flirtStack after all, is about ‘Flirting’, and this social website allows for flirters all over the world to unite, and to ‘Flirt’ of course! 

The template of card/s below is a sample only & is not a complete stack.

what we need to be successful in flirtStack!

  • If less than $10,000 is raised but more than $6000, the flirtStack basepack will be produced.

  • If $10, 000 is raised a limited number of flirtStack box sets will be made for eligible contributors to the campaign (This will include the Mobile Extension Version which also includes the flirtStack social network website and one ‘Roll the Dice” QR code URL).

  • If > 13,000 is raised the flirtStack social website mobile extension version will be extended to include more interactive mechanisms i.e. spin a wheel/solve a riddle/spin the bottle/answer a Trivia question.

  • If > $15,000 raised an extension pack X-rated flirtStack set of 136 FLIRT cards will be produced.

  • The template of card/s below is a sample only & is not a complete stack.



How to play

  • LoveNest is placed in center of table

  •  Shuffle the cards

  • The cards are placed downwards facing next to LoveNest in x2 stacks  - FLIRT stack & FLIRT COMEBACK stack

  • Play starts with one person selecting a FLIRT card & depending on who they have to ‘flirt’ with, that person takes the top  FLIRT COMEBACK card & places it in front of them face down.  The Flirter then reads out their FLIRT & then awaits their FLIRT COMEBACK to be read to them. (Your flirt is randomly directed to the person indicated by seating in relation to you as per the FLIRT card).  Play continues with the Flirted person then becoming the FLIRT & so on...

  • Sound boring?  Wait until you have to direct a flirt to your best buddy with something like 'I love chocolate, especially when it is poured all over you!'

  • Game ends when no card in the middle to respond to FLIRT or your sides are hurting from too much laughter!

  • Winner is the person with the most cards in their stack, or maybe if you play the Mobile Web Version, winner could be announced during this play!

  • Extended Version: Mobile Web Version – if you opt to play using your mobile, the QR code is on the cards for you to scan & be taken directly to the URL (where you may spin a wheel/roll a dice/solve a riddle/spin the bottle etc. etc.; which could make you a bigger loser (by taking more cards away from you) or a bigger winner (by doubling the number of cards you have or crown you as the ‘Master Flirter’ there and then).  You will have a choice when you play your game, you can ignore or play the mobile web version - URL on selected cards

  • For a complete listing of the Rules, click here!

  • Initially only ‘Roll a Dice’ will be available in Extended Version, however, if we oversubscribe on your kind upfront support, meaning we have much more money in the kitty than originally asked for - we may expedite the additions of other fun components

Risks & Challenges

The Risk: being embarrassed by the flirtatious nature of this game!

If you choose the X-rated extension version available more embarrassing moments!

If less than $6,000 is raised the project may not go ahead-we will assess the situation at the time. Obviously we do not wish for this to happen ‘EVER’, so do share with all your friends on every social network so we get the word out there and jointly make this project a success!

Anticipated delivery date of all perks will be March 2015 - Provided we meet our goal!

What is Flirting?

The definition of flirting according to Wikipedia – ‘is a social and sometimes sexual activity involving verbal or written communication as well as body language by one person to another.  Flirting usually involves speaking and behaving… within the rules of social etiquette.  This can be accomplished by communicating a sense of playfulness or irony.’

Why Not?

So why not break the ice, gather some single & married friends, or what a great way to meet your neighbors! Bring out the LoveNest & play flirtStack!  You can play it while hanging at the bar, at the next friend/family BBQ/birthday party or create your own occasion! 

Let the Flirting BEGIN!


Our flirtStack Shop has some great products-check it out by clicking here: SHOP NOW


Referral Program:

Help us spread the word about flirtStack the flirting fun card game by email and social media. Earn a free flirtStack basepack (LoveNest) for every 6 or more friends who buy a flirtStack LoveNest or higher perk through our IndieGogo Campaign. You have to follow the instructions in the image below to be taken into account for the referral program and you must be a contributor yourself to the campaign. Once the campaign is over all earned credits will be applied to your account. you cannot refer yourself.  The contributor must be named by the referred purchaser at the time of purchase-this is very important or you will not receive credit. Also if you are not signed into your IndieGogo account or do not follow the instructions in the picture below you will not appear in or records as a referrer.

story:
Hang on to your stuff and get ready for Cops and Thugs.. at Night! Our first Videogame for mobile devices. 

Navigate your way as a thief and steal as much stuff in the dark. Whatever you do mind the walls, furniture and especially the cops. There's more than 100 various stages all set to test your memory and dexterity. Are you the king of thieves?

Cops & Thugs.. At night! Is the first release by HiveStudio.

Born in beautiful Barcelona we are two associates with more than 8 years experience working abroad in different places such as Spain, France, USA and Canada as Computer Science Engineers specialized in Mobile Development since 2010. 

We are passionate about videogames since childhood. Since we started working on Mobile Apps we wanted to work on a videogame someday.

Finally we came up with this idea of gameplay two years ago and we started working since then in our spare time. Now we believe it’s time to give it a final push as we strive to create a professional videogame that everyone can enjoy.

Albert Castro

I really love Canada but I have to say it gets quite cold during the winter, but hey! Being stuck at home for 6 months a year also means you have plenty of time to dedicate to indoors hobbies, such as programming. I loved working on this project. I learnt a lot about videogame development as well as level design and even working on the graphics.

Damia Ferrer

I’m luckier than Albert so I can see the sunshine everyday in hot California. I’m passionate about robotics as well as mobile programming. Working in this game it’s been inspiring as I have been able to learn a lot about game level design, programming, etc.

Saoud Belshalat

I have been a gamer for as long as i can remember. I come from one of the most successful cities in the world, Dubai. I am passionate about being successful in anything I do. I work in a telecommunication company, I am the founder and board member of the UAE rugby federation. Surprisingly, I still have so much spare time. My role here is to help promote this amazing game with Albert and Damia through marketing, and also to introduce a new addictive, yet fun, game to the world.

We need your help in order to polish the game up and create the best user experience. We want to take it to the next level and make the game as fun as possible!

Apart from the funds we may receive, we really like the idea of having other people participating in our game. That's why our rewards are focused on adding game content created by our indiegogo backers. We are sure people will have much more ideas of new levels and power up items! We look forward to hear your feedback!

We are asking for $5,000. Most of the game engine and graphics are already done. So we need the money to finish the game and to add content to make it funnier!! The budged will be distributed like this:

$5,000: Create levels. Our goal is to have at least 100 levels. The more time you can play the more time you enjoy!

$3,000: More power up items! We want to make the game as varied as possible. We don’t like repetitive videogames!

$1,000: Enhance user experience. We would like to create Leaderboards and Achievements to challenge the player!

$1,000: Add miscellaneous content.

In case we could get more funds, we would like to expand the game to other devices and add much more content to the game:

$20,000: Game+ version. We love playing difficult games! We want to add a new Game+ to enlarge game life.

$24,000: iPad version. Imagine play a huge level on your tablet, we would love to create this version!

$30,000: Android version. As we have limited resources we can only work on the IOS version right now, but we would be glad to create a version for all the Android players out there.

Our release day for the App Store is scheduled for April 1st, 2015! Once we achieve our funding goal we will be working on the indiegogo features adding content to the game!

In case we may succeed on our funding goal the idea is to launch an iPad and Android version during Summer 2015.

To be informed of the progress of the campaign and the project we recommend you to follow us on Facebook, Twitter and our website!

story:
About

Welcome to the battlefield of Zombies and Humans!

My name is George Frigo, and I love all about zombies. I have been working as ui/ux designer for a long time. And all this time I have been helping other people to make their own dreams come true. Now, its time to put my idea into life. So, I have researched different zombie games, and found out, that there is no such game, that would connect people in real life fighting as zombies and humans. That’s how my idea was created. All people around the world could join this Epic battle, where each second someone can infect or cure you.

Let`s find out together which side is stronger, Zombies or Humans?

Simple Gameplay

The gameplay is very simple. You will learn how to play in a few minutes. Just 3 steps from the start: Register - Choose the side - Add personalization, and you are inside the opposition.


Select your victim in one click, or use search engine to infect someone around the world. Want to infect or cure your friend, so that he becomes a Zombie or Human? There is nothing easier! Select a friend from your contact book.  He is not in the game? Just send him an invite, and the battle begins.


But this war does not depend only on one button. For each successful step, you receive money, which can help you to survive in this ruthless and cruel world. You can buy the time shields and potions to defense yourself. And that is not all! After each level you receive the time shields and potions for FREE.

But even THAT is not all. If we fund more than $ 50 000, then we can integrate DETAILED PROFILE. With this feature, the system with different weapons and armors will be added to the game, which you can receive from the victim, if it was successfully defeated. This weapons and armors will help you to increase the chance of cure or infection, as well as the defensive stats.

How can I support this campaign?

As I told you previously, I have a lot of design experience. So, in the past few months I have finished all sketches, design steps, logic developing, and even a few future updates. The only one thing I had to stop is program developing.

Here I need your help to reach our goal to raise $ 30,000.

You can choose any individual perks you want. Some of them are very unique.


Extras

The more of your support we receive, the more freebies we will give you:


Risks & Challenges

This is my very first project with such a large scale. And I hope you will help me not to let it fail. If you can not give me some funds, just share it. For me it is also very important and helpful.

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
We've launched a new referral program, check out the Updates section to read more about it https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/suuri-s-adve...

Suuri's Adventure is a mixed genre game that uses both a matching and adventure based themes. Suuri takes off on her adventure to save her brother with 5 weapons. Each stone in the matching portion of the game corresponds to one of the 5 elemental weapons, matching 3 or more of those stones charges that weapon. Here is a prototype, game board and stones are final but the character art and weapons are placement only.

Main game screen


The following is my basic GDD to give more info about the game.

Suuri’s Adventure

High Concept:
The high queen Suuri Kuningatar returns home from a long journey to find that her brother has been kidnapped by Lady Elle Mantle the lady of darkness in an attempt to gain control of the master crystal. Suuri gathers her wits and weapons to set out into the realm, fighting Elle’s bosses and minions to rescue her brother. She will need skill and cunning to overcome the waves of evil bosses and minions to reach the heart of Elle’s realm.

Suuri’s Adventure is the first title in a series of different games planned.

Backstory:
In the benevolent land of Criostail Ghleann lives a crystal people charged with keeping the balance of energy here on Earth. Deep in the center of this land lies Magtcentrum the seat of power, a place where the 12 crystal leaders (Emerald, Amethist, Agate, Aquamarine, Citrine, Celestite, Garnet, Jade, Lapis, Malachite, Rose Quartz, and Ruby) gather to absorb the ethereal energy and regulate its power down to the earthly plane. Suuri Kuningatar, the Emerald high queen of the land, watches over everything with a justful and kind eye. They have thrived in peacefull abundance under her rule for thousands of years. There has been only one citizen in the recent history of Criostail Ghleann who’s greedy and ambitious nature caused her to be cast out of the land. The Onyx lady of darkness Elle Mantle, whose lust for power has grown exponentially over the centuries and she will stop at nothing to control the master crystal underneath Magtcentrum. Recruiting elements from the lower realms she has finally amassed an army that might be large enough to become such a threat. Once Elle controls the master crystal she will use block the flow of energy to earth, keeping it for herself and raising her to godlike ability. It is up to Suuri Kuningatar and the other 11 crystal leaders to stop Elle from succeeding.

Game Platform:
The game is a mix of genres, a match 3+ with an adventure. It is intended to be a social media game (Facebook). The game will use a free to play / in-game purchase model. Special ability stones will be available as random drops and in the game store. The game will use Unicoins as a common currency, which will also be used in future titles.

Game Play:
The player swaps adjacent (vertical / horizontal) symbols, no match will be required to move a symbol. Successfully matching 3 or more symbols will charge that symbol’s weapon in the adventure part. As the symbols match they remove themselves and drop down new symbols, there is a possibility for multiple symbol types to match up. Example, if one of the dropping symbols completes a match those will also be counted in that turn. There will be 5 different symbols 1 for each element, Earth, Air, Fire, Water and Psi (psychic/spirit) used to charge the 5 weapons Suuri caries. Two regular game stones will also be used. A life stone that will act as a heal stone, giving the player a health boost. The second is a death stone, this one will take half the match points for that stone away from the total enemy health and give it to the player.

Game Play Mechanics:
Game Layout:
There will be a few screen types from main title to social media specific and the main game screen .The main game screen will be split into 2 sections, the lower half will consist of the matching part while the adventure portion will be on top.

Mechanics:
There will be starting levels based on each element and some other levels to be added later. Example might be seasonal types (Halloween, Christmas, Valentine’s Day, etc.). Each set will have 3 levels per element with increasing number of waves per level. The first will be 3 enemy waves then 4 then 5. Additional sets added later can be variable from 3 - 5 levels per set. The player advances to the next wave by matching symbols in the lower grid to charge the weapon in the adventure part to shoot the enemies on screen. With each successful match of 3 or more like symbols it charges the appropriate elemental weapon and shoots at the enemies in the upper adventure half decreasing its health bar. It is a turn based game so after the player fires each enemy on screen will take turns shooting at the player. The weapons are upgradable to add stamina and damage for that weapon. Player health is a base number plus the stamina of all the weapons.

Player Control:
The player will use the mouse (or touch/drag for mobile devices) to move adjacent pieces on the match 3 game grid.

Score & Health Meters:
Each enemy will have a health bar that will decrease as the enemy is hit. The player will also have a main health bar that will decrease with each enemy hit. Each enemy defeated will add to the score.

Winning & Losing:
Winning solution is two parts, first successfully defeating all enemies on screen per “wave” and finally defeating the “boss” wave to complete each level. Score points will be added to the main score which will advance the player with experience points. Those points are used to upgrade the weapons.

Loss condition is if the player loses all heath before defeating the “boss”. Score points will be lost.

Game Environment:
The game environment will be split into two sections. The upper part will have an adventure section displaying the world, enemies, and elemental weapons. Each level set will keep a common theme, example the water element will have a water look and feel to it. The lower part will have the match 3 game grid. A background will be used to fill the negative space and tie the theme together for that level set.

Characters:
The Player’s Character:
The player is the title character (protagonist) Suuri Kuningatar.

The NPCs:
Elle Mantle, the main antagonist. Each wave will have a boss and several minion types for that level set theme.

Why indiegogo:
The basic game prototype has been made but your help is needed to complete the graphics and character art needed for the 30 initial levels.

A boss character will be created for the highest supporter over $10,000 for a special supporter’s level. In the event of more than one with the same amount a random drawing will be held to pick who will become the Boss for that level.

BIO
currently a design studio for a variety of medium from print to web and offer services including design, programming and photography. The goal is to transition into a full gaming studio. Initially creating games for social media and expand into full desktop and mobile titles within the first 2 to 3 years. This title is the first in a series around Suuri. A prototype is made; however, funds are needed to generate the artwork for all the characters, backgrounds, and weapons in the game.



Stretch goals:
$65,000
Experience points are universal but an option can be added later to allow special “drops” from the enemies allowing for element specific upgrades and special abilities for the weapons.

$80,000
Currently the damage is calculated based on the weapon numbers; however, this can be augmented by adding a player stat option that can have shield, health, and damage ratings that up those numbers and help protect the character better.

$100,000
Currently the game is designed for desktop social media platforms using Flash, with extra support we will port the game to a mobile friendly game engine.

$200,000
20+ additional initial levels

Once funding is reached we will reach out to those in the silver and higher reward level for their mailing address. After the beta is complete and we launch the game everyone will receive notification with a special one-time code to redeem their reward level Unicoin pack.

Title screen prototype

Bag overlay prototype

Social media prototype

Player stat prototype

Shop / store prototype

The following is my basic GDD to give more info about the game.

her brother. She will need skill and cunning to overcome the waves of evil
bosses and minions to reach the heart of Elle’s realm.

story:
About Elemental Perios & Its Team 

Hi, we're the Elemental Perios team. We're led by Stuart Miller, a father who was fascinated by the amount of useless information his children retained about video game characters in their brains. He asked himself, "What if there was a video game that was just as fun, but actually taught children something worthwhile?" 

Enter the magical world of Perios. In this world, a Perio is a character much like a Pokemon™ and there are many different types -- 118 to be exact. That's because each Perio stands for a different element of the Periodic Table of Elements. Every unique Perio comes with unique characteristics, mirroring those of actual chemical elements. The more a child learns about their favorite Perio, the more they learn about chemistry. 

Since Stuart first wondered how his kids could better use their brains, the Perios team developed three apps and mobile games and launched Perios themed interactive learning exhibits at Utica Children's Museum. 

Now, his children are all grown up and the Perios world is growing up too. 

We hope to raise $50,000 to fund the rest of the development of the newest and most ambitious Perios game yet: Elemental Perios. This multi-level quest game will remind children of Halo and Pokemon combined. As the Elemental Explorer (the main character) discovers this new and beautiful universe, it can catch Perios, utilize their unique characteristics, or combine them with others to create useful reactions.

Instead of storing useless facts about made up characters, players will gain a foundational knowledge of chemistry that they can bring with them to their first high school chemistry class. The trick is making the game so fun, they don't even realize it's educational. We like to call this phenomenon "accidental learning". 

To bring the game to life, Stuart Miller teamed up with Forge Modern, a creative technology consulting firm in Los Angeles led by Elias Clark. Clark is Forge Modern's Creative Developer with a Masters in Animation and New Media and a passion for developing engaging educational experiences. So far, Forge Modern's team has done an incredible job building out the first level of the game.

Our expert game testers have played that first level and the reviews are in: Elemental Perios is a game kids will love and parents will encourage them to play!

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $50,000 to hire the help we need to get the rest of the game developed. We already have the first level and redesigned a third of the characters -- all done with no outside money. But we need help to get it across the finish line. Specifically, we will use the funds to hire the following help: 

  • Character Artist
  • Environment Artist
  • Scriptwriter
  • Programmer
  • Animator
  • Tester
  • Composer 

In return, we've come up with all sorts of unique perks for our funders to enjoy. There are simple perks, like a handwritten thank you note, and big ones, like a completely customized Elemental Explorer in your version of the final game. 

If we don't reach the entire goal, we will use the funds received to develop the game as far as possible. From there, we will pitch accredited investors and education-based or gaming-related Venture Capitalist funds. 

 

The Impact

Children are spending more and more time in front of a screen these days. The Elemental Perios team wants to make this time more productive by creating educational and entertaining games. Instead of video games void of any tangible or useful information, we can create games with an impact.

Our team also believes in making science and learning accessible to all children. Not every student's family can afford early education tutors or summer science camps. With your help, Elemental Perios can give more children a jumpstart on learning. All they (or their school) need is an internet connection and a computer. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is not reaching our funding goal. If we don't hit our goal, we can't hire the help we need to get the game finished, and more kids learning about chemistry, sooner. While our lead developer, an expert on interactive education technology, can finish the game on his own, the lack of assistance will significantly delay the timeline. Plus, we'd eventually like him to get some sleep in 2019.  

Even if we don't reach our full funding goal, we will continue to create the game because it's a project we believe in. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not all support is financial. If you can't donate to the cause, we would love if you could share this campaign with three friends.
