story:
The player wakes up inside of a digital themed world. You are awoken by a little flying AI named Felix and are immediately told that you and him both have lost your memories. Together you go on a journey completing environmental puzzles and searching for Felix’s lost memories (these are shown as large stones) as well as your own. While unlocking Felix’s memory, you discover that things are not exactly as they seem. Felix's personality changes and evolves throughout the game, hinting the player that there might be a different agenda at play underneath the surface. Help Felix find his memory while keeping a close eye on him and the world around you to unlock your real purpose.

 

We are a group of six (6) indie developers that include: 1 manager, 2 designers, 1 programmer, 1 artist and 1 audio engineer, who are passionate gamers and even more passionate game-makers who like to create games and build worlds. We all met online and decided that we want to combine our skills and focus on building great games. We have made over a dozen successful games so far on mobile devices, but now turned our attention to VR. We noticed that there is a lack of narrative-driven VR games, but a large demand for them. So, we decided that we need to build the very type of game we would all enjoy the most.

However, we know that in order to make a great game, you need more than just the story. Which is why we wanted to make a narrative-driven game with addictive gameplay.  We were inspired by games such as Portal and Stanley’s Parable, and were able to come up with gameplay that would be enjoyable to everyone, even if you strip it away of its story. So if we think it’s fun and has not been done yet then why not build it?  We want to raise money to build a game that leaves our fans happy and asking for more.  

By backing this project you are helping build a game for those who love environmental puzzles with strong narrative driven gameplay, and those that think that VR games should have more depth to them. We want people to add their comments and thoughts about the game as we develop it, and any donation, even $1 CAD, gets us closer to our goal.

 

We want to raise $5,000 CAD to pay for equipment, licensing, and marketing materials to get us on the Steam store. We are making the game on our own time and resources and don't want be greedy. Whatever funds we raise will be used 100% towards marketing and materials for our game.  

Our perks - We will give you a link to come hang out with us and chat live and view us actually coding and playing the game. We are all super friendly and from 3 different countries.

 

Our campaign is important to us and for the people who love VR games and want more of them. We are making a difference as we give some of our revenues to charities such as the Happy Housing which helps to fight the homelessness in Canada.

We worked on some of these games that were very successful and can be seen at rikkir.com & happyhousing.org

We are now trying to make a game that is going to get attention for being unique and bring the joy of narrative-driven games to VR.

 

This is our first VR game, but we feel that our experience in game making lead us to this and gave us the edge we needed.

We are actively playtesting other VR games to make sure we get our game just right, and are getting people to sign up and become alpha testers to help us find bugs and suggest features.

 

Some people can't afford to contribute at this point, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you can not contribute any money then feel free to share this campaign on your social media pages or any other website you feel people might be interested on.

Come join us on our Discord channel to discuss development, propose ideas or to just hangout with us! www.discord.me/rikkirgames

story:
The Exceeds is proud to present our new game project entitled as Mini Melee.

Why IndieGoGo?

Mini Melee's campaign creation is not only for the sole purpose of raising funds to support the development but also interested on hearing user's response on its early stage of development. This way, from a user's perspective, we can both easily pinpoint what are good and bad points that can be enhanced and simplified for a better straightforward in-game systems that can be fully enjoyed by the users. Ultimately, we may also pick Game Veterans within the IndieGoGo community when they're fully interested and suitable for the development of Mini Melee. Check the Community topic below for more details about Game Veterans.

Note: Majority of the Concept Art below is a rough sketch and temporary. It will be replaced later on with better graphical presentation from the development updates. 

The Game

Mini Melee is a 2.5D Action MMORPG wherein users can experience the 2D and 3D essence of a game altogether while delivering user-friendly gaming experience. Each set of system that will be built in the game will have an important impact on the user's experience and game play rather than just "another feature" to be added. The Exceeds team is sensitively designing in-game systems to be added to bring a full relevance of each in the game.

World Exploration

Mini Melee is played in a 2.5D isometric environment with 8 directional controls using WASD keys as movement controls.

Mini Melee's world is greatly influenced and designed by a combination of Greek & Roman Mythology and the essence of some anime shows and games blended to bring a whole new user experience in a virtual world.

The World of Mini Melee is set in a massive ever-changing clocktower called the Tower of Eternity or also known as Horologium. It is divided into floors sustained by the Guardians and the Crystals at the center of each floor. Who knows what lies ahead beyond the horizon.

Players must fulfill the Current Floor Guardian's Wish  to obtain a Crystal Badge that will serve as a Key to the Gate of the Next Floor.

World exploration is both in an open world manner wherein all players within the vicinity can hunt on the same monsters/bosses and in an instanced manner wherein players can either enter an area in solo mode (1), party mode (5) or raid mode (10-20).


Character Progression

Mini Melee's progression system is synchronously designed as level is dictated by the highest quality of gears crafted and worn. Meaning, there won't be an experience system.

For example, Player A has successfully crafted full Golden-tier set from the Nth Floor. Player A's level is as well successfully leveled up to XX. It's a matter of grinding materials for better gears to level up than experience gained.

In short, if your Level is high it exactly means you're that well geared altogether. This way, the problem within most MMORPGs as high leveled players with poor gear ratings for dungeons & raids is solved. While the rest will be player performance based.

Player Stats

Mini Melee's stat system is straightforwardly designed into 2 stats, Damage and Health. Meaning Damage dealt will exactly reduce Health count and Health count will exactly endure Damage dealt. Due to parrying and evading will depend on the player's performance.

Players when leveled up are always given 2 stat points which they can either put in either Damage or Health. They are given the opportunity to be flexible on whatever type of play they want. Either Attacker-type, Tank-type or Balance-type.

The same applies for equipment. There will be equipment that are better in Health, some are better in Damage and some are completely balanced to fulfill the 3 set of roles without having any of the 3 as better from another.

This way, play style isn't limited and players can perform unique set of combat combination, make situation wise builds and adjust depending on party or raid they belong and monsters or players they will battle

Gathering & Crafting

Mini Melee's gathering system is purely designed on hunting materials by defeating monsters. While crafting system is hierarchically designed as tier based equipment.

White-tier Equipment require materials dropped by Common Monsters and materials sold by a Friendly NPC.

Orange-tier Equipment requires a prerequisite base White-tier equipment and materials dropped by Elite Monsters. 

Golden-tier Equipment requires a prerequisite base Orange-tier and materials dropped by Boss Monsters.

For Example: Slime drops Slime Eye and Slime Goo plus Ore sold by NPC, you can craft it for a White-tier weapon and by crafting it with Elite Slime's Cat Ears and Tail, you can craft it for an Orange-tier weapon and ultimately by crafting it with Slime King's Mustache, you can craft it for a Golden-tier weapon. (Reminder: This is only an example.)


Equipment & Costumes
Mini Melee's weapon system is specifically designed as weapons to be used only for short range combat, they vary in size, shape, texture, color, theme and animation. Examples are Axe, Hammer, Gauntlet, Katana, Knife, Lance, Rapier, Scythe, Sword, etc.
While Armor system is solely designed to increase stats only due to the character's clothing appearance will be overwritten by Costumes which are either personalized or customized designs that follows a certain theme or an event.


With the addition of Offhand equipment, it will distinct attackers more from the tanks due to Off-hand Shields are dedicated only for giving HP stats while Off-hand Weapons are dedicated only for giving DMG stats.

Players can still switch accordingly if they either want to wield Off-hand weapon or shields at any time when out of combat. 

Battle & Combat

Mini Melee is a hack and slash action MMORPG. 

With the availability to move in 8 direction, it allows the player to attack in any direction within 360 degrees giving the 3D effect in a 2.5D environment.

Due to Weapons are all i short range, it requires the player to hone their skills in dodging, reacting, predicting and attacking precisely which is the game's goal, to offer a complete player-performance game.

Game Engine

Mini Melee is currently being developed using Unity3D Engine.

It's globally known for developing high-end games both in 2D or 3D.

It is also one of the Top 5 Game Engines that is purely dedicated on developing games that is user and developer friendly.

With the use of Unity3D Engine, it will allow us to develop and publish our games in cross-platforms like Windows, Mac, Android and iOS.

Community

Mini Melee's community will be a place where we will provide 24/7 player support and moderation with a less than an hour response in-game or not.

Players, Veterans and Game Masters (Moderators, Developers and Leaders) will coexist in the game to assure safe and secured gaming experience.

Meaning, players can regularly see and chat with available Game Masters online in the game and ultimately play with them on events, hunts and raids.

However, Game Masters aren't allowed to trade players and be included in a trade between players. Both players are only liable for their gains/losses. Game Masters will never ask/give/return items.

Observed dedicated player applicants may be promoted to a Game Veteran and become a part of the Player Support Team to provide a better in-game/forum assistance for other players.

Game Veterans are still players, meaning they can still trade with other players, but they have additional in-game powers for player assistance. For example, they can fly in every floor and in any location like Game Masters can.

Ultimately, if Game Veterans are observed as completely dedicated on their activity and performance, they may be promoted as an Official Game Master not only in Mini Melee but also in all game projects of The Exceeds.


Budget

Mini Melee's budget include salaries, rents, utilities, equipment, legal costs and other sort of business activities that will require financial support ahead.

The Exceeds team have decided to set the $10,000 as a minimum starting line to continue the development. With the continuous support and contribution of people in the IndieGoGo community, we'll be able to expand our team and be able to fasten our development while increasing and delivering decent results and updates to our user which will serve as our stretch goal.

If you have noticed, $10,000 is very low to support the development funds and would actually support only a single developer in a month considering the scale of this game project. Some of us have been using our own pockets already just to keep the development running because we really wanted to make this game project possible and hopefully release a Single-Player prototype demo of the game to give the users a feel of the game.

The Team

The Exceeds Team is composed of members who have been in the gaming industry for many years, if not, decades. All of them were originally players before and they're able to pinpoint what's good and bad about a game from its basic to complex features within a user's perspective which comes from their experience to be applied in the development.

Mini Melee is a big game project and certainly we would need to expand our team by adding more talented developers especially artists and designers suitable for the nature of Mini Melee which we can't make it possible without your support.

Rewards

Choir - $5

With Choir Perk, we'll reward you an entitlement of "Choir" title in game, give you 5 Exceed Coins that you can use to purchase items in Mini Store in-game and 1080p Mini Melee Wallpapers for your PC, Laptop or Smartphones.

Angel - $10

With Angel Perk, we'll reward you an entitlement of "Angel" title in game, give you 10 Exceed Coins, 1080p Mini Melee Wallpapers, access in Beta Testing as a Beta Tester and a reservation of 1 Character Name for the Live release. (Note: First contribution, first reservation and numbers aren't allowed in character names).

Archangel - $25

With Archangel Perk, we'll reward you an entitlement of "Archangel" title in game, give you 25 Exceed Coins, 1080p Mini Melee Wallpapers, access in Beta Testing as a Beta Tester, a reservation of 1 Character Name and a Starter Pack that contain valuable items which you can use in your adventure.

Principality - $50

With Principality Perk, we'll reward you an entitlement of "Principality" title in game, give you 50 Exceed Coins, 1080p Mini Melee Wallpapers, access in Beta Testing as a Beta Tester, a reservation of 1 Character Name, a Starter Pack and a reservation of 1 Guild Name for the Live release. (Note: First contribution, first reservation and numbers aren't allowed in guild names).

Power - $75

With Power Perk, we'll reward you an entitlement of "Power" title in game, give you 75 Exceed Coins, 1080p Mini Melee Wallpapers, access in Beta Testing as a Beta Tester, a reservation of 1 Character Name, a Rare Pack, a reservation of 1 Guild Name and 1 Exclusive: Seraph Box that you can open for a chance to obtain Seraph Costumes.

Virtue - $100

With Virtue Perk, we'll reward you an entitlement of "Virtue" title in game, give you 100 Exceed Coins, 1080p Mini Melee Wallpapers, access in Beta Testing as a Beta Tester, a reservation of 2 Character Name, a Rare Pack, a reservation of 1 Guild Name, 2 Exclusive: Seraph Box, customized character color name for the contributors in the forum and a Founder's Costume Set (Head & Body).

Dominion - $250

With Dominion Perk, we'll reward you an entitlement of "Dominion" title in game, give you 250 Exceed Coins, 1080p Mini Melee Wallpapers, access in both Alpha/Beta Testing as an Alpha Tester, a reservation of 2 Character Name, a Mythical Pack, a reservation of 1 Guild Name, 5 Exclusive: Seraph Box, customized character color name for the contributors in the forum, a Founder's Costume Set (Head & Body) and the opportunity to design a monster specie with the help of our developers to be used in-game.

Throne - $500

With Throne Perk, we'll reward you the Special Title "Throne" in game, give you 500 Exceed Coins, 1080p Mini Melee Wallpapers, access in both Alpha and Beta Testing as an Alpha Tester, a reservation of 3 Character Name, a Mythical Pack, a reservation of 1 Guild Name, 10 Exclusive: Seraph Box, customized character color name for the contributors in the forum, a Founder's Costume Set (Head & Body), the opportunity to design a full equipment/costume set and if you have a company/brand, we can promote it by adding texts of your company's name or brand in our credits/sponsored by pages.

Cherubim - $750

With Cherubim Perk, we'll reward you the Special Title "Cherubim" in game, give you 750 Exceed Coins, 1080p Mini Melee Wallpapers, access in both Alpha/Beta Testing as an Alpha Tester, a reservation of 3 Character Name, a Divine Pack, a reservation of 1 Guild Name, 15 Exclusive: Seraph Box, personalized character color name of your choice in the forum, 2 Founder's Costume Set (Head & Body), the opportunity to design an elite/boss monster and if you have a company/brand, we can promote it by adding images of your company's name or brand in our credits/sponsored by pages and a complete Exclusive: Seraph Full Set (Head, Body, Back and Weapons).

Seraphim - $1000

With Seraphim Perk, we'll reward you the Exclusive Title "Seraphim" in game, give you 1000 Exceed Coins, 1080p Mini Melee Wallpapers, access in both Alpha/Beta Testing and officially become and promoted as a Game Veteran of the Player Support Team, a reservation of 3 Character Name, a Divine Pack, a reservation of 1 Guild Name, 20 Exclusive: Seraph Box, a personalized character color name of your choice in the forum, 2 Founder's Costume Set (Head & Body), the opportunity to design an entire floor and if you have a company/brand, we can promote it by adding videos of your company's name or brand in our credits/sponsored by pages, a complete Exclusive: Seraph Full Set (Head, Body, Back and Weapons) and a personalized 1080 wallpaper exclusive for you.


If you have any questions about the campaign/game project, feel free to post your comments and we'll reply as soon as possible!

On behalf of our team, we hope that you can support us and make this game project possible. Every contribution is greatly appreciated.

Thank you very much in advance.

-The Exceeds

story:
Grace Chat with Christ Theme Centre.

We would like to create a Global Messenger App purely messages about God, Jesus and Bible.  Christian worldwide can connect under 1 messaging app designed by Christian for Christian.  The app stickers, emoticons all will be Christ centric. 

Christian worldwide can create and contribute to app stickers, emoticons 
We are focusing of providing Christ Theme section where Christian song writers and singers can have the opportunity to share worship songs to millions of Christians worldwide.
  • We are Christian base Mobile App Developers  and has been blessed by God's grace to be able to develop sophisticated enterprise level app at low cost.  
  • This campaign serve as 2 purpose.  First is to get exposure and let Christian worldwide knows we are creating this app.  2nd is to get your support to help finance this app.  The development cost, server operation cost is expensive to maintain potential 100mil Christian Users.
  • Every contribution to this project will help shape the future of Christian communities globally.  

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need $50,000 usd of fund to complete the development of this app and develop the Christ Theme so that we can provide a platform for many talented christian to share their music to christian worldwide.  The songs in the Christ Theme will be 100% Free.
  • What will be in the Christ Theme?
  1. A platform for all christian to browse for all worships song.  
  2. Christian can rate like / dislike and comments on the songs.
  3. Christian can choose to listen free or contribute money to the singer.   
  4. Christian can invite the singer to visit their church to sing by paying a service fees (or free if the singer is willing).
  5. There will be categories of songs and in different languages. 
  6. Christian can stream or download the music to their smartphone.
  • What will be in sticker stores?
  1. A place for Christian designers to upload Christ Centric stickers and emoticon to the sticker store.    
  2. Christian Designers can set their stickers free or set as paid stickers.
  3.  Christian can support the designers by buying their paid stickers.
  4. We will be able to have thousands of stickers and emoticons specially designed for God, Jesus, and Church to be shared globally.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will use the funds to launch GraceChat App only, and to fund the setup and operations of server to maintain up to potential 100mil Christian Users.

The Impact

Many churches has music and singing band, has many good audio visual engineers and designers serving God.  We are creating a platform where millions of talented Christian can now share and showcase their talent globally (personally or with Church) to every single christian's smartphone. 

  • As a Christian, we are finding it difficult to listen or download free Christian worship songs.   
  • iTunes store songs only available for iphone/ipad users and not available for android users. 
  • Christian in Asia unable to list their songs to sell in itunes as individual and must go through agencies which will take a cut into their profits.
  • We provide a platform that solve all the problems and allow more opportunities to Christians.  
  • We have created few Offline bible apps for iphone, ipad, android phone.  Few of those apps are currently in use by over 200,000 christians. https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=c...

Risks & Challenges

The risk is everyday we will need to filter all the songs to ensure there is no violation of copyright and trademark.   

  • With the ratings of like, dislike and comments, we will be able to determine and take necessary actions should any intellectual property is infringed.  
  • We welcome to work with any Christian that are professional in this line of establishment.

Other Ways You Can Help

Other than monetary support, by your sharing of this campaign to all your Christian friends and family, you already have help us to out reach this app to more Christian!

  • Do make a loud sharing via social media, via all your messenger apps friends and of course, use Indiegogo share tools!



** We will add more pictures and video once the design is available.
Updates 1 May 2015:  We decided to change the app now to GraceChat.

We have created few Offline bible apps for iphone, ipad, android phone.  Few of those apps are currently in use by over 200,000 christians. https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=c...
    Risks & Challenges  The risk is everyday we will need to filter all the songs to ensure there is no violation of copyright and trademark.     With the ratings of like, dislike and comments, we will be able to determine and take necessary actions should any intellectual property is infringed.   We welcome to work with any Christian that are professional in this line of establishment.    Other Ways You Can Help Other than monetary support, by your sharing of this campaign to all your Christian friends and family, you already have help us to out reach this app to more Christian!  Do make a loud sharing via social media, via all your messenger apps friends and of course, use Indiegogo share tools!






** We will add more pictures and video once the design is available.
Updates 1 May 2015:  We decided to change the app now to GraceChat.

story:
Remember how football was before fantasy games started? Not as many people cared to watch the games that did not involve their favorite team. Now if you play fantasy football, every game is important. Fantasy Battle Rap will have the same result with the Battle Rap industry. 

WHAT IS FANTASY BATTLE RAP?

Fantasy Battle Rap (FBR) is an interactive gaming and social media platform that integrates fantasy sports elements and battle rap. Currently available via an online website and mobile application, FBR connects battle rappers, leagues, and fans on a global level.  

Fantasy Battle Rap is cardinal in the future of battle rap culture as it provides a fun, competitive, and new interactive aspect for battle rap fans. Battle rap fans  are able to create a unique profile, watch battle rap matches, vote for battle rap match winners, place point wagers on battles, win prizes plus more! 

Further more, qualified battle rappers and battle rap league owners will be eligible to enjoy in an advertising revenue sharing program designed by FBR to put money back into the hands of the skilled rappers and league owners who make it all happen. 

Battle Rap is a creative and entertaining art in its own and FBR is not only dedicated to supporting the industry's growth and recognition, but also in making it more accessible to fans worldwide.  

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU'LL GET 

We're a trio of Boston-based locals who have put in all we have to start Fantasy Battle Rap and we're trying to raise $15,000 through our crowdfunding campaign to continue the development of our platform. The funds will be used to pay for additional resources and custom programming needed to further build and enhance the gaming platform. Even if we do not meet our goal, all funds raised go to the Fantasy Battle Rap, LLC and will be used to pay for intended purposes stated above. However, we're dedicated to making this happen and with you're help we can go further.  

All donations are appreciated! Contributors can receive cool perks such as shout-outs on our social media accounts, FBR merchandise, and even VIP tickets to our official launch battle rap event taking place in October 2015. 

If that wasn't exciting enough, one lucky contributor will have the chance to battle Chilla Jones (www.chillajones.com) in front of a live crowd and video stream on our platform!!  


WHO WE ARE

The Founding Team 

Walace Nogueira, Jr. (CEO & Creative Director)- Background and experience in Music Marketing, Event Planning and Merchandising. Battle Rap Supporter & Fan. 

Daniel Zayet-Volshin - (Chief Technology Officer) Background and experience in IT & Web Development. Battle Rap Supporter & Fan. 

Jerome "Chilla" Jones - (Brand Ambassador & Director of Strategic Partnerships) Battle Rapper, Supporter & Fan. Background and experience in Battle Rap as a Battle Rapper, Battle Rap Event Judge and Commentator. 

Advisors

Valerie Becker-Nogueira - Administration & Public Relations, B.S. in Marketing Communications, Emerson College. 

Brandon Matthews - Social Media Marketing, Co-founder of ShowOff Marketing & KillerBoomBox.com

Chris McKenna - Legal advisor on Intellectual Property, Attorney at Foley & Laudner, LLP

David Kantaros - Legal advisor on Corporate Structure and Venture Capital, Attorney at Foley & Laudner, LLP 

WHAT ELSE CAN HAPPEN WITH YOUR SUPPORT?

Battle rap fans are very loyal in their support for their favorite rappers and leagues and Fantasy Battle Rap strives to be the hub for all battle rap related events.  We hope to collaborate with Battle Rap leagues and websites to create the best fan experiences possible and curate the best content for users. In order to achieve this goal, we need to win the support of all the battle rap leagues, rappers, and media outlets that cover battle rap and their loyal fans.

The challenge for FBR will be getting the decision makers of these companies to see our vision. With the support of fans and donors we can make this happen. Nonetheless, we promise to remain focus on creating the best platform imaginable. 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

You don't have to contribute money to help. Please help us through social media support. Every tweet and facebook mention of our website is a big help already. If you can help us spread the word about this awesome project and this indiegogo campaign by simply sharing our link, we would really, really, really appreciate it! 

Thank you for your support! 

-Walace N.

story:
Hier geht's zum deutschen Text!

Summary

Hey there, my name's Andreas Malessa. I've been organising gaming events, tournaments and parties in Cologne, Germany under the brands "Barcraft Cologne" and "Bar of Legends Cologne" for more than three years now. Over these years, I got lots of experiences in gastronomy, event management, marketing and of course I'm a huge gaming and esports addict!

We want gaming, eSports and nerd culture to grow (up) - from side events in a rented bar into something bigger! We want to build a place where all kinds of nerds can feel at home and share their passion with people alike!

This can't happen if  our events stay the "hobby" they have been, limiting our time and financial ressources. That's why we want to open up our own dedicated gaming, esports & nerd bar in Cologne! 

Unfortunately, a bar like this costs a lot - and banks don't like to fund neither gaming nor gastronomy projects. That's why we need your support!

What you give & what you'll get

For the whole bar we'll need around 75,000 €. With our crowdfunding goal of 25,000 € we'll be able to get a regular credit to finance the bar. The more money we raise the easier the financing will become and the safer we can calculate.
If we don't raise enough money we'll either try to get our funding with whatever we get or we'll pay back everything (minus the 5% that indiegogo takes).
We have some unique perks that are only available once and many more common perks. Unique perks are for example signed, not obtainable WCS trading cards I collected over the last year or some of our selfmade gaming cookie cutters.
The common perks include free drinks in our bar, tshirts that will only be produced for this event and never availabe again, 

- every donor gets a unique number on his/her shirt -
behind-the-scenes material, your name engraved on elements in the bar or special memberships that grant you free drinks with every visit. 
Furthermore, everyone will get additional extras whenever we reach certain goals.


How the bar will be like

The bar will be a part of the MELTDOWN esports bars franchise. It aims to be a place where every nerd feels at home.

Gaming

We're planning fixed days for the biggest games (like LoL, DOTA 2, Hearthstone, CS:GO, Heroes of the Storm, SC2, etc) as well as regular events for every smaller game every few weeks (Mario Kart, Smash Brothers, FIFA, Pro Evolution, Street Fighter, Mortal Kombat). For all of these we plan to do tournaments inside the bar. We'll also host launch parties whenever a new major title (GTA, Witcher, Zelda, etc) comes out.

eSports

We'll show esports tournaments and leagues that are currently running, be it LCS, WCS, IEM, ESL One or more. Due to our setup we'll be able to show several eSports in the bar at the same time.

Nerd Culture

We're not just gamers - we're overall nerds and we admit it! We play MTG, Pen & Paper or Tabletop games. We're cosplaying or LARPing. We watch Anime, Game of Thrones and Rocketbeans. Many of our regular visitors have more in common than just gaming, so in our bar you'll always find someone else to talk about your favourite hobby!

Risks & Challenges

Of course there are risks involved. But going new ways never comes without those. The renovation might take longer or become more expensive as we planned - but we're prepared for these kinds of incidents. Our businessplan was made with several buffers which ensure that even several incidents won't become a problem.

Additionally, we're used to dealing with problems: during our three years of gaming events we faced many challenges and it only got complexer with the search for a fitting location and convincing its owner of our project. We always found a solution!

Other ways to support us

Some people can't donate - but they can still support us! 

Sharing this project on social media actually helps a lot! There are buttons for sharing on facebook and twitter on the left side of our video at the top of this page. 
Furthermore you can tell your friends, family or colleagues about our project online, in school, university or at work. Post something on your blog, in your favourite internet forum, subreddit or facebook group.
Every little thing can incentivise others to do the same and the more people here about us the more might donate.

Together, we can help the nerd culture to evolve, grow up and finally get the respect in the outside world that it already has online. Let's build a home for every nerd!


Deutsch

Kurzbeschreibung

Hallo, mein Name ist Andreas Malessa. Seit über drei Jahren organisiere ich unter den Eventreihen "BarCraft Cologne" und Bar of Legends Cologne" Gaming Events, Turniere und Parties in Köln. In dieser Zeit habe ich viele Erfahrungen in der Gastronomie, dem Event-Management und Marketing gesammelt und natürlich bin ich absolut Gaming- und eSports-Verrückt!

Wir wollen, dass Gaming, eSports und die allgemeine Nerdkultur wachsen und erwachsen werden. Wir möchten einen Ort aufbauen an dem sich jeder Nerd zuhause fühlen und sein Hobby mit Gleichgesinnten ausleben kann. Dies kann nicht passieren wenn unsere Events nur ein "Hobby" bleiben weil dadurch sowohl die Zeit als auch das Geld das wir investieren können streng limitiert bleiben. Darum wollen wir in Köln eine Bar eröffnen die sich spezifisch dem Gaming, eSports und allerlei Nerdkultur widmet!

Leider kostet eine solche Bar eine Menge Geld und Banken agieren sehr vorsichtig bei der Finanzierung von Projekten sowohl aus den Bereichen Gaming als auch der Gastronomie. Darum brauchen wir eure Unterstützung!

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Für die gesamte Bar brauchen wir etwa 75.000 €. Mit unserem Crowdfunding-Ziel von 25.000 wären wir in der Lage, den Rest mit einem normalen Bankkredit zu finanzieren. Mit noch mehr Geld wird die gesamte Finanzierung natürlich noch einfacherer und sicherer.

Sollten wir nicht genug Geld sammeln werden wir zunächst alles versuchen, um doch noch einen Finanzierung auf die Beine zu stellen, vielleicht eröffnet uns die öffentliche Aufmerksamkeit dieser Kampagne neue Perspektiven. Sollten wir auch dabei scheitern werden wir alle Summen zurück zahlen (abzüglich der 5% die an indiegogo gehen).

Wir haben einige einzigartige Vorteile für euch die es nur einmal gibt und viele öfter verfügbare Vorteile. Zu den einzigartigen gehören zum Beispiel eine vollständige WCS Kartenkollektion, teilweise unterschrieben oder unsere selbstgemachten Keksausstecher.

Zu den normalen Vorteilen gehören Freigetränke, T-Shirts die nur für diese Gelegenheit produziert werden und niemals sonst erhältlich sein werden

- jeder Spender erhält eine einzigartige Nummer -,
exklusives Behind-the-Scenes Material, eine Gravur deines Namens in Elemente der Bar oder spezielle Mitgliedschaften die dir bei jedem Besuch Vergünstigungen einbringen.

Zusätzlich wird es Belohnungen für alle geben wenn bestimmte Summen erreicht werden:


Wie das Barkonzept aussehen wird

Die Bar wird ein Ableger des "MELTDOWN" esports bar Netzwerkes werden. Sie soll ein Ort sein an dem sich jeder Nerd zuhause fühlt.

Gaming

Wir planen, feste Tage für die größten Spiele (wie LoL, DOTA 2, Hearthstone, CS:GO, Heroes of the Storm, SC2, usw) einzurichten. Dazu wollen wir alle paar Wochen auch Abende für kleinere Spiele (Mario Kart, Smash Brothers, FIFA, pro Evolution, Street Fighter, Mortal Kombat, etc) organisieren. Für all diese Spiele wollen wir Turniere in der Bar veranstalten.Zudem werden wir Launch-Parties feiern wenn neue Major-Titel (GTA, Witcher, Zelda, etc) herauskommen.

eSports
Wir werden durchgängig eSports Turniere und Ligen zeigen die aktuell laufen, egal ob LCS, WCS, IEM, ESL One oder mehr. Durch die technische Einrichtung der Bar ist es dabei möglich, diverse eSports Events gleichzeitig in der Bar zu zeigen.

Nerdkultur
Wir sind nicht nur Gamer - wir sind durch und durch Nerds und wir stehen dazu! Wir spielen MTG, Pen & Paper oder Tabletop. Wir cosplayen oder LARPen, schauen Anime, Game of Thrones und Rocketbeans. Viele unserer Stammbesucher haben viel mehr gemeinsam als nur das Zocken, ihr werdet also in unserer Bar fast immer jemand anderes treffen mit dem ihr über euer Lieblingshobby reden könnt!

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Natürlich gibt es auch Risiken, aber diese gibt es immer wenn man etwas neues versucht. Die Renovierung könnte länger dauern oder mehr kosten als gedacht aber wir haben solche Vorfälle mit eingeplant. Unser Businessplan enthält diverse Puffer die sicherstellen, dass selbst mehrere Probleme das Projekt nicht gefährden werden.

Außerdem sind wir es gewohnt, Herausforderungen zu bewältigen: während der letzten drei Jahre kam es oft zu unvorhersehbaren Problemen und diese wurden mit der Locationsuche und dem Drang, ihre Besitzer überzeugen zu müssen nur umso komplexer. Eine Lösung haben wir bisher immer gefunden!

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Manche Leute können nichts donaten - aber sie können uns trotzdem unterstützen!

Dieses Projekt in Social Media zu teilen hilft tatsächlich sehr! Oben links neben dem Video gibt es Buttons zum Teilen auf facebook und twitter.

Weiterhin könnt ihr natürlich euren Freunden von diesem Projekt erzählen, eurer Familie, eurem Clan, eurer Gilde, euren Kommilitonen oder Kollegen. In der Schule, der Uni, auf eurem Teamspeak Server oder auf der Arbeit. Postet etwas über uns in eurem Blog oder liebsten Internetforum, subreddit oder facebook Gruppe. Jede Kleinigkeit kann andere dazu bewegen das Gleiche zu tun und andere zum spenden zu bringen.

Zusammen können wir der Nerdkultur helfen, sich weiter zu entwickeln, erwachsen zu werden und endlich den Respekt in der Außenwelt zu erfahren den sie online längst erreicht hat. Lasst uns gemeinsam ein Zuhause für jeden Nerd aufbauen!

story:
Saving lives is never easy! And when you’re on the frontline of war zones, deadly diseases, and natural disasters it’s almost impossible.

We are creating a mobile game that will allow you to step into the shoes of Doctors Without Borders (MSF) and experience what’s it’s like working to save lives under the most extreme conditions with only limited supplies.

This game is unique in its capacity to enable players to help real people from the other side of the planet through an easy to use ‘donate’ button - money from which will be given directly to MSF.

We all sit on the sofa or bus, watch a news clip from the other side of the world and think “that is awful,” yet very few of us find a way to make a real difference. The staff of Doctors Without Borders risk their own lives to save the lives of people far, far away every single day.  Mediadante (BAFTA-Nominated producers of “Escape from Isis”) want to work with YOU to make a powerful game that, just by playing, gives all of us the chance  to make a difference.

¡Haz click aquí para leer la presentación en castellano!

What is the game?

This mobile game gives players the chance to experience for themselves the unthinkable situations faced by humanitarian workers on the frontline of conflicts, epidemics, and natural disasters. Based on the work of the medical aid organisation, Doctors Without Borders (MSF),  this is a highly playable, slightly addictive (in a good way) game, that gives everyone the chance to make an impact through the sharing of knowledge and direct donations.

Before we get into details we want to make clear that ultimately we want the game to be shaped, invented and reinvented by you, the gamer. We have established a broad framework for the game but everything from the final title of the game, the storyline, scenarios, and even the logo, will be created collaboratively with our community of gamers.

The basic gaming dynamic could be similar to Plague Inc. , This War of Mine or The Sims or any other real time strategy game in which players need to solve a problem with limited resources, while up against forces beyond their control.

There are different characters to choose from, (different roles in MSF) and multiple scenarios in which you could find yourself.

The game is set in an imaginary region of the world where  every potential disaster is possible.

Through different challenges the user must learn the game controls and the different activities of each character (all professionals used by MSF on its missions: Doctors, Nurses, Constructors, Logistics Specialists, Communication Officers)

Then you step into the shoes of one of those people - you create, build and then become your own hero. You have to make life and death decisions.

Once the first disaster hits they will keep coming and growing in difficulty as the game evolves.

Each scenario or ‘mission’  is introduced with an in-game video feed that may include real-world archive footage  of past emergencies, helping to ground the imaginary world of the game in the reality of the world it reflects. Gamers can click through to the forum to find out more about what happened in the past, giving them context and content to help them play the game more efficiently and discuss real world events and problems.

The user must also build different facilities; field hospitals, shelters, refugee camps water and sanitation stations to assist their mission.

Each mission is set in the same virtual world  but has a different emergency  unfolding:

  • Natural disasters - Earthquakes, floods, hurricane, tsunami
  • Famine
  • War and conflict
  • Disease outbreak
  • Extreme poverty - long term health effects

 

Why are we making this game?

We would like to tell the story of MSF through a mobile game in order to:

- raise key awareness of humanitarian emergencies and global medical problems,

- Engage a community of socially-minded or just casual gamers in the work of Doctors Without Borders (MSF)  

- help raise crucial funding for this brave organisation to continue their work in over 60 countries

Our aim is to reach beyond basic storytelling and give people a real insight into what’s like to be part of an MSF team working under extreme conditions.

Although the game is set in a fictional world, it draws upon the rich seam of real life stories and experiences of MSF staff, responding to events such as the Ebola epidemic in West Africa, the humanitarian crisis in Syria, and the earthquakes in Nepal and Haiti

The physical, medical, moral and logistical challenges Doctors Without Borders face under extreme time pressure are very much real. Their staff  have a set of tools (vehicles, medical equipment, ‘inflatable’ hospitals etc) and resources (medicines, fuel, staff etc)  which they have to use and manage a with great care and expertise.  They also make life or death decisions such as where and when to intervene in a humanitarian emergency, that determines the fate of thousands.  

Who are  Doctors Without Borders (MSF)?

Doctors without Borders (also known by its French name Medecins Sans Frontieres - or ‘MSF’ for short) is  an international humanitarian-aid organisation and Nobel Peace Prize laureate, that was founded in France in 1971. Today it is a global force with over 30,000 staff helping many of the world’s most desperate people. They give up their day jobs, leave their comfort zone, and move far away from their families, to work for MSF as doctors, nurses, logisticians, water and sanitation experts, and in many other capacities. They are one of the world’s most efficiently run charities, and one with the most impact. Their stories, their bravery, and the everyday challenges they face and overcome to bring even basic treatments to disaster-stricken places is almost impossible for most of us to comprehend. These are real world heroes, not the ones that popular media feed us. They should be our role models, so let’s create a game that unlocks the humanitarian inside all of us.

What do we need from you?

Doctors Without Borders (MSF) is backing this project and has offered ongoing collaboration and support but as a medical aid charity they are unable to contribute financially with their donor’s money.

So, to make this game a reality, we need your financial support, but as well as sourcing funds, we also recruiting your beautiful minds, your imagination, your ability to problem solve, and your curiosity! We want your help to create this amazing game and no previous experience or coding knowledge is necessary. You’ve all seen the power of crowdfunding, and your donations will help us get the game off the ground, but what we really want is your help to create the game itself.

A community of gamers

Through a specially designed forum (run by ANewMission.org), we will  brainstorm ideas and collaborate on how to create a mobile game that will directly impact Doctors Without Borders’ (MSF) work. Alongside MSF staff and top game designers, our IndieGoGO backers will be part of a dynamic community focused on making an innovative mobile game with real impact, the likes of which has never been done!

Development of the game will  happen over several months but as a community member you'll be free to dip in and out of the project, contributing as much or as little as you’d like. By crowdsourcing ideas in this way, we believe the process will be fun and creative, and allow people from all over the world to come together and bounce ideas off each other!

We’d like you to be involved in any way you can, but  if you’d just like to give some money to support this project, that’s fantastic too.  We are incredibly grateful for any contribution you can make and we’re offering some great perks so check them out.

How will we use the money?

At this stage, we are not trying to raise money for a  finished  game - we’re just seeking development funding. We are in touch with big games developers and they are already very interested in helping us make the game.  We are confident they will, but they need a fully developed pitch, complete with artwork, and basic prototypes before they invest. It’s a seriously exciting challenge, and we are thrilled to invite you to be a part of this special community.

We’re seeking $50,000 but of course, the more we can raise, the further we can take this game. However, if we don’t raise enough to develop this game any further we plan to donate it to MSF. In addition, if there’s any money left over from the development phase, we would donate that to MSF as well - so please make sure you're happy for us to do that before donating to this IndieGoGo campaign.   

So here’s a bit more detail about how we plan to use the money we raise:

-  Development of the concept  with games developers and executive producers Games 4 Change, Mediadante (the producers),  2conleche and of course Doctors Without Borders and the our IndieGoGo community

- Commissioning storyboard artists, prototypes, and mock-ups  

-  Providing workshops for for MSF field staff  with extensive real-world  experience so they can be a part of the development phase to make it as realistic as possible.

-  Testing of the concept with gamers and market research.

-  The creation of a visually exciting package online and in print that we can present to the game developers

-  Economy travel to and from investors meetings in the UK and abroad so they can say, “Yes, let’s enter this brave new world of socially beneficial gaming together”.

Who’s on  the team?

Doctors Without Borders (MSF) - from the frontline to the back office people across MSF are excited about the possibilities of sharing their everyday extraordinary experiences with the world and the opportunity to reach new audiences.

Mediadante - award-winning documentary makers, this team has long worked to find fresh ways to tell MSF's story and new paths for easy donations to keep their work alive. Rosie Garthwaite's award-winning book which gives a third of its profits to MSF, How To Avoid Being Killed in a War Zone, is part of the inspiration for this game.

Eduardo Celorio - the founder of 2conleche,  A digital strategy consulting company specialising in creating interaction and gamification between content and the audience. The company is involved in several successful projects such as tusrelatos.com, the largest community of short stories in Spanish, and several trivia games produced in different formats.

Anew Mission – A young company that connects the world in doing good. They have built the platform we will be using to co-create the game. It has been especially designed for collaborative innovation. And teaches us how to solve problems creatively.

Playback Interactive - was formed in 2014 with the goal of producing high quality, innovative titles on mobile platforms. They like to produce rapid prototypes and get quick user feedback to determine good projects to pursue full time and also to deliver the most enjoyable experiences possible for potential users. As of February this year they signed a publishing deal with All 4 Games, a games publishing arm of Channel 4 set up to support creative talent within the mobile games sector.

 

CASTELLANO

MSF - [IT’S NO GAME]

¡Salvar vidas nunca es fácil! Y cuando estás en la primera línea de zonas de guerra, ante enfermedades mortales o frente a desastres naturales es casi imposible.

Estamos creando un juego móvil que te permitirá ponerte en la piel de Médicos Sin Fronteras (MSF) y vivir lo que significa trabajar para salvar vidas en las condiciones más extremas y con recursos limitados.

Es sencillo sentarse en el sofá, ver las noticias que provienen del otro lado del mundo y pensar: “esto es horrible, quiero hacer algo”. La realidad es que pocas personas pueden realmente hacer algo para que cambien las cosas. El personal de Médicos Sin Fronteras sí puede, y cada día arriesgan sus vidas para salvar a personas que viven y sufren en lugares muy, muy lejanos.

Desde Mediadante (productores de "Escape de Isis" documental nominado a un BAFTA) y 2conleche (consultora estratégica de marketing online) queremos trabajar contigo para hacer un juego de gran alcance que, solo por jugarlo, te dé la oportunidad de marcar la diferencia y ayudar a los más necesitados.

¿Qué es It’s No Game?

Un juego móvil que da a los jugadores la oportunidad de experimentar por sí mismos las situaciones impensables a las que se enfrentan los trabajadores humanitarios en la primera línea de los conflictos, epidemias y desastres naturales. Basado en el trabajo de la ONG de ayuda médica, Médicos Sin Fronteras (MSF), estamos ante un juego divertido y un poco adictivo (en el buen sentido), que te dará la oportunidad de hacer un verdadero impacto en el mundo a través del intercambio de conocimientos (Crowd-Knowledge)y donaciones directas a MSF.

Antes de entrar en detalles queremos dejar claro que en última instancia, queremos que el juego sea construido, inventado y reinventado por ti: el jugador. Hemos establecido las líneas básicas pero todo, desde el título final, la historia, los escenarios e incluso el logotipo, se creará en colaboración con nuestra comunidad de jugadores.

La dinámica básica del juego podría ser similar a Plague Inc., This War of Mine, The Sims o cualquier otro juego de estrategia en tiempo real. Los jugadores tienen que resolver problemas con recursos limitados mientras luchan contra fuerzas fuera de su control.

Hay diferentes personajes para elegir, (que son los diferentes profesionales que trabajan en MSF) y múltiples escenarios en los que podrías encontrarte.

El juego se desarrolla en una región imaginaria del mundo en la que todo desastre potencial es posible.

A través de diferentes retos los usuarios deberán aprender los controles del juego y las diferentes actividades de cada personaje (todos los profesionales que acuden con MSF en sus misiones: médicos, enfermeras, constructores, especialistas en logística, responsables de comunicación, etc.).

A continuación entras en la piel de una de estas personas - creas, construyes y terminas por convertirte en tu propio héroe. Tienes que tomar decisiones de vida o muerte.

Una vez llegue el primer desastre, no vas a poder parar. Conforme avanzas en el juego los desastres te seguirán golpeando y creciendo en dificultad.

Cada escenario o "misión" se introduce con una secuencia de vídeo que puede incluir imágenes de archivo de emergencias reales que ya han sucedido. Esto ayudará a los jugadores a que puedan comprender mejor el mundo imaginario del juego y la realidad que este mundo refleja. Además, los jugadores podrán ir al foro para averiguar más acerca de lo sucedido en el pasado, obtener contexto y contenidos de ayuda para ser más eficiente en la misión. Además, el foro servirá para discutir acontecimientos y problemas del mundo real.

El usuario también debe construir diferentes instalaciones; hospitales de campaña, refugios, campos de refugiados y estaciones de saneamiento y agua potable para ayudar en la misión.

Cada misión sucede en el mismo mundo virtual. Lo que cambia son las diferentes emergencia que se van desarrollando:

  • Desastres naturales - terremotos, inundaciones, huracanes, tsunamis
  • Hambruna
  • Guerras y conflictos armados
  • Epidemias de enfermedades
  • Extrema pobreza - efectos sobre la salud a largo plazo

¿Por qué hacemos este juego?

  • Nos gustaría contar la historia de MSF a través de un juego para móviles con la finalidad de: el fin de:
  • Sensibilizar a la población de las emergencias humanitarias y los problemas de salud mundiales.
  • Crear una comunidad de jugadores con mentalidad social alrededor del trabajo de Médicos Sin Fronteras (MSF).
  • Ayudar a aumentar los fondos de esta valiente ONG para que pueda continuar su trabajo en más de 60 países.

Aunque el juego se desarrolla en un mundo de ficción, se basa en la rica veta de historias reales y experiencias del personal de MSF en respuesta a acontecimientos como la epidemia de Ébola en África occidental, la crisis humanitaria en Siria y los terremotos en Nepal y Haití.

Este juego es único en su capacidad de permitir que los jugadores ayuden a personas reales al otro lado del planeta a través de un botón “donar” - que enviará dinero directamente a MSF.

Los desafíos físicos, médicos, morales y logísticos a los que Médicos Sin Fronteras se enfrenta bajo extrema presión, son una realidad diaria para los voluntarios de esta organización. El personal de MSF tiene un conjunto de herramientas (vehículos, equipos médicos, hospitales inflables, etc.) y recursos (medicamentos, combustible, personal, etc.) que tienen que usar y administrar con gran cuidado y experiencia. También toman decisiones de vida o muerte, cómo dónde y cuándo intervenir en una situación de emergencia humanitaria. Estas decisiones determinan el destino de miles de personas.

¿Quiénes son Médicos Sin Fronteras?

Médicos sin Fronteras (también conocido por su nombre en francés MEDECINS SANS FRONTIERES o "MSF" para abreviar) es una organización internacional de ayuda humanitaria y Premio Nobel de la Paz, que fue fundada en Francia en 1971. Hoy en día es una fuerza global con más de 30.000 empleados que ayudan a muchas de las personas más desesperadas del mundo. Son personas que dejan sus trabajos, salen de su zona de confort y dejan a sus familias para trabajar en MSF como médicos, enfermeros, especialistas en logística, expertos en potabilización de agua y saneamiento y en muchas otros roles necesarios. MSF es una de las ONG más eficiente del mundo y con mayor impacto. Para la mayoría de nosotros es casi imposible comprender sus historias, valentía y los retos diarios a los que se enfrentan para lograr llevar los tratamientos más básicos a los lugares afectados por desastres. Estos sí son héroes reales, muy diferentes de los que la cultura popular nos ofrecer. Deben ser nuestros modelo, y por esta razón vamos a crear este juego con el fin de abrir la vena humanitaria dentro de todos nosotros.

Nuestro objetivo es llegar más allá de la narración básica y dar a la gente una visión real de lo que es ser parte de un equipo de MSF que trabaja en condiciones extremas.

¿Qué necesitamos de ti?

Médicos Sin Fronteras (MSF) apoya este proyecto y nos ha ofrecido su colaboración permanente, pero como organización benéfica que son no son capaces de contribuir económicamente con el dinero de sus donantes.

Por lo tanto, para hacer este juego una realidad, necesitamos tu apoyo financiero. Pero además de los fondos de abastecimiento, también necesitamos tu creatividad, tu imaginación, tu capacidad para resolver problemas y tu curiosidad. Queremos que tu ayuda para crear este juego increíble. No es necesarios tener experiencia previa o conocimiento de programación. Todos conocemos el poder del crowdfunding y sí, tus donaciones nos ayudarán a conseguir que el juego despegue, pero lo que realmente queremos es tu ayuda para crear el juego en sí mismo.

Una comunidad de jugadores

A través de un foro especialmente diseñado (desarrollado por ANewMission.org), vamos a pensar en ideas y colaborar en la forma de crear un juego para móviles que impactará directamente en el trabajo de Médicos Sin Fronteras (MSF). Junto con el personal de MSF y los mejores diseñadores de juegos, nuestros patrocinadores Indiegogo serán parte de una comunidad dinámica centrada en hacer un juego para móviles innovador y con impacto real como nunca se ha hecho.

El desarrollo del juego durará varios meses, pero como miembro de la comunidad serás libre de entrar y salir del proyecto y de contribuir tanto o tan poco como desees. Creemos que esta forma para generar ideas va a ser divertido y creativo. Sobretodo va a permitir que gente de todo el mundo se reúna y comparta ideas entre sí.

Nos gustaría que te involucres tanto como quieras y puedas. No obstante, si no quieres participar del desarrollo y lo que te apetece es darnos un poco de dinero para apoyar este proyecto, nos parece fantástico también. Estamos muy agradecidos de cualquier contribución que puedas hacer. Revisa todos los regalos que ofrecemos y escoge el que más te apetezca.

¿Cómo vamos a usar el dinero?

En esta etapa no estamos tratando de recaudar dinero para terminar el juego, sólo estamos buscando financiación para el desarrollo. Estamos en contacto con grandes desarrolladores de juegos que están muy interesados ​​en ayudarnos a hacer esto una realidad. Estamos seguros de que lo harán, pero antes de invertir en este proyecto necesitamos presentarles un concepto totalmente desarrollado, con arte finales y prototipos básicos. Estamos ante un reto emocionante y encantados de invitarte a ser parte de esta comunidad especial.

Nuestro objetivo es recaudar $ 50.000 pero, como casi siempre, cuantos más fondos podamos conseguir mejor, Sin embargo, si no conseguimos obtener los fondos suficiente para desarrollar este juego tenemos la intención de donar todas vuestras donaciones a MSF. Por supuesto, si hay algo de dinero sobrante de la fase de desarrollo también lo donaremos a MSF. Por favor, asegúrate que este planteamiento te gusta antes de donar en esta campaña IndieGoGo.

Aquí tienes más detalle acerca de cómo planeamos utilizar el dinero que recaudemos:

  • Desarrollo del concepto con los desarrolladores de juegos y los productores ejecutivos Playback Interactive, Mediadante, 2conleche (los productores) y, por supuesto, Médicos sin Fronteras y tú, como parte la comunidad que se una a esta aventura.
  • Propuesta gráfica, storyboard, prototipos y maquetas
  • Talleres para personal de campo de MSF con amplia experiencia en el mundo real. Buscamos conocer su experiencia para hacer un juego lo más realista posible.
  • Prueba del concepto con jugadores y estudio de mercado.
  • Creación de un paquete visualmente emocionante para presentar a los posibles inversores del juego.
  • Costes relacionados con las reuniones con inversores en el Reino Unido y en el extranjero. Buscamos que nos digan: "Sí, queremos ser parte de este nuevo mundo de juegos sociales".

¿De qué otras formas beneficiará este juego a Médicos sin Fronteras?

El juego estará directamente vinculada a un Foro (gestionado por anewmission.org) - online para debatir y discutir "misiones" dentro del juego y los problemas del mundo real.

El objetivo del juego es entretener, educar, crear conciencia y obtener fondos para MSF.

El objetivo último del foro es crear una herramienta que MSF puede utilizar para consultar a la comunidad de jugadores sobre necesidades que surjan en el terreno.

El primer desafío, o "misión", de este foro será hacer realidad este juego, pues como te hemos contado queremos que la comunidad no sólo participe con ayudas económicas sino que se involucre en el desarrollo del mismo. ¿Estás listo para jugar?

¿Quién es el equipo?

Médicos Sin Fronteras (MSF) - desde aquellos en primera línea hasta las personas que trabajan en la parte administrativa de MSF están entusiasmados con las posibilidades de compartir sus experiencias extraordinarias con el mundo y la posibilidad de llegar a nuevos públicos.

Mediadante - premiados documentalistas, este equipo ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo para encontrar nuevas maneras de contar la historia de MSF y encontrar nuevas vías de financiación para que el trabajo de esta ONG siga adelante. Rosie Garthwaite, autora del premiado libro How To Avoid Being Killed in a War Zone, da una tercera parte de sus beneficios a MSF y es parte de la inspiración de este juego.

2conleche - Una consultora de estrategia digital especializada en crear dinámicas de interacción (gamificación) entre los contenidos y su público. Dirigida por Edu Celorio participa en varios proyectos exitosos como tusrelatos.com, la mayor comunidad de relatos en español, y varios juegos de trivia producidos en distintos formatos.

Anew Mission - Una empresa joven que conecta el mundo para hacer el bien. Esta empresa ha desarrollado la plataforma, el foro, que se va a utilizar para co-crear el juego. Esta plataforma ha sido diseñada para fomentar la innovación colaborativa y tiene como objetivo enseñarnos cómo resolver problemas de forma creativa.

Playback Interactive -  fundada en 2014 con el objetivo de producir aplicaciones de alta calidad e innovadores títulos para plataformas móviles. A ellos les gusta producir prototipos rápidos y obtener retroalimentación de los usuarios para determinar buenos proyectos que merezca la pena perseguir a tiempo completo. Buscan entregar una experiencia lo más agradables posible a los usuarios. En febrero de este año firmaron un acuerdo con  All 4 Games, un brazo de Channel 4 creado para apoyar el talento creativo en el sector de juegos móviles.
