They should be our role models, so let’s create a game that unlocks the humanitarian inside all of us.What do we need from you?Doctors Without Borders (MSF) is backing this project and has offered ongoing collaboration and support but as a medical aid charity they are unable to contribute financially with their donor’s money.So, to make this game a reality, we need your financial support, but as well as sourcing funds, we also recruiting your beautiful minds, your imagination, your ability to problem solve, and your curiosity! We want your help to create this amazing game and no previous experience or coding knowledge is necessary. You’ve all seen the power of crowdfunding, and your donations will help us get the game off the ground, but what we really want is your help to create the game itself.A community of gamersThrough a specially designed forum (run by ANewMission.org), we will  brainstorm ideas and collaborate on how to create a mobile game that will directly impact Doctors Without Borders’ (MSF) work. Alongside MSF staff and top game designers, our IndieGoGO backers will be part of a dynamic community focused on making an innovative mobile game with real impact, the likes of which has never been done!Development of the game will  happen over several months but as a community member you'll be free to dip in and out of the project, contributing as much or as little as you’d like. By crowdsourcing ideas in this way, we believe the process will be fun and creative, and allow people from all over the world to come together and bounce ideas off each other!We’d like you to be involved in any way you can, but  if you’d just like to give some money to support this project, that’s fantastic too.  We are incredibly grateful for any contribution you can make and we’re offering some great perks so check them out.How will we use the money?At this stage, we are not trying to raise money for a  finished  game - we’re just seeking development funding. We are in touch with big games developers and they are already very interested in helping us make the game.  We are confident they will, but they need a fully developed pitch, complete with artwork, and basic prototypes before they invest. It’s a seriously exciting challenge, and we are thrilled to invite you to be a part of this special community.We’re seeking $50,000 but of course, the more we can raise, the further we can take this game. However, if we don’t raise enough to develop this game any further we plan to donate it to MSF. In addition, if there’s any money left over from the development phase, we would donate that to MSF as well - so please make sure you're happy for us to do that before donating to this IndieGoGo campaign.   So here’s a bit more detail about how we plan to use the money we raise:-  Development of the concept  with games developers and executive producers Games 4 Change, Mediadante (the producers),  2conleche and of course Doctors Without Borders and the our IndieGoGo community- Commissioning storyboard artists, prototypes, and mock-ups  -  Providing workshops for for MSF field staff  with extensive real-world  experience so they can be a part of the development phase to make it as realistic as possible.-  Testing of the concept with gamers and market research.-  The creation of a visually exciting package online and in print that we can present to the game developers-  Economy travel to and from investors meetings in the UK and abroad so they can say, “Yes, let’s enter this brave new world of socially beneficial gaming together”.Who’s on  the team?Doctors Without Borders (MSF) - from the frontline to the back office people across MSF are excited about the possibilities of sharing their everyday extraordinary experiences with the world and the opportunity to reach new audiences.Mediadante - award-winning documentary makers, this team has long worked to find fresh ways to tell MSF's story and new paths for easy donations to keep their work alive. Rosie Garthwaite's award-winning book which gives a third of its profits to MSF, How To Avoid Being Killed in a War Zone, is part of the inspiration for this game.Eduardo Celorio - the founder of 2conleche,  A digital strategy consulting company specialising in creating interaction and gamification between content and the audience. The company is involved in several successful projects such as tusrelatos.com, the largest community of short stories in Spanish, and several trivia games produced in different formats.Anew Mission – A young company that connects the world in doing good. They have built the platform we will be using to co-create the game. It has been especially designed for collaborative innovation. And teaches us how to solve problems creatively.Playback Interactive - was formed in 2014 with the goal of producing high quality, innovative titles on mobile platforms. They like to produce rapid prototypes and get quick user feedback to determine good projects to pursue full time and also to deliver the most enjoyable experiences possible for potential users. As of February this year they signed a publishing deal with All 4 Games, a games publishing arm of Channel 4 set up to support creative talent within the mobile games sector. CASTELLANOMSF - [IT’S NO GAME]¡Salvar vidas nunca es fácil! Y cuando estás en la primera línea de zonas de guerra, ante enfermedades mortales o frente a desastres naturales es casi imposible.Estamos creando un juego móvil que te permitirá ponerte en la piel de Médicos Sin Fronteras (MSF) y vivir lo que significa trabajar para salvar vidas en las condiciones más extremas y con recursos limitados.Es sencillo sentarse en el sofá, ver las noticias que provienen del otro lado del mundo y pensar: “esto es horrible, quiero hacer algo”. La realidad es que pocas personas pueden realmente hacer algo para que cambien las cosas. El personal de Médicos Sin Fronteras sí puede, y cada día arriesgan sus vidas para salvar a personas que viven y sufren en lugares muy, muy lejanos.Desde Mediadante (productores de "Escape de Isis" documental nominado a un BAFTA) y 2conleche (consultora estratégica de marketing online) queremos trabajar contigo para hacer un juego de gran alcance que, solo por jugarlo, te dé la oportunidad de marcar la diferencia y ayudar a los más necesitados.¿Qué es It’s No Game?Un juego móvil que da a los jugadores la oportunidad de experimentar por sí mismos las situaciones impensables a las que se enfrentan los trabajadores humanitarios en la primera línea de los conflictos, epidemias y desastres naturales. Basado en el trabajo de la ONG de ayuda médica, Médicos Sin Fronteras (MSF), estamos ante un juego divertido y un poco adictivo (en el buen sentido), que te dará la oportunidad de hacer un verdadero impacto en el mundo a través del intercambio de conocimientos (Crowd-Knowledge)y donaciones directas a MSF.Antes de entrar en detalles queremos dejar claro que en última instancia, queremos que el juego sea construido, inventado y reinventado por ti: el jugador. Hemos establecido las líneas básicas pero todo, desde el título final, la historia, los escenarios e incluso el logotipo, se creará en colaboración con nuestra comunidad de jugadores.La dinámica básica del juego podría ser similar a Plague Inc., This War of Mine, The Sims o cualquier otro juego de estrategia en tiempo real. Los jugadores tienen que resolver problemas con recursos limitados mientras luchan contra fuerzas fuera de su control.Hay diferentes personajes para elegir, (que son los diferentes profesionales que trabajan en MSF) y múltiples escenarios en los que podrías encontrarte.El juego se desarrolla en una región imaginaria del mundo en la que todo desastre potencial es posible.A través de diferentes retos los usuarios deberán aprender los controles del juego y las diferentes actividades de cada personaje (todos los profesionales que acuden con MSF en sus misiones: médicos, enfermeras, constructores, especialistas en logística, responsables de comunicación, etc.).A continuación entras en la piel de una de estas personas - creas, construyes y terminas por convertirte en tu propio héroe. Tienes que tomar decisiones de vida o muerte.Una vez llegue el primer desastre, no vas a poder parar. Conforme avanzas en el juego los desastres te seguirán golpeando y creciendo en dificultad.Cada escenario o "misión" se introduce con una secuencia de vídeo que puede incluir imágenes de archivo de emergencias reales que ya han sucedido. Esto ayudará a los jugadores a que puedan comprender mejor el mundo imaginario del juego y la realidad que este mundo refleja. Además, los jugadores podrán ir al foro para averiguar más acerca de lo sucedido en el pasado, obtener contexto y contenidos de ayuda para ser más eficiente en la misión. Además, el foro servirá para discutir acontecimientos y problemas del mundo real.El usuario también debe construir diferentes instalaciones; hospitales de campaña, refugios, campos de refugiados y estaciones de saneamiento y agua potable para ayudar en la misión.Cada misión sucede en el mismo mundo virtual. Lo que cambia son las diferentes emergencia que se van desarrollando:
Desastres naturales - terremotos, inundaciones, huracanes, tsunamis
Hambruna
Guerras y conflictos armados
Epidemias de enfermedades
Extrema pobreza - efectos sobre la salud a largo plazo
¿Por qué hacemos este juego?
Nos gustaría contar la historia de MSF a través de un juego para móviles con la finalidad de: el fin de:
Sensibilizar a la población de las emergencias humanitarias y los problemas de salud mundiales.
Crear una comunidad de jugadores con mentalidad social alrededor del trabajo de Médicos Sin Fronteras (MSF).
Ayudar a aumentar los fondos de esta valiente ONG para que pueda continuar su trabajo en más de 60 países.
Aunque el juego se desarrolla en un mundo de ficción, se basa en la rica veta de historias reales y experiencias del personal de MSF en respuesta a acontecimientos como la epidemia de Ébola en África occidental, la crisis humanitaria en Siria y los terremotos en Nepal y Haití.Este juego es único en su capacidad de permitir que los jugadores ayuden a personas reales al otro lado del planeta a través de un botón “donar” - que enviará dinero directamente a MSF.Los desafíos físicos, médicos, morales y logísticos a los que Médicos Sin Fronteras se enfrenta bajo extrema presión, son una realidad diaria para los voluntarios de esta organización. El personal de MSF tiene un conjunto de herramientas (vehículos, equipos médicos, hospitales inflables, etc.) y recursos (medicamentos, combustible, personal, etc.) que tienen que usar y administrar con gran cuidado y experiencia. También toman decisiones de vida o muerte, cómo dónde y cuándo intervenir en una situación de emergencia humanitaria. Estas decisiones determinan el destino de miles de personas.¿Quiénes son Médicos Sin Fronteras?Médicos sin Fronteras (también conocido por su nombre en francés MEDECINS SANS FRONTIERES o "MSF" para abreviar) es una organización internacional de ayuda humanitaria y Premio Nobel de la Paz, que fue fundada en Francia en 1971. Hoy en día es una fuerza global con más de 30.000 empleados que ayudan a muchas de las personas más desesperadas del mundo. Son personas que dejan sus trabajos, salen de su zona de confort y dejan a sus familias para trabajar en MSF como médicos, enfermeros, especialistas en logística, expertos en potabilización de agua y saneamiento y en muchas otros roles necesarios. MSF es una de las ONG más eficiente del mundo y con mayor impacto. Para la mayoría de nosotros es casi imposible comprender sus historias, valentía y los retos diarios a los que se enfrentan para lograr llevar los tratamientos más básicos a los lugares afectados por desastres. Estos sí son héroes reales, muy diferentes de los que la cultura popular nos ofrecer. Deben ser nuestros modelo, y por esta razón vamos a crear este juego con el fin de abrir la vena humanitaria dentro de todos nosotros.Nuestro objetivo es llegar más allá de la narración básica y dar a la gente una visión real de lo que es ser parte de un equipo de MSF que trabaja en condiciones extremas.¿Qué necesitamos de ti?Médicos Sin Fronteras (MSF) apoya este proyecto y nos ha ofrecido su colaboración permanente, pero como organización benéfica que son no son capaces de contribuir económicamente con el dinero de sus donantes.Por lo tanto, para hacer este juego una realidad, necesitamos tu apoyo financiero. Pero además de los fondos de abastecimiento, también necesitamos tu creatividad, tu imaginación, tu capacidad para resolver problemas y tu curiosidad. Queremos que tu ayuda para crear este juego increíble. No es necesarios tener experiencia previa o conocimiento de programación. Todos conocemos el poder del crowdfunding y sí, tus donaciones nos ayudarán a conseguir que el juego despegue, pero lo que realmente queremos es tu ayuda para crear el juego en sí mismo.Una comunidad de jugadoresA través de un foro especialmente diseñado (desarrollado por ANewMission.org), vamos a pensar en ideas y colaborar en la forma de crear un juego para móviles que impactará directamente en el trabajo de Médicos Sin Fronteras (MSF). Junto con el personal de MSF y los mejores diseñadores de juegos, nuestros patrocinadores Indiegogo serán parte de una comunidad dinámica centrada en hacer un juego para móviles innovador y con impacto real como nunca se ha hecho.El desarrollo del juego durará varios meses, pero como miembro de la comunidad serás libre de entrar y salir del proyecto y de contribuir tanto o tan poco como desees. Creemos que esta forma para generar ideas va a ser divertido y creativo. Sobretodo va a permitir que gente de todo el mundo se reúna y comparta ideas entre sí.Nos gustaría que te involucres tanto como quieras y puedas. No obstante, si no quieres participar del desarrollo y lo que te apetece es darnos un poco de dinero para apoyar este proyecto, nos parece fantástico también. Estamos muy agradecidos de cualquier contribución que puedas hacer. Revisa todos los regalos que ofrecemos y escoge el que más te apetezca.¿Cómo vamos a usar el dinero?En esta etapa no estamos tratando de recaudar dinero para terminar el juego, sólo estamos buscando financiación para el desarrollo. Estamos en contacto con grandes desarrolladores de juegos que están muy interesados ​​en ayudarnos a hacer esto una realidad. Estamos seguros de que lo harán, pero antes de invertir en este proyecto necesitamos presentarles un concepto totalmente desarrollado, con arte finales y prototipos básicos. Estamos ante un reto emocionante y encantados de invitarte a ser parte de esta comunidad especial.Nuestro objetivo es recaudar $ 50.000 pero, como casi siempre, cuantos más fondos podamos conseguir mejor, Sin embargo, si no conseguimos obtener los fondos suficiente para desarrollar este juego tenemos la intención de donar todas vuestras donaciones a MSF. Por supuesto, si hay algo de dinero sobrante de la fase de desarrollo también lo donaremos a MSF. Por favor, asegúrate que este planteamiento te gusta antes de donar en esta campaña IndieGoGo.Aquí tienes más detalle acerca de cómo planeamos utilizar el dinero que recaudemos:
Desarrollo del concepto con los desarrolladores de juegos y los productores ejecutivos Playback Interactive, Mediadante, 2conleche (los productores) y, por supuesto, Médicos sin Fronteras y tú, como parte la comunidad que se una a esta aventura.
Propuesta gráfica, storyboard, prototipos y maquetas
Talleres para personal de campo de MSF con amplia experiencia en el mundo real. Buscamos conocer su experiencia para hacer un juego lo más realista posible.
Prueba del concepto con jugadores y estudio de mercado.
Creación de un paquete visualmente emocionante para presentar a los posibles inversores del juego.
Costes relacionados con las reuniones con inversores en el Reino Unido y en el extranjero. Buscamos que nos digan: "Sí, queremos ser parte de este nuevo mundo de juegos sociales".
¿De qué otras formas beneficiará este juego a Médicos sin Fronteras?El juego estará directamente vinculada a un Foro (gestionado por anewmission.org) - online para debatir y discutir "misiones" dentro del juego y los problemas del mundo real.El objetivo del juego es entretener, educar, crear conciencia y obtener fondos para MSF.El objetivo último del foro es crear una herramienta que MSF puede utilizar para consultar a la comunidad de jugadores sobre necesidades que surjan en el terreno.El primer desafío, o "misión", de este foro será hacer realidad este juego, pues como te hemos contado queremos que la comunidad no sólo participe con ayudas económicas sino que se involucre en el desarrollo del mismo. ¿Estás listo para jugar?¿Quién es el equipo?Médicos Sin Fronteras (MSF) - desde aquellos en primera línea hasta las personas que trabajan en la parte administrativa de MSF están entusiasmados con las posibilidades de compartir sus experiencias extraordinarias con el mundo y la posibilidad de llegar a nuevos públicos.Mediadante - premiados documentalistas, este equipo ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo para encontrar nuevas maneras de contar la historia de MSF y encontrar nuevas vías de financiación para que el trabajo de esta ONG siga adelante. Rosie Garthwaite, autora del premiado libro How To Avoid Being Killed in a War Zone, da una tercera parte de sus beneficios a MSF y es parte de la inspiración de este juego.2conleche - Una consultora de estrategia digital especializada en crear dinámicas de interacción (gamificación) entre los contenidos y su público. Dirigida por Edu Celorio participa en varios proyectos exitosos como tusrelatos.com, la mayor comunidad de relatos en español, y varios juegos de trivia producidos en distintos formatos.Anew Mission - Una empresa joven que conecta el mundo para hacer el bien. Esta empresa ha desarrollado la plataforma, el foro, que se va a utilizar para co-crear el juego. Esta plataforma ha sido diseñada para fomentar la innovación colaborativa y tiene como objetivo enseñarnos cómo resolver problemas de forma creativa.Playback Interactive -  fundada en 2014 con el objetivo de producir aplicaciones de alta calidad e innovadores títulos para plataformas móviles. A ellos les gusta producir prototipos rápidos y obtener retroalimentación de los usuarios para determinar buenos proyectos que merezca la pena perseguir a tiempo completo. Buscan entregar una experiencia lo más agradables posible a los usuarios. En febrero de este año firmaron un acuerdo con  All 4 Games, un brazo de Channel 4 creado para apoyar el talento creativo en el sector de juegos móviles.

story:
Help us upgrade Leonardo Bridge to create the most exciting online bridge playing platform 


It’s true, we love playing bridge. That’s why we built Leonardo Bridge, one of the newest platforms for online bridge playing, completely on our own means. Now our vision is to take Leonardo a step further, by adding two innovative features that will cover all bridge players’ needs:

  • Play online bridge from any mobile device (smartphone or tablet)
  • Compete in live bridge tournaments

With these two major enhancements, Leonardo Bridge will become the most social, accessible and easy to use online platform, that will bring bridge even closer to our daily lives, like an ideal bridge club would.

Leonardo Bridge is the first online platform that was created on Facebook to offer bridge players a unique gaming experience, for free. It was officially launched in March 2015, and what makes it truly different is that Leonardo Bridge takes full advantage of Facebook’s platform and built-in tools, such as chats and friendships, to upraise online bridge to an almost face-to-face game experience. With Leonardo Bridge you always know who you are playing with, what they look like, where they live and what their interests are – along, of course, with their bridge playing level, rankings etc. Thus not only it becomes a personal experience, but it also helps you socialize, meet new people who love bridge as much as you and even meet them in real life for a partie libre!

 

Leonardo Bridge was created by bridge players for bridge fans of all levels, or even for new players who want to improve their skills by watching more experienced players. It is open 24/7 and already counts more than 7500 unique members from 35 different countries. Apart from the Facebook Game Page there is also an active Leonardo Facebook Group with more than 1.200+ members who share results and views on the deals played in the game. With many new members every day and an 80-minute average staying time in the game, Leonardo Bridge has become an online meeting point for bridge fans, and we are determined to take it a step further! 

Leonardo Bridge is currently open to all Facebook users, who want to play contract bridge against real people for free and without any time limit. When a user enters Leonardo’s facebook platform, he/she can either join an open table, create a table of her own or follow a specific table as a kibitzer (viewer). Users can invite their friends to play together, send and receive messages while playing, and have access to all other users’ daily or lifetime rankings.
You can check the full list of Leonardo's Bridge unique features, by clicking here

Leonardo Bridge offers one of the most stable environments to play bridge online, but at the moment there is one restriction: it only works for desktops and laptops. Wouldn’t it be far better if we were able to play from wherever we were and from any possible device? 

Allowing Leonardo to take over tablets & smartphones is our current goal! 

Another very important aspect that will upgrade our gaming experience is to enable Leonardo Bridge to host tournaments in real time, open to bridge fans from all over the world. 

Both these enhancements require help from professional developers and hardware upgrade, so this is where you come in the story. 


Bringing Leonardo Bridge to its current level has been a 100% individual initiative, by two Greek bridge enthusiasts who, empowered by their passion for the game, devoted their free time to create this unique platform so that all bridge lovers can have an online place to get together and get to know each other. The initial idea was to make this environment accessible to anyone, and this is why we haven’t considered Leonardo as a profit-making platform.

However, in order to further develop the game, we need to enlarge our team, and since there are no revenues coming from the game itself, we turned to Indiegogo’s crowdfunding platform. 

 

After many hours of calculations, we concluded that a 35.000 $ funding not only will enable us to employ the right professionals and acquire all the necessary software/hardware to upgrade Leonardo Bridge, but it will also allow us to help in our turn the “Athens Association of Alzheimer’s Disease and Related Disorder”. So when you claim any of our perks, your financial support will be distributed as follows:

  • 62% for App Design & Development for iOS & Android, Live tournaments Design & developemnt, hardware/software upgrade
  • 19% cost of perks
  • 14% Indiegogo, PayPal, taxes
  • 5% Donation to the “Athens Association of Alzheimer’s Disease and Related Disorder”

BEYOND MONEY: OTHER WAYS TO HELP US

Money makes the world go round, it’s true, but there are also other ways to help us make that great leap forward for online bridge playing.

  • Talk about Leonardo Bridge and our goals to your bridge partners and/or your association/club.
  • Share our Indiegogo campaign with the world by simply clicking on the social media links below
  • Write a story about us if you are a journalist or blogger
  • Feel free to give us feedback, concerning both our campaign and perks but also Leonardo Bridge at its current state! We look forward to meeting you at Leonardo’s Facebook Game Page.

Thank you a million for your support! 

Leonardo Bridge was conceived and designed by Achilles Charmpilas and Vasiliki Nika, two Greeks with a unique passion for bridge. Achilles has been developing computer programs for more than a decade. Vasiliki is a music composer, online marketing entrepreneur, member of the Greek Bridge Association and bridge instructor amongst other things. Together they have developed a wide variety of products, among which an innovative sports article generation engine. 
Leonardo is also supported by Konstantinos Kontomitros, a Greek Bridge expert, who is ready to share his knowledge and experience with bridge players in Leonardo Bridge, from all over the world. 
More details about the entire team you can find here.

We are offering a wide range of perks to cover all tastes and budgets. You can be among the first to have access to the new mobile LeonardoBridge App with as little as US$ 15, or get a Leonardo Mug, or a special Leonardo T-shirt or Leonardo Sweater, or all 3 of them by ordering the Leonardo Combo pack!

You can also enhance your bridge playing level with the Leonardo Masterclass perk, or by one of the very few Leonardo VIP members in live tournaments!

The new Leonardo Bridge is just a step away. But we can’t make this step without you.

Please make your contribution before our campaign expires, to help us raise the necessary 35.000 $ for the Leonardo Bridge upgrade.

marketing entrepreneur, member of the Greek Bridge Association and bridge instructor amongst other
things. Together they have developed a wide variety of products, among which an innovative sports article generation engine. 

Leonardo is also supported by Konstantinos Kontomitros, a Greek Bridge expert, who is ready to share his knowledge and experience with bridge players in Leonardo Bridge, from all over the world. 
More details about the entire team you can find here.
 


We are offering a wide range of perks to cover all tastes and budgets. You can be among the first to have access to the new mobile LeonardoBridge App with as little as US$ 15, or get a Leonardo Mug, or a special Leonardo T-shirt or Leonardo Sweater, or all 3 of them by ordering the Leonardo Combo pack!


You can also enhance your bridge playing level with the Leonardo Masterclass perk, or by one of the very few Leonardo VIP members in live tournaments!
The new Leonardo Bridge is just a step away. But we can’t make this step without you.
Please make your contribution before our campaign expires, to help us raise the necessary 35.000 $ for the Leonardo Bridge upgrade.

story:
Mosha Online

Mosha Online is an Online Social Multiplayer RPG that helps you connect and interact with your friends and other players around the globe through a virtual space also known as the Dream World.

 

Game Mechanics:

The following features represent what I definitely want on the game, but is not yet fully implemented (that's why I humbly ask for your help):

Dreams are wonderful, but it's better to share those dreams. So, after creating your Dream World, you can upload your Theme, so that other players buy it and use it too! Keep creating incredible Dreams to increase your wealth in no time!

   

   Battle!

 

Battle against monsters, grab the loots and sell them to increment your wealth! Use Skills and Items to increase your chances of winning.

 

  Mementos

 

 

The Team

I've been working on Project Eden since 2008, now known as Mosha since 2016. Lot's of things have happened, but I've finally developed my in house engine! I've decided to come to Indiegogo to ask for the community's help!

I've been a game developer for almost 20 years now and this is my first game doing it all myself! One great advantage working alone is that I can really nail what I want with Mosha. Another one, is that I can save a lot of time by not having to be subordinate to anyone else in the decision making process.

One of the disadvantages to being a one-man team is that I cannot produce enough content as fast as a multi-person team. I try to keeping things simple. Often the simple solution ends up being better anyway!

 

What Mosha Needs!

Work on Mosha has been steadily going for just over a year. It has really been amazing, but the most important challenge is budget. To get all things working for the next 10 months, Mosha needs roughly $35,000 USD, so lets get going!

 

Stretch Goal

Because Mosha is a project that will release sooner than later, I must clarify that Mosha will release before all content is finished and will receive further support from me.

$35,000 USD / enough to help me finish Mosha but I still need to keep my current Job.

$50,000 USD / Will help me work full time on Mosha, which means I will be able to deliver even sooner!

 

REWARDS

!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡​¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡​¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡​¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡

 

Risks & Challenges

Game development can be cruel, and there is always risk, specially with a limited budget that threatens your own wallet, right?

I'm at a point in life when things get a little more complicated. It costs a lot of money to make a game, and I have erred on the lower side of what is needed for this game. Anything past the  goal will allow me to continue working on Mosha. Otherwise, I will have to get another job and Mosha may take years to complete.

BUT! You can trust me, I will finish Mosha! It has become my ultimate goal :)

 

Merchandising

 

Other ways you can get Involved!

We understand that not everyone has the financial ability to contribute, but that certainly doesn't mean you can't help in other ways.

  • FOLLOW us on Facebook, Twitter & Youtube and join the discussion!
  • Please! SHARING the project with others on Facebook, Twitter and other social media and encouraging others to join the campaign is JUST as important and helpful! Be sure to use Hashtags #MoshaOnline  or #GoGoMosha !
     

Mosha really needs your help. To achieve funding, you can help Mosha by telling everyone and sharing this project with all your contacts. That way, we can increase exposure of the project. That's it!

 

P.S.

There's a lot of passion on Mosha! I believe there's power in community: gamers, players, designers, fans, reviewers, youtubers, journalists: let's grow this amazing community!

This is a game I want to make and a dream I believe in. Thank you for your support, patience, and trust.

Remember, share this campaign with everyone!

Mosha really needs your help. To achieve funding, you can help Mosha by telling everyone and sharing this project with all your contacts. That way, we can increase exposure of the project. That's it!
 
P.S.
There's a lot of passion on Mosha! I believe there's power in community: gamers, players, designers, fans, reviewers, youtubers, journalists: let's grow this amazing community!
This is a game I want to make and a dream I believe in. Thank you for your support, patience, and trust.
Remember, share this campaign with everyone!

story:
Seven Mysteries: The Last Page is a supernatural horror RPG. The game will be available for Windows, Mac, iOS and Android.

That night, at the only school of a small town, a group of students unintentionally discovered their school had been hiding things that should have been left unknown. Every student knew about the tales of what happened there, except them. Then, unknowingly, the unacquainted students were somehow connected to uncover the hidden. Together they try to open doors, hoping they would clear away the fog. However, soon will their realization come when all the pieces of the final puzzle gather. All will fall into dead silence with the same thought... about why they crossed each other's path in the very beginning. 

Seven Mysteries: The Last Page is divided into 11 chapters. In the game, you'll play as 3 main characters: Sang, Nathan, and Neal.

The gameplay differs between each chapter. Some of them require you to pay attention to your surroundings and some require you to run and hide. You'll have to follow the storyline and figure out what happened in the past and what's happening at present.

  • Multiplatform Support: Windows, Mac, Android and iOS.
  • Multiple playable characters: Take control of the three main characters and uncover their stories.
  • Secret Items: Gather all hidden items for the hints to unlock that which resolves everything, the last chapter.

  • Varied Gameplay: Search for treasure, hide and seek, and make decisions that will affect the ending.

 

Title Screen

Treasure Hunting

 

Where Do the Funds Go?

All the funds will be used for commissioning Assets, Music, and Sound Design. The music will be composed by composer Myuu once the campaign reaches its goal. 

    Risks & Challenges

    We are doing flexible funding so backers can still get their rewards even if the campaign doesn't get funded. We'll continue to develop the game and do our best to improve it.   

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't back the project, you can still help it by telling about the project to your friends and family. Also, we'd be extremely grateful if you share the Indiegogo Campaign page. The campaign will reach its goal faster with your help.

story:
Like us on our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/DigitalGoldGames

Follow us on our Twitter page: https://twitter.com/DigitalGGames

What is “Reclaim”? It is a third-person, adventure puzzler game in which you have one very important mission: to recover Earth’s long lost history.  Earth has become inhospitable due to catastrophic events caused by humans, forcing them to evacuate the planet and colonize others. Centuries later, humanity sends a robot to Earth to recover our long lost history for us to share to our future generations. 

After centuries of not being on Earth, humans don’t know how the atmosphere has changed, or what they will encounter on the planet, so they send Space Probe Centurion model VLKR-5 to explore it. The probe has been equipped with state-of-the-art life support systems, the latest in radar and scanning technologies, and an exoskeleton made to withstand even the harshest of climates, be it bone-chilling cold temperatures or rock-melting heat. All of these capabilities will be at the player’s disposal, and are essential to exploring the familiar but unknown Earth. The player has to find any source of information that contains pieces of our history, and convert it to Bits that will grant you Knowledge. This Knowledge is used to unlock upgrades for the probe. Some upgrades require a specific Knowledge level, so collecting as much Bits as possible is essential and ultimately the goal of your mission. Wait, so a game based purely on exploration? Well, not exactly. There will be enemies for you to overcome, but we can’t spoil the story now, can’t we. The only thing we will say is this: you are not the first probe sent to Earth.

We plan on releasing the game in "episodes", each ending with a major boss challenge to overcome. This allows us to work on each episode as hard as possible to deliver the highest quality that each one of you deserves out of a game. And as an added bonus, Indiegogo backers that donate on a tier that includes the game will have access to all episodes, and an extra episode just for you! This is our first major game and we want to make it as beautiful and great as possible, and with your help, we are sure that we are going to succeed in delivering an extraordinary experience. We will be publishing the game on Steam for PC, but if we exceed our goal, then we will try to release it for consoles also.



 We are aware that there is a chance that we surpass our funding goal. There are other things that we'd like to do in the game if we have the chance. The following shows part of the things we would like to accomplish if the initial goal is exceeded:


What We Need & What You Get

  • The amount we need to make this project a reality is $125,000. We are an emerging company, so we need to acquire the commercial licenses to be able to publish our game. We need Autodesk Maya, Pixologic Zbrush, the Adobe Creation Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.), the Quixel Suite, and others. These programs are used to create the 3D aspect of the game, what gamers see when they play a game. These programs are expensive, but if we can't acquire them, we can't make the game. So we need your support to make our dream come true.
  • Part of the funds will also go towards fulfilling the backers' rewards. There are a couple of physical rewards, so we want to give you the best quality rewards possible.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will still use whatever money we do get towards the programs, those are the most important we need to complete this project.

Risks & Challenges

This is our first major game, one we are very excited and proud to make, but we know, as is the case with any major endeavor, that somewhere along the road something unexpected may happen that delays the game. Digital Gold Games is committed to delivering an unforgettable experience, but to do so, we can not only rely on your support, we have to make our part in listening to what the backers want and need, because ultimately, more than backers, you are gamers that are waiting to try out this new game. We aim to please, and we will be in constant communication with our backers, be it to solve any complaint, or to hear your feedback on what you would like to see in our game.

We understand that it is a great risk to back an emerging company in its first project, but rest assured, we aim to work on this project with the integrity and respect you all deserve. Our major challenge is time, because we are two developers at the moment, but if we reach our goal, we are going to be able to work comfortably and with every asset at our disposal. We invite you to embark on this journey with us, you won't be disappointed.

Other Ways You Can Help

We get that some of you are not able to donate to our project. That's OK! You can also help us by telling other people you know about our game, and to help us by backing our project. Every help counts, so let's make this project come true!

story:
Intro

Hello from Greece, my name is Thomas Karkaletsos  - for the most of you a bit difficult to pronounce it :-) - and I am coming from Athens, Greece. The last 7 years I leave in Santorini and I am involved in tourism. Driving around Santorini, made me notice that from the highest spots of Santorini’s roads, the terraced terrain with the small white houses looks like a board of a game. So Santopoly was born...

Santopoly is a board game based on the famous real estate board game. In the board you can find the villages and areas of Santorini and all the chance and community chest cards refer to Santorini as a touristic destination. In the front part of the cards there is a picture and a small text regarding each area that will help you “travel” to this unique island or plan your journey there, receiving precious information about it.



The houses and hotels (cave houses) have been designed and made by a local artist of the island and could themselves be a beautiful Cycladic decorative for your place.

The game is 100% made in Greece. All the printings will be made by a company involved in board games that is based in Athens and all the figurines of the game will be made by a small company on Santorini.

What You Get

The Box contains :

  • 1 board with the villages of Santorini
  • 22 cards of villages of Santorini with photo and text
  • Chance and community chest cards
  • 32 handmade houses
  • 16 handmade cavehouses (hotels)
  • 6 figures
  • 2 dice
  • 1 package of money


Playing Santopoly Board Game

With Santopoly board game you can play an already successful game, have fun with your family and friends, “travel” to Santorini through its pictures, plan your trip to the island using the various information that each card gives to you or even use its figurines as decoratives for your place.

In Greece nowadays can be very difficult to support economically a new idea. You can be the first to support Santopoly to make it happen!

Please share the project, make some noise about Santorini, make some noise about the creative part of Greece!

story:
What is this again?

Project OpenHattan is an initiative with a specific goal to create an accurate and complete virtual Manhattan. We think it is time gamers are finally given a realistic, detailed, real-scale, authentic 3D model to play with. We want to recreate every building, street, sidewalk and park as an exact top-quality textured 3D model. All of it made specifically to be used in real-time applications and games. 


Our idea is to harness the power of the gaming and CG community and create a virtual urban environment of before unseen size and detail. That's 70000 buildings in a 21km x 5km area and over 800km of streets. 

Just to give you an idea of the scale, here is a comparison with some of the best virtual cities:

Once created, the model will be FREE to use by ANYONE. So, whether you are a gamer, CG artist, developer or a virtual tourist there are enough reasons to get excited about bringing the FIRST EVER complete and detailed  3D model of Manhattan to the public.

All the funds from this campaign will go into creating the resource. Most of it will go back to the modding and CG communities as rewards for creating 3D models. Anyone with the required skills can participate in the modeling stage and GET PAID in return. (read on for more on that)

Impact

Just what would the existence of such a massive resource mean to the gaming and CG scene? 

We think it will create a big splash and see customers benefiting in several ways: 

  • Gamers get the ultimate urban playground. Manhattan is not only huge, it is astonishing. Diverse and rich neighborhoods intertwine to create the greatest borough of the greatest city. You could spend months just exploring areas and finding hidden jewels everywhere.
  • Developers gain a free setting for their projects, allowing them to focus time and money into the rest of their pipelines. Eventually gamers will get to enjoy new ideas and developments in better and more polished games. 
  • CG artists can utilize a free resource for both their professional and personal projects, saving them time and money while improving the quality of their work.
  • Virtual explorers will be able to roam the streets of Manhattan in the virtual reality of Occulus Rift or similar products. Imagine flying over central park, between downtown skyscrapers or under the Manhattan bridge.


What do you get for contributing?

Being excited about a studio, modder or an indie dev building something around the virtual Manhattan is not the only reason to contribute to the cause. There's actual stuff you will get if we hit the goal.
  • Every backer will receive an Occulus Rift enabled playable demo featuring the complete Manhattan model. You will be able to drive, walk or fly around and explore the city. It will be created either in Cryengine or UDK 4, granting it amazing visuals. Additional features may be added (we are open for suggestions). There will be multiple builds released to the backers, showing off the model throughout its modeling stages. (you won't have to wait long once modeling has started for the first glimpses of Manhattan)


  • You will also receive the entire 3D model complete with textures in multiple formats ready for import into real-time engines and applications. 

 (preview low-poly massing model)

  • Every, third party commercial project, featuring this 3D model will offer a discount to every contributor . We will be aiming for a discount of minimum $5 so you can get your contribution back with the first purchase and start saving onwards. (check perks for doubling the discount)

  • Anyone with enough experience in 3D modeling and texturing will be able choose a city block to model in our platform and GET PAID in return. (for rewards sizes check further down)
                           

What about existing models?

There are several sources that provide models and all of them are unusable not only because of the low detail level, but also due to the lack of commercial-use licenses. Google's, satellite-derived, model is the best out there and it still is miles away from what we need. 
Here is a comparison between google's model and the detail of OpenHattan.

We believe advances in technology should come from the content providers. As such we want to make the next step towards creating a realistic and immersive city environment. A detail level so high, coupled with the free-to-use nature of the resource, creates a thrilling new opportunity for the future virtual scene. 

We will create an experience that's the next best thing to actually being in Manhattan. (Occulus rift anyone?)
We are also excited to see what indie developers and studios will do with it and what new and creative ways to use it they'll come up with.

How are we going to do it?

1. Survey and data acquisition
We send a team to New York to survey Manhattan and take photos of each building, street or park. All the references will be taken with 3d modeling and texturing in mind (we have years of experience in that). We want to use real images for textures as much as possible for the highest realism and accuracy. This stage alone is a massive and expensive task. 

2. Platform
We make a platform (website) where we meet the funds gathered and 3D artists (modelers) who want to create buildings, parks, roads and whatever needs to be made and GET PAID in return. The island will be divided in blocks and a reward assigned to each block, depending on complexity. It should be reiterated that ANYONE can opt in to be a modeler. We will not be modeling buildings inhouse, the project relies on interested 3D modelers contributing their skills. (for reward sizes check further down)

3. Modeling 

Modelers send us 3D models of blocks they've chosen to model and we enforce quality control. We have access to experienced specialists in architectural modeling and game artists who can make sure every model is up to the needed standard. Our primary target for the usage of the model is realtime engines and games. Models will be textured and modeled accordingly with lower GPU and CPU usage in mind and utilization of real-time techniques for the best possible visuals.

4. We manage and piece the thousands of models, we have received, into a complete and seamless model.

5. We release the complete 3D model to be used freely for any kind of projects. The only rule is developers of commercial products (games, movies) will have to offer a discount to every backer of this campaign.

Money talk

This campaign is flexible, meaning even if the goal isn't reached we will still receive the funds and be able to perform a part of the task. There are multiple milestones which will guarantee certain stages of the whole project will get done.

1. $0-$10 000
If the project stays below the budget needed to go and survey city blocks on site we will use the money to create a couple of blocks from data available on the Internet and volunteer the work needed to model them. They will be put in a real-time engine and released to the public as a proof of concept. Keep in mind that not having data specially gathered for the purposes and having to do it for free will take longer.
2. $10 000 

If we collect this much we will be able to gather the data for 4 city blocks and publish it in a platform for people to to pick buildings to model. We will then import the 3D models in a real-time engine and release the build. It will serve as a technical demo to promote the project and attract more people to donate for the inclusion of more city blocks.

3. $30 000

That much will ensure the photographing and surveying an area the size of Little Italy. It will also cover attaching a reward of $1000 to each city block for anyone who creates it. The result will be released in a build of the real-time demo.

4. $30 000+

The more we collect the more we will include and the bigger the rewards  thus attracting more and better qualified CG artists.

5. $200 000

If we reach this milestione we can perform the whole survey of Manhattan, collect all the data needed and launch the platform to distribute the blocks to willing to contribute modelers. Even if this is all we get to do it will form a solid base for further efforts to accomplish the idea. It will not, however be enough to offer rewards for the modeling of the buildings.

Alternatively the money could be used to photograph a couple of Manhattan areas and offer rewards for modeling them in the platform. Similarly to the $30 000 milestone this will create an initial build of the demo to be used for promotion.

6. $ 200 000+

From this  amount up to the goal we can scale the scope of the task to accomodate the funds gathered. 

The top goal of the campaign is high and it is a measure of what is needed for the full job of creating 70 000 buildings and 800km or streets. However we will still be able to work with whatever we get and recreate a proportional area of Manhattan. How big and how soon it will be ready depends, off course, on the budget.

We see OpenHattan not as a business start-up but as an experiment in how much the world wants to have this resource. It is not a product, that will generate revenue once created and has no other funding sources. The crowd-funding campaign is its ultimate test and contributions are the votes “yay”.

Before donating, please be sure you will be ok with the project finishing this campaign below the $10 000 mark. You are donating to an idea, not a product.

We understand not everyone can donate and because reaching as many, possibly interested individuals, as possible is crucial for the “elections” to work we ask you to share on FB, tweet or just tell your friends. This could sometimes contribute to the project more than a donation would.


Time frames


  • Photographing all the buildings and streets and gathering all the data will take about 3-4 months.
  • Creating the online platform to distribute the funds and city blocks will take a couple of months.
  • The rest is up to the public. How much will contributors gather and respectively how many modelers we will attract and how motivated they will be to do the job quickly.
  • The making of the interactive demo will overlap with the modeling stage, so once all the models are done, it will virtually be ready too. (beta builds will be released during the modeling process so you get to walk the streets of Manhattan much earlier than the completion date)

Why Manhattan?

Maybe you are thinking we've seen enough of it. We have seen a lot, but it has mostly been the same stuff. All the famous sites have been well over-used and worn out. However, there is so much more to that borough than what we are shown in movies. When it comes to games, we've never had a city even close to being large enough to encompass the true attraction of Manhattan. 

It is the sheer size and diversity of areas and vibes that turn it into a place that can tell a 1000 stories. Many people don't realize how rich and intriguing this place is. It has a lot more to offer than Times square, Empire state building and Downtown. Some say you need to spend months with it to understand it. 

After all if you had one shot at doing this wouldn't it be Manhattan?

We understand having just the island is silly. You have to be able to see the rest of the boroughs and you will. We will create the visible, from the island, parts of the other boroughs for a complete immersion. 

About us

My name is Dimitar Tilev and I am the creator of the project. I've been involved in CG graphics for 9 years and I am a co-founder of an architectural visualization studio called VAYA (www.vaya.bg).

Over the years I've been in charge of many large-scale development projects that have required management of "street level detail" to "overview detail " relations.

Over the years I've established connections with every kind of specialist, I would need for this job. I can quickly assemble a team, of an appropriate size, for the next stages of the project.
story_txt:
What is this again?
Project OpenHattan is an initiative with a specific goal to create an accurate and complete virtual Manhattan. We think it is time gamers are finally given a realistic, detailed, real-scale, authentic 3D model to play with. We want to recreate every building, street, sidewalk and park as an exact top-quality textured 3D model. All of it made specifically to be used in real-time applications and games. 
Our idea is to harness the power of the gaming and CG community and create a virtual urban environment of before unseen size and detail. That's 70000 buildings in a 21km x 5km area and over 800km of streets. Just to give you an idea of the scale, here is a comparison with some of the best virtual cities:Once created, the model will be FREE to use by ANYONE. So, whether you are a gamer, CG artist, developer or a virtual tourist there are enough reasons to get excited about bringing the FIRST EVER complete and detailed  3D model of Manhattan to the public.All the funds from this campaign will go into creating the resource. Most of it will go back to the modding and CG communities as rewards for creating 3D models. Anyone with the required skills can participate in the modeling stage and GET PAID in return. (read on for more on that)ImpactJust what would the existence of such a massive resource mean to the gaming and CG scene? We think it will create a big splash and see customers benefiting in several ways: 

Gamers get the ultimate urban playground. Manhattan is not only huge, it is astonishing. Diverse and rich neighborhoods intertwine to create the greatest borough of the greatest city. You could spend months just exploring areas and finding hidden jewels everywhere.

Developers gain a free setting for their projects, allowing them to focus time and money into the rest of their pipelines. Eventually gamers will get to enjoy new ideas and developments in better and more polished games. 

CG artists can utilize a free resource for both their professional and personal projects, saving them time and money while improving the quality of their work.

Virtual explorers will be able to roam the streets of Manhattan in the virtual reality of Occulus Rift or similar products. Imagine flying over central park, between downtown skyscrapers or under the Manhattan bridge.
What do you get for contributing?Being excited about a studio, modder or an indie dev building something around the virtual Manhattan is not the only reason to contribute to the cause. There's actual stuff you will get if we hit the goal.

Every backer will receive an Occulus Rift enabled playable demo featuring the complete Manhattan model. You will be able to drive, walk or fly around and explore the city. It will be created either in Cryengine or UDK 4, granting it amazing visuals. Additional features may be added (we are open for suggestions). There will be multiple builds released to the backers, showing off the model throughout its modeling stages. (you won't have to wait long once modeling has started for the first glimpses of Manhattan)





You will also receive the entire 3D model complete with textures in multiple formats ready for import into real-time engines and applications. 


 (preview low-poly massing model)
Every, third party commercial project, featuring this 3D model will offer a discount to every contributor . We will be aiming for a discount of minimum $5 so you can get your contribution back with the first purchase and start saving onwards. (check perks for doubling the discount)
Anyone with enough experience in 3D modeling and texturing will be able choose a city block to model in our platform and GET PAID in return. (for rewards sizes check further down)

                           


What about existing models?There are several sources that provide models and all of them are unusable not only because of the low detail level, but also due to the lack of commercial-use licenses. Google's, satellite-derived, model is the best out there and it still is miles away from what we need. Here is a comparison between google's model and the detail of OpenHattan.






We believe advances in technology should come from the content providers. As such we want to make the next step towards creating a realistic and immersive city environment. A detail level so high, coupled with the free-to-use nature of the resource, creates a thrilling new opportunity for the future virtual scene. 

We will create an experience that's the next best thing to actually being in Manhattan. (Occulus rift anyone?)

We are also excited to see what indie developers and studios will do with it and what new and creative ways to use it they'll come up with.

We have access to experienced specialists in architectural modeling and game artists who can make sure every model is up to the needed standard. story:
RPG Style Coding

"I levelled to Java skill 80 after I finished the Bug Boss in the Repo Dungeon."

"I have cleared all quest in Advanced C++ tutorial."

Does this make sense to you? We see fun for developers & students.


You'll be able to download Code RPGify for free from our website once it's released (current eta, Nov 2016 if the funding succeeds). 

The rewards with PERKs are not available for cash, you can only reach those items by actually playing the game. We have no plan to make those IAP at least for now. 

It is not a coding tutorial game, it adds fun on top of your current and future programming assignments!

One more thing; We need your enthusiasm not only your funding. Love, feedbacks, fun ideas and your commitment. So we will open-source the client program and some of server logic(like calculating exp, skill-tree proposals etc) to GitHub when we're ready. We have a huge goal, we know we can't go without your help. Please share our goal and become our ally!


Code + Exp

Bring some fun and motivation into your coding life. Once our client is installed, you will start gaining exp while you code. You're coding Java in Eclipse, doing some C# in Visual Studio or hacking Javascript in Sublime Text? No matter what tool or language you use, we get them all.


The Code RPGify client utilizes the node fs.watch functionality. We're all programmers, so: inotify on linux, kqueue on OS X, ReadDirectoryChangesW on Windows. It depends on your OS, you get the point, don't you? ;-) Then it detects the programming language using atom linguist and analysis the amount of work. In this way you can use RPGify without any significant performance loss. And no worries! We don't cause any trouble, the client never actually reads your code or sends your code anywhere. The exp point is calculated by file size and timestamp with the file path being hashed and salted individually.


Get Equipments

Aren't you waiting for your fancy new laptop? I also want a new laptop however no money no laptop. I'm just surfing the news for the launching date & expectations, but I decided to make one and give it to my character :)

You can also make coins, not only exp points when you are coding. With the coins you've collected, you can buy your character a powerful laptop, a convenient mouse, a fancy new keyboard or widescreen monitor, it's up to you(or the liking of your character). Given gears boost your exp gain, coin digging and lower the fatigue.


Resume & Statistics

Having trouble remembering what projects you have worked on? RPGify will remember what the project was, which skills you used, how many months you worked on it and other interesting information, just for you. Oh and don't forget, there are also interesting statistics ready:

  • Yearly / monthly / weekly / dayly coding hours
  • Average coding hours during weekdays
  • Estimated compile time
  • Project details


So. Is this a Game or What?

Here is our humble beginning: We've taken the level and equipment system from RPG games so, yeah it is a game, for now.

And as you know there are tons of great systems and mechanics in RPG games, skill trees, guilds, raids, parties, quests, chats, etc. We imagine RPGify to be integrated with all of those systems from RPG games. We think of it as more than just another RPG game. You can learn coding using the tutorial quests, check necessary skills on your skill tree as a professional developer, manage your friends list and add them from any git commit in your commit history right away, Job recruiters will call out "Looking for more C++ developers". Yes, at the moment this is just imagination, but we're sure it is absolutely worth a shot. Although some of those ideas might be found to be poor or might be dropped for some other reason, we haven't faced yet.


So. Again. Isn't it just a game? We certainly want it become something beyond a simple game, but still, you can play it. The one thing that is different from games is we do not characters store on your local disk. A lower level doesn't mean you are a poor developer or vice versa. What a ridiculous idea detecting a person's coding level? We want you to become a better developer while you play and become rewarded with a higher skill level. Our goal is to form RPGify in a way, that it helps your real coding skills, while you enjoy programming and playing the game.


The following features won't come with the first version shipped, but hit the road shortly thereafter.

PLUG-IN

Sublime Text, Atom, Eclipse and many more editor plugins. Detecting the programming language through atom linguist on a file change event has it's limitation; In many cases a file includes more than just a single language. Imagine a HTML file, which includes languages such as JavaScript, CSS beside HTML. Later we want to solve this problem by developing editor plugins detecting language.

GITHUB & STACKOVERFLOW

Whenever you commit code on GitHub to your open source repository, answer questions on StackOverflow, you'll gain a bigger amount of experience points. RPGify itself is built on amazing open sources technology and we love to reward with higher exp gain when contributing to open source or public communities. In the future we plan to integrate many other services too.

SKILL-TREE

In the current version of RPGify can provide you with titles like "**language Developer" ("Html Developer", "Javascript Developer", or similar). In the next version we want to improve it to be represented as a skill tree. For example a "TypeScript Frontend Web Developer" knows HTML, JavaScript, CSS, TypeScript and so on.


Our first funding goal is $8,000. If the goal is achieved, any further money will buy us more time to stay focused on this project. Extended goals give us more months. Of course, our project goal is far beyond the funding. We will continue working on this project, no matter the funding goal is achieved or not, anyhow your help is highly appreciated and provides us with the option to start with a better services, earlier. For supporters who helped us, we came up with small gifts as a thank you. Feel free to contact us to reveal the secret perk and further details. Last but not least, for partners, we offer integrations to your service.

SHARE US, GET EXTRA

You want to show RPGify to your friends? Share this page or our site on your Facebook, Twitter or Google+, Beside of the INDIEGOGO rewards you will get a "Starter Package" which includes a basic laptop for your character and plenty of coins to dive right into them, just like Uncle Scrooge.

Our site : http://code.rpgify.com

Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/coderpgify

Twitter : https://twitter.com/coderpgify

Google+ :  https://plus.google.com/u/0/114292772929133818870

Email : code@rpgify.com

story:
Dragon's Dogma meets Tomb Raider meets Pen & Paper RPG

...and throw in a little Skyrim

Scions of Chaos: Prologue is the first installment in a multi-chapter series of games to be released over the next few years. Each chapter is a complete stand-alone game, but with clear ties to an over-arching story-line that spans time and genres. 

You are Princess Grais, a half-elf, the illegitimate child of the Queen of Fehrton. Thought to have died at the hands of bandits, you were given into the care of peasants in a local hunting village. There you grew to be a young woman with no knowledge of your royal lineage. When the King's agents discovered the truth of your whereabouts and of the Queen's infidelity, you were to be captured and executed. But the King's own champion, sworn to protect you, rescued you from the shadow of death. You must now embark on an epic quest to learn the truth of your heritage and the nature of your destiny. A great prophecy of doom hangs over the lands and you are a central player in the drama to unfold.

Basic
  • Third person player controls
  • Character leveling, skills, and power enhancement
  • Magic spells, magic archery, and telekinesis
  • Melee combat
  • Deep story and role-playing opportunities
  • Puzzles and traps
  • Climbing, jumping, ledge sliding, vaulting, swimming, pushing, and other interactive abilities
  • Skills that improve through failure 
  • Advanced weather effects (rain, snow)
  • Check points
  • Mini-Map
  • World Map
  • Quests
  • Crafting
Pen & Paper Concepts
The following concepts were inspired by traditional pen & paper (tabletop) role-playing gaming.

Search: Instead of having to physically search every square inch of an area, the player can initiate a skill-based search, which will reveal objects of interest in the immediate area by highlighting them. Depending on the character's skill level, the search can even reveal hidden or secret items such as secret doors.

Environment Clues: Things found in the environment can be essential for progressing in the game such as writing on a wall, an item on the ground, etc. For example, a quest could be triggered by simply finding a message scrawled on the wall that says "Griffon Inn. Ask for Brayden." 

Game master hints: Sometimes when someone is stuck when playing a P&P RPG, the GM may sense it and provide a little snippet of information to help the players progress. When GM hints are enabled, the player can opt to view one at any time. If a hint is available, the wise Game Master appears and gives the player some good advice on how best to proceed.

Simulated Sensory Perception (SSP): In a P&P RPG, players are often given detailed descriptions of an area or room when they first arrive. This is often embellished by the Game Master who can go so far as to tell the player what smells are in the air, the ambient temperature, or even how the place makes the character "feel." While a lot of this information is easily translated to the visuals that the player sees, there can still be a lot more information given to enrich the play experience. With SSP turned on, the player can see additional textual information when available that describes a place in more detail. Such information can also convey back story or historical facts about a place.

Scions of Chaos: Prologue is the first in a series of video game titles that span multiple genres. Prologue is a fantasy action/adventure RPG game with strong story elements and a firm foundation in pen & paper role-playing game traditions.

We at Magique Productions are passionate about making games and have a great desire to bring unique family friendly games to the PC and console gaming systems.

                          

My name is Thomas Scott. I'm the president and head game designer/programmer for Magique Productions, Ltd. I started programming games on the Commodore 64 back in 1984 and have been a fan of video games from the Atari 2600 era all the way up to present day. I'm an avid role-playing gamer and author of many role-playing game adventures. I've also written teleplays, having produced my own TV pilot that aired on local TV in Las Vegas, Nevada. By day, I've been a professional programmer for the past 25+ years. I've spent the last 13 years with a gaming company developing multimedia and game operating systems for video slot machines.

Scions of Chaos: Prologue is being developed on the Unity 5 game engine. We have spent that last year honing our skills on this platform and accumulating some of the best plugins and assets available. 

We find ourselves in a financial bind that threatens to halt our development on the Nintendo platform. Our invoice for the Nintendo Dev Kit was due on September 24th and, due to circumstances beyond our control, we were only able to pay about one-third of the total. We received an extension until November 14th, but find that we have not improved our financial situation. That is why we are reaching out to the gaming community for help to get us over this important hurdle and back on track.

Our first priority at this time is to get our Nintendo Dev Kit paid off and to help cover some of the development costs we've incurred thus far in regards to art and 3D content.  Here is the breakdown:

  • While we can't disclose the price of a Nintendo Dev kit, it is the first priority to get it paid off. Our deadline for paying for the kit was September 24th, 2015, but we've received an extension until November 14th, 2015. A portion of this funding goes immediately to paying off the dev kit.
  • We've incurred some costs in purchasing art and 3D content as well as 3rd party tools and scripts for speeding up the development process. We've invested in some of the best Unity assets available for making professional games. Some of the money will go to cover the costs we've already incurred out of pocket. 
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, all money will go towards payment of the Nintendo Dev Kit and we'll do whatever we can to come up with the difference.
  • If we should be so blessed to achieve funding beyond our development kit needs, all funds will go toward additional 3D content, music, and paying our development team for their efforts. If we see this escalate, I will update the campaign with additional stretch goals to match.
Important Note: This short term funding drive is primarily to pay for the Nintendo Dev Kit and some initial costs. However, if we reach our goal, the campaign shall continue indefinitely as part of Indiegogo's In-Demand program. But it is urgent that we raise the initial funds in the time-frame requested.
Update: Anticipating that our funding campaign might not go through, I contacted Nintendo and let them know we are not going to be able to meet the November 14th extension deadline. I said that the best I could expect to do is to pay a portion of the invoice every 2 weeks unless our sources came through. They were very understanding and have agreed to let us pay every 2 weeks until it's paid off. So we are not dead in the water and this game will definitely see the light of day on the Wii U console. 

That being said, we still want to push forward with getting this campaign funded. The more we can get toward the dev kit total, the faster we can make good on paying the invoice and getting back to focusing on making games. Please continue to spread the word on social media as we push forward.

Check out an older teaser trailer that shows off some additional features of the game.


Please Note: This fund raiser is for Scions of Chaos: Prologue only. All rewards apply only to the first installment of the game. And although it is our intention to create more chapters for the game, there are no guarantees that any other installments will be produced.

$10 - Contributor

Your name appears in the game manual and end game credits as a funding contributor and we thank you for your contribution.

$20 - Informed Gamer

Access to behind the scenes developer blogs, videos, and monthly developer chat. Access scheduled to begin on January 10th, 2016.

$25 - Beta Game Builds

Early access to beta builds of the PC game when available.

$30 - Game Shaper

Want to help shape the game with your input? You'll gain access to developer polls where you can cast your vote to help shape the game content and features.

$35 - Digital Game Download

Digital copy of the completed game on a single platform of choice. Console choice shall be limited to Wii U if additional console support is not unlocked in stretch goals.

$50 - Access to Alpha Game Builds

Access to alpha builds of the PC game when available.

$100 - Prototype Testing

Access to prototype tests of the PC game. These prototype tests shall consist of small PC applications for testing specific functionality for the game.

$500 - Co-Author (Limit 3)

Work with the game developers to include your own side quest to tie into the main story-line. You will provide a summary of the quest concept and our development team will work with you through e-mail, text and/or voice chat to refine the concept and insure it fits well within the game's story and game world. You will receive co-author credit for the specific “named” quest.

Note: Rewards are cumulative.



With anything like this there are certainly risks involved. Games take time to develop and deadlines can be missed. Or the scope of the game can change. While we plan to do everything in our power to insure that Scions of Chaos: Prologue is completed and in your hands by end of 2016, we cannot guarantee the timing will work out. As everyone knows, even the biggest studios can have setbacks or changes in plans as we've seen with such games as the Legend of Zelda Wii U, Mighty No. 9, and others. 

To insure that we do our best in getting these games out the door and into your hands, we will use all available funds to bring on additional game developers to stay on track and improve the quality of the end product.

Let's face it. There just aren't many games of this type on the Wii U or even planned for the Wii U. This kind of game is sorely needed and can fill a huge void in the gaming library of a great Nintendo console. And you can have a voice in helping to shape the game and make it the best possible experience. This game could even help to improve Wii U sales, bring it exposure, and give it a longer shelf life. We need this game!
In addition to helping with Scions of Chaos: Prologue, contributions to pay off our Nintendo Dev Kit also help us to continue to work on and finish our 2 smaller projects, Asteroid Challenge and Frontier Guard. Both of these projects are on pause while we scrounge for the funds to pay off the dev kit. 
Asteroid Challenge
Frontier Guard

For those interested in seeing some of my pen & paper role-playing game content, you can download many of them for free at the following links. These adventures were developed as a freelance writer for Wizards of the Coast for the now defunct Living Forgotten Realms campaign:

ABER4-3 A Little Rebellion

WATE4-1 Paying the Piper

ELTU3-6 True Blue

NETH3-1 Secrets and Shadows

EAST2-03 Nightmares

EPIC3-3 The Tangled Skein of Destiny

EAST1-03 Unbidden

The above adventures are free to download and provide a great example of the kind of storytelling and adventure that you can expect from our game.

Additional content is available at RPPNow.com for purchase. The following link should take you to all the content we have available.

Content on RPGNow

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Help us out by getting the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools to post on Facebook, Google+, Twitter, and other websites. Getting people to check out the campaign is key!

You can also help by going to RPGNow.com and purchasing any of our role-playing game products. Sales of those products will also go to assist us in paying off our Nintendo dev kit and for other operating expenses.

Content on RPGNow
story_txt:
Dragon's Dogma meets Tomb Raider meets
Pen & Paper RPG
...and throw in a little Skyrim
Scions of Chaos: Prologue is the first installment in a multi-chapter series of games to be released over the next few years. Each chapter is a complete stand-alone game, but with clear ties to an over-arching
story-line that spans time and genres. 


You are Princess Grais, a half-elf, the illegitimate child of the Queen of Fehrton. Thought to have died at the hands of bandits, you were given into the care of peasants in a local hunting village. There you grew to be a young woman with no knowledge of your royal lineage. When the King's agents discovered the truth of your whereabouts and of the Queen's infidelity, you were to be captured and executed. But the King's own champion, sworn to protect you, rescued you from the shadow of death. You must now embark on an epic quest to learn the truth of your heritage and the nature of your destiny. A great prophecy of doom hangs over the lands and you are a central player in the drama to unfold.





Basic


Third person player controls


Character leveling, skills, and power enhancement


Magic spells, magic archery, and telekinesis


Melee combat


Deep story and role-playing opportunities


Puzzles and traps


Climbing, jumping, ledge sliding, vaulting, swimming, pushing, and other interactive abilities


Skills that improve through failure 


Advanced weather effects (rain, snow)

Check points
Mini-Map
World Map
Quests
Crafting
