story:
Overview

Paradise Island started as a Visual Novel with an adult thematic. Over the last two years we have split up the game into two different version. The mainstream version playable in Consoles, and the Mature version. Today the game is a survival adventure game with RPG mechanics and classic novel scenarios.

Take a look at the gallery for video and in-game graphics.

Mya/Ken

Meet the protagonists of our game. Instead of locking our gameplay mechanics and story to a single protagonist we wanted to allow our players to decide which gender they would preferred to play as.

Mia by felipe98 on Sketchfab


Meet Mya, the fun and spirited manager of Paradise Hotel. Mya was adopted by the owners of the island and is also Ken's adopted sister. Mya was sent to survival training since an early age, and started her martial arts training at the age of 6.

Meet Ken, playboy, surfer, and Mya's older brother. Ken brings a different play style with enhance fishing and hunting abilities, but you'll have to make good choices to unlock all the hidden secrets of the island.
The World of Paradise Island
As the titles suggest Paradise Island takes place in a beautiful island in the pacific. The Island is owned by Ken/Mya, an inheritance left behind by their parents. What our protagonist don't know is that this beautiful island is filled with secrets and mysticism. This environment has a mind of its own - it can concealed itself from the world, cutoff supplies, spawn mystical creatures, and test the survival skills of our players. 
The game is filled with beautiful traditional art backgrounds, and 3D area for complete exploration. 


          Supporting Characters
We have a full cast of characters for our adventure. Since Paradise Island is rooted in the Visual Novel genre an excellent cast of characters to progress the story was important to us. This character are not placeholders or simply there to progress the story, they all have
  • Secrets to divulge
  • Collected Items
  • Skills to share and teach
Our social meter is not composed of simple YES/NO decisions, but each decision is carefully weighted and will decide which characters will openly assist you in your quest.

Take a look at our website paradiseislandthegame.com starting on 11/20/2015 for a complete list of characters, bios, sketches, and more.
*We will only publish Mature content for the game in our website. Check out the mature version wallpaper we will have on lunch day.

Production

Paradise Island started and remains a labor of love. We have spend many our crafting the look and feel, mechanics, and more. And we have done this by choosing each contractor, and technology carefully.


Engine

We are using Unity to power Paradise Island. After maintaining our proprietary engine we opted for using an engine that would allow us to reach many more platforms than we had ever reached before. Unity is also an excellent choice for small size studios and provide a great level of support and tooling to get the job done.

Composition


There is no restrictions on the tools our artist use to create the beautiful graphics of Paradise Island. Over the last years we have established a flow of using PSD for deliverables, and FBX produce by Maya or 3D Studio Max. There are many technologies involved for audio, particles and more. We look forward to answering any qusetions regarding this matter.


The People


  • Giovana Leandro Art Director
    Giovana is professional illustrator, comic artist and writer; her works are recognized in the world on networks such as deviantart and pixiv, as well as in several works she has done for companies worldwide. Giovana was part of two comic projects through Crowfunding who managed the funds (EGUM by Catharsis and SEMI at Kickstarter). Usually perform work for the Brazilian Jambo publisher, including the cover of the magazine Dragonslayer, several illustrations of the Bestiary and several illustrations for the RPG book "Light Brigade Star" of Jambo publisher. In her repertoire of achivements Giovana also produces artwork for games published in Japan. 
  • TYPO
  • Felipe Ramos Code Master has been writing enterprise solutions for over 14 years now. He has server as a technical reviewer for Apress on game development publications like Monogame. Aside from being a full time developer on GameStatsApi.com he is working on this magnificent project.


Perks Updates

Per several request we have received we have updated Live Promoter and above to also include physical copy of the game, and physical copy of the art book publish by blurb.com.

story:
Sail through history on board the ill-fated RMS Titanic, the largest moving object in the world in 1912, and a technological wonder of the time. As Titanic races through the icy waters of the North Atlantic, Robert Morgan battles the odds to clear his name of horrible crimes. When the brand new luxury liner strikes an iceberg, and threatens the lives of 2,200 souls, Morgan must race the rising waters and the clock as the ship sinks out from under him.

Click the following link to get our FREE early tour demo for PC to try on your computer: http://www.titanichg.com/demo/
Find additional information on this campaign on our website at these pages:
  • The Perks
  • Budget and Goals
  • Review of Phase 2
  • How You Can Help
  • Mailing List Registration

We are a small team of independent developers looking to make history by bringing it to life. We want to recreate the entire RMS Titanic, in full detail and authenticity, for the player to explore however they choose.



  • FREE ROAM MODE, where the player can wander around the ship, the docks, and the city of Southampton with no objectives, minimal crowds, and no time limits.
  • STORY MODE, where the player must live in the confines of 1912 society and work to clear his name of horrible crimes, for which the police are chasing him. In the end, as the vessel begins to sink in real-time, the player must work to finish his mission before it is too late.

Want to add a third dimension to Titanic? You'll be able to tour the ship and experience the grandeur of the great liner and the detail of our Titanic recreation using the Oculus Rift headset coupled with the power of Unreal Engine 4!

In the finished game, you'll be able to explore every corner of the ship and take in the breathtaking beauty of Titanic in a rich virtual reality. Walk the narrow corridors to get a feeling for how cramped some of the spaces were on board, or stroll the promenades and wander the spacious public rooms of First Class to admire the craftsmanship of Edwardian shipbuilding and interior design at its best.

You don't even have to wait to do that to some small extent. Check out this article to see what some have been doing with our FREE early environment demo and Oculus Rift, or just watch the video below to see it in action!


The Core Team

  • Tom Lynskey - Project Manager, Director, Writer

  • Matthew DeWinkeleer - Interior Modeler, Accounting, Legal

  • Kyle Hudak - Technical and Exterior Modeler, Temp. Unreal Programmer

Support Team

  • Nicolas Murgia - Texture Artist

  • Tomás Tonon - Contributing Modeler

  • Anthony Casalena - Musician

  • Sean Hewitt - Image Rendering

  • Matthew Chapman - Painter

Consultants

  • Bill Sauder - Technical and Operatings Expert

  • Parks Stephenson - Systems Engineer, Titanic Wreck Diver

  • Ken Marschall - Maritime Painter, Titanic Wreck Diver

Support Consultants

  • William Brower Jr. - Author, Lecturer

  • Daniel Allen Butler - Author (The Other Side of the Night), Lecturer

  • Tad Fitch - Author (On A Sea of Glass)

  • Joshua Nobel - Titanic Gazette

  • Daniel Smith - British Titanic Society, Nomadic Preservation Society

  • Bill Wormstedt - Author (On A Sea of Glass)


Our project is a unique one. We are attempting to recreate a moment in history by pushing today's current technology to its limits. With advanced models, concepts, and a cutting edge game engine, we are virtually rebuilding the entire RMS Titanic, the world's most famous ill-fated ocean liner.

In our game, you'll be able to explore the ship inside and out. You can access every room, corridor, cabin, and pantry, with as much interactiveness as we can achieve. A tour mode is available where the player can simply explore everything at their leisure, but the main focus of the game is the story mode.

Beginning in the city of Southampton, England, which is being recreated on a large scale and with as much accuracy as our ship, the player is on the run from the police. He's accused of a terrible crime, but most importantly- he's innocent. He must pursue the true culprit, requiring the player to find a way onto the Titanic just before it departs.

Playing through all five days of the voyage talking to passengers, gathering clues, and unraveling a grand mystery all while trying not to get discovered, the hero, Mr. Robert Morgan, has no idea that his whole world is about to change. When Titanic collides with an iceberg in the middle of the North Atlantic, the player must race the rising waters to complete the mystery, prove his innocence, and, most importantly.... survive.




To give a quick summary, watch this video on our budget breakdown.

Team Expansion: This represents the money needed to expand the team and hire new people, such as programmers, technicians, musicians, voice actors, and 2D artists.

Team Compensation: This is the cost needed for people currently included in the team, to cover the continued work and time needed to complete the project. This is also including core consultants, as well as additional modelers who are working on commission helping with characters, props, and other parts of the 1912 world.

Hardware and Software: This is any and all equipment we need to purchase, including additional computers, software licenses, motion capture materials, and sound equipment.

Situational: This is any kind of cost that occurs on special occasions, but is no less necessary for the production. It includes travel for research and recording events, for sound materials, for possible studio sessions, and other special event purchases.

Promotional and Legal:  Licensing, rights, and contract negotiations. The promotional costs include continuing to spread the word, completion fees, and also IndieGoGo perks to thank the donors.

IndieGoGo Fees: IndieGoGo charges us 9% until we reach our goal, then begins charging 4% after that, also refunding the difference between the 9% and 4% fees.

Southampton and the Rest of the Project

Our goal is to not just complete the Titanic in its entirety, but a large chunk of the City of Southampton, England, as it appeared in 1912.

As our budget expands and increases, we will also be expanding the main part of the game, the Titanic elements, but with every additional $250,000 we receive, enough money will be put aside for us to expand out to the next numbered zone and include that in the game.

Work has already begun on the greenzone with progress having been done on nearly every street in it. It is all an early work-in-progress and obviously lacking textures, but samples are below.


This covers the costs needed right this moment, in addition to giving us enough to move forward in all possible directions, including beginning sound work, programming, and building the team.

This money allows us to complete the ship and tour mode, as well as hold our group out to find additional funding elsewhere.

This is still not enough to get us through completion of our vision for the entire game, but allows us to work even harder for longer times, and lets us build more progress before needing to seek additional funding.

  • Allows for additional fund-raising events in the promotional category, such as dinners and other on-location events
  • This also allots for additional programmers to join the team

This is the lowest amount needed in order to bring us through completion, but the game will need to be trimmed back.

  • Includes minimum necessary team expansion to complete game
  • Allows for all needed hardware and software

This allows us to complete the game as we see fit, including most of the features we have our hearts set on, but will still require a slight bit of conservatism.

  • Additional programmers and team members
  • Covers completion, marketing, and distribution costs
  • May allow us to commission a Ken Marschall cover artwork

This allows us to comfortably complete the game, flush in everything we were possibly considering, and even see what other ideas can be included.

  • Full marketing and distribution
  • Game convention attendance
  • Possible expansion packs?
  • Live orchestra soundtrack?
  • Large team of professionals to guarantee quality

The Perks

To the right of the page, we're offering various thank-you prizes ranging from a simple credit on our page to being modeled into the game, meet-ups, and limited edition items. Please keep in mind that these are all 'thank-you' items, and not actual purchases. All perks include everything in the smaller perks as well, even perks that are in limited quantity.

To find out more about our perks, click here!

Other Things in Return

In addition to our perks, you will also be a part of something monumental. There has never been a recreation of a real-life subject like this, let alone something as poorly documented. You'll know that your contribution and support was a vital part in making this happen.

Along the way, we will also continue to update our fans with behind-the-scenes videos, exciting screenshots, and historical vignettes educating those who are interested in fascinating stories and debates about history's most famous ship.



If we are able to achieve our vision through the support of our fans and contributors, we intend to revolutionize gaming. Just with the small fan-base we began with, we've seen opinions and biases fade. Many people see video games as a mindless pastime with no educational value and something only for the younger generations. Whether the stereotypes are true or not, the concept of this game goes beyond that.

In the words of some of our more senior consultants, "this isn't a game. This is an experience."

This game will not only be exciting and entertaining, but will make history interesting and kindle the desire in many of today's youth to learn and research.


We intend for this game to also be an educational tool, with a special package designed for teachers and schools to educate their students on the Titanic and the 1912 time period. We are working with teachers and principals to develop a product that can be licensed to schools and youth groups to promote an exciting and engaging way of learning.



It is our goal to include as many facts about the ship and her passengers and crew as we can. We intend for the player to be able to assume that if it was included in this game, it happened. We are searching and researching with an enormous amount of effort to find every last shred of evidence we can, including a large amount of unpublished documents and plans of the ship, to make sure the stories and ship designs we include are exactly as they appeared in 1912.


We are also making our own discoveries in the ship, even 103 years after the disaster. We are finding rooms and areas that were actually always assumed to be one way, but in fact are different. We will be announcing these areas through in-depth documentary style videos over the course of the campaign. Stay tuned for our updates!


Never before has the historical maritime city had the opportunity to be recreated on such an authentic and in-depth level. We recognize this, and want to take the opportunity to give this city the preservation it deserves. We really want to pay tribute to the city out of respect for the hundreds lost and the citizens today who still continue to preserve the memories of those lost on the ship.


If possible, we'd also like to see about recreating the shipyards of Belfast, parts of Cherbourg and Queenstown (now Cobh), and even the Piers of New York City.


We are going out of our way to make sure to include as many people as we can in the game, all based on real life people (with the exception of the main character and the villains). 

As of now, the number of real-life Titanic passengers and crew in the game who you can talk to, interact with, and even 'stalk' during the sinking to watch their real-life actions is around 200. However, this number may increase or decrease as final production decisions are made, based on how successful our campaign is.

We are also trying to include people who are lesser known, either because they never had the opportunity to write down their story, or because they were never focused on before by films. These people include:

  • Some of the 113 Swedish Passengers on board, of whom 87 were lost
  • Masabumi Hosono, the only Japanese passenger
  • The Italian waiters in the First Class A La Carte Restaurant
  • Joseph Laroche, one of the only black passengers on board
  • Helen Candee, feminist and author
  • The Sage Family, a family of 11 who were all lost
  • The Guarantee Group, the troubleshooters for the maiden voyage
  • The Postal Workers, five mailroom workers who were all lost
These are, of course, included in addition to the many must-haves for any Titanic story, such as:

  • Edward John Smith, the ship's Captain
  • J. Bruce Ismay, Managing Director of the White Star Line
  • Thomas Andrews, Chief Designer of the Titanic
  • J.J. Astor, the richest man on the ship
  • Benjamin Guggenheim, First Class Passenger
  • Lawrence Beesley, famous Second Class Passenger
  • The Orchestra, who stayed behind and played music until the end


DONATE

The biggest thing we need right now is money. A contribution of even just a few dollars will go a long way, but please consider an even larger donation, if possible. We are thankful for all donations and are offering perks in return.

SHARE

Share our campaign on social media! Use the buttons at the bottom of the page, add a few words if you want, and share!

Sharing our website, facebook, and YouTube help, but not as much as sharing the campaign itself. The campaign is designed to contain all information someone new would need to learn about our project.

Make a video and upload it to YouTube, Vimeo, or wherever you have followers. Talk about what we are doing, and encourage people to donate and further spread the word.

If you are involved in the media, write an article or do a story on our project, encouraging your audience to get involved. Talk about our task and our efforts to preserve history and the legacy of those lost, and talk about what we need. If you do something, please be sure to share it with us as well! We always love to see this stuff.

WORD-OF-MOUTH

In person or through private email, tell your friends, family, co-workers, complete strangers, their pets.... tell everyone about what we are trying to do. Tell them about our goals and the quality of work, and tell them what we need to get it done.

Also visit our here for flyers you can download and print to hand out to people.

LIKES AND VIEWS

Even the simple things count. Just visiting our IndieGoGo page earns us view points, factoring in to our chances of getting featured. Liking our facebook page helps us reach more people. Watching and liking- even commenting on- our YouTube videos boosts our popularity (and don't forget to subscribe!) Just being an active fan not only helps us with the campaign, but gives us a boost in motivation to see such supportive fans helping us through this.

YOUR INDIEGOGO TOOLS

Using the buttons at the bottom to tweet, facebook, and email this campaign out add up and get our campaign more 'points' towards being featured. We were featured last time, let's do it again!
story_txt:
Sail through history on board the ill-fated RMS Titanic, the largest 
moving object in the world in 1912, and a technological wonder of the 
time. As Titanic races through the icy waters of the North Atlantic, 
Robert Morgan battles the odds to clear his name of horrible crimes. 
When the brand new luxury liner strikes an iceberg, and threatens the 
lives of 2,200 souls, Morgan must race the rising waters and the clock 
as the ship sinks out from under him.







Click the following link to get our FREE early tour demo for PC to try on your computer: http://www.titanichg.com/demo/


Find additional information on this campaign on our website at these pages:
The Perks
Budget and Goals
Review of Phase 2
How You Can Help

Mailing List Registration



We are a small team of independent developers looking to make history by bringing it to life. We want to recreate the entire RMS Titanic, in full detail and authenticity, for the player to explore however they choose.







FREE ROAM MODE, where the player can wander around the ship, the docks, and the city of Southampton with no objectives, minimal crowds, and no time limits.

STORY MODE, where the player must live in the confines of 1912 society and work to clear his name of horrible crimes, for which the police are chasing him. In the end, as the vessel begins to sink in real-time, the player must work to finish his mission before it is too late.



Want to add a third dimension to Titanic? You'll be able to tour the ship and experience the grandeur of the great liner and the detail of our Titanic recreation using the Oculus Rift headset coupled with the power of Unreal Engine 4!In the finished game, you'll be able to explore every corner of the ship and take in the breathtaking beauty of Titanic in a rich virtual reality. Walk the narrow corridors to get a feeling for how cramped some of the spaces were on board, or stroll the promenades and wander the spacious public rooms of First Class to admire the craftsmanship of Edwardian shipbuilding and interior design at its best.You don't even have to wait to do that to some small extent. Check out this article to see what some have been doing with our FREE early environment demo and Oculus Rift, or just watch the video below to see it in action!










The Core Team



Tom Lynskey - Project Manager, Director, Writer 
Matthew DeWinkeleer - Interior Modeler, Accounting, Legal 
Kyle Hudak - Technical and Exterior Modeler, Temp. Unreal Programmer




Support Team

Nicolas Murgia - Texture Artist



Tomás Tonon - Contributing Modeler






Anthony Casalena - Musician




Sean Hewitt - Image Rendering

Matthew Chapman - Painter



Consultants

Bill Sauder - Technical and Operatings Expert



Parks Stephenson - Systems Engineer, Titanic Wreck Diver



Ken Marschall - Maritime Painter, Titanic Wreck Diver

William Brower Jr. - Author, Lecturer
Daniel Allen Butler - Author (The Other Side of the Night), Lecturer
Tad Fitch - Author (On A Sea of Glass)







Joshua Nobel - Titanic Gazette






Daniel Smith - British Titanic Society, Nomadic Preservation Society







Bill Wormstedt - Author (On A Sea of Glass)

story:
Summary

Dude, where is my beer? is a satiric point-and-click adventure game about a guy who is desperately trying to find a pilsner in a world where people only care about craft beers.

In this game the protagonist has to talk to different characters, most of them bartenders, solve beer related puzzles at different stages of inebriation at locations like a sports bar, a microbrewery, a dive bar and a rock bar in his quest of finding an old school pilsner. Drinking beer is an integral part of the game experience and your BAC will open up or close off quest options and dialogue choices.

Among the puzzles you will have to win a brewing contest by finding all the necessary (and not only) ingredients to brew a rare beer, following a brewing recipe and I am sure you will fail a few times, before you brew it correctly.

With your help we can create an amazingly good-looking, humorous old school adventure game with fun puzzles and dialogues, and if it works, we can continue in the same direction and make more games like this one.

After ten years in the IT industry, I decided to combine my love for old school adventure games with all the skills I can contribute and bring them together in one product, using creative writing, graphic design, 2D animation, programming and humor. In DWIMB I can use all of them, with some help from another graphic designer and a sound designer.

I am a professional 2D animator with ten years of experience from the IT, animation and web industry. My background gives me experience in all aspects of producing a project like DWIMB, including concept development, script, project management, graphic design, animation, interaction design, and programming. You can check out my animation portfolio here: www.arik.no

The project will feature all original artwork by illustrator Edo Brenes,  His unique style is sure to make the game look spectacular. You can check out his work at www.edobrenes.com (He also made the illustrations above.)

 

What We Need 

I am working on this game in my spare time and my original plan was to produce it all by myself, but as the project grew more ambitious, so did I. I decided to use a professional graphic designer with experience from these kind of projects, and when I found the one I knew would bring the game to a new level, I asked him for a quote. Therefore, almost all the funds from this crowdfunding are going forward to pay him for designing backgrounds, characters and all the items in the game, consecutively. Besides that we need funds to pay a sound designer and a composer to make the sound effects, a game theme and background music for the different locations in the game. The rest of the money will go to the voice actors to record all the dialogues and make the gaming experience even better.

Our goal is to make DWIMB available for the Steam platform on PC, Linux and Mac. We want to make the game interesting to people from different countries, and we are going to translate it to different languages. I speak English, Norwegian and Russian fluently and right now I am learning Spanish, so the translation would be neither expensive nor difficult to implement.

We are going to update the contributors and those who are interested in helping, by posting updates about the progress and showing the new graphic elements to prove that we are working hard and getting closer to the target!

 

Funding and Status       

We will finish the game no matter what. If we don't meet the goal, we will try to find other ways of getting the funds to pay for graphics and sounds. That might delay the whole development of the project, but it doesn't mean it will stop.

The storyboard and most of the programming is almost done. What still needs to be done is to create the graphics and implement them into the game, make the animations, improve some parts of the story, dialogues and puzzles and put the sound and the music at the end.

Please, check out the Perks section to see what you can get buy supporting us.

 

Other Ways You Can Help    

If you are interested in this game please share this page and tell your friends, we could use all the support you can give us. Thank you to everyone who does. If you have hipster friends who are into brewing craft beer, have beards, fancy round glasses and weird bicycles, show this to them! We know they'll support us! Please help us spread the word by facebooking, tweeting, or sharing this URL.

Cheers, guys!

We want to make the game interesting to people from different countries, and we are going to translate it to different languages. I speak English, Norwegian and Russian fluently and right now I am learning Spanish, so the translation would be neither expensive nor difficult to implement.

We are going to update the contributors and those who are interested in helping, by posting updates about the progress and showing the new graphic elements to prove that we are working hard and getting closer to the target!
 

Funding and Status       
We will finish the game no matter what. If we don't meet the goal, we will try to find other ways of getting the funds to pay for graphics and sounds. That might delay the whole development of the project, but it doesn't mean it will stop.
The storyboard and most of the programming is almost done. What still needs to be done is to create the graphics and implement them into the game, make the animations, improve some parts of the story, dialogues and puzzles and put the sound and the music at the end.
Please, check out the Perks section to see what you can get buy supporting us.


 
Other Ways You Can Help    
If you are interested in this game please share this page and tell your friends, we could use all the support you can give us. Thank you to everyone who does. If you have hipster friends who are into brewing craft beer, have beards, fancy round glasses and weird bicycles, show this to them! We know they'll support us! Please help us spread the word by facebooking, tweeting, or sharing this URL.
Cheers, guys!

story:
Updates
Please have a try of our customization prototype demo v3!  http://www.indiedb.com/games/mass-builder/downloads/mass-builder-prototype-demo-v3 

updated with the following:

- New armor set for a better preview of our customization system

- More weapons for customization

- A small preview into the combat system through our improved training grounds

- Added melee combat for testing

- Changed and improved particle effects and optimization

- Changed and improved some animation styles


The World: The world after its collapse from being invaded. Countries are abolished and humanity is forced into shelters (a total of 13 around the world). Terrains are deformed as a result of wars and red zones that humanity should never enter are established.

 

In M.A.S.S. Builder, you’re free to create your own M.A.S.S. with everything you’ve collected. That’s right, you can put any kind of parts into each slot of your M.A.S.S. and create the perfect one that is up to your taste. We have classified each part of your M.A.S.S. into 4 main categories as of following:

Frames and Armors
These are the main body of your M.A.S.S. They are the inner works where you'll be attaching and assembling parts of armors onto. After selecting your frame, you will then attach 'Armors' which are parts that will be attached onto a M.A.S.S. frame to cover them up. You are free to change each parts to suit your liking and create a customized look for your M.A.S.S.

Joint Adjustment: Frame joints' length can be adjusted in most cases to create the perfect looks for your armors.

Armor Assemble: Attaching armor onto a frame.

Joint Armor Expand: Armor pieces that are attached on joints will be resized in accordance to frame joints.


Armors: Armors can be fully mixed and matched up to your liking. Above is a preview of the two styles we have created.

Paint: Each armor will have around 2-4 sub-elements where you can select a paint style for each element separately.
When you edit those styles, every part using it will be changed as well.

Decal: Decals can be attached onto each armor piece and you can adjust its size, color, position, designs, and etc. as you like.

Weapons
Equipped with each M.A.S.S. are an array of weapons to deal with the Quarks. Each weapon will be separated into two parts that form a single weapon, so choose what you’d like to have. You can wield a total of one melee weapon, two ranged shooters, and two launcher option parts on your M.A.S.S. For more clarification, see below.

  • Close Combat melee weapons allow selecting a grip to determine your stances and an assaulter part that determines the weapon’s damaging abilities.
  • Shooters are categorized into two types. You can select a trigger and barrel for both of them so you can customize them to shoot what you like.
    • Bullet shooters are ranged weapons that fire physical bullets. These weapons have ammo counts but will continuously shoot until they run out of it aside from reloading. 
    • Energy shooters are ranged weapons that fire energy bullets. These weapons do not have ammo counts, but will constantly need to recharge before being able to fire again. 
  • Launchers are separated into bullet launchers and energy launchers as well. They attach to parts the M.A.S.S.’ body.
    • Bullet launchers launch projectiles such as missiles or physical objects, they are extremely effective at their purpose but they are limited by ammo counts.
    • Energy launchers will use a large amount of energy from the M.A.S.S. to fire but they do not need to care about ammo counts.

Close Combat: Melee weapons allow selecting a grip to determine your stances and an assaulter part that determines the weapon’s damaging abilities.

Ranged Combat: Ranged weapons allow you to select a trigger and barrel that customizes how you shoot and what you shoot at your enemies.

Weapon Stances: Each weapon has its own attacking stances and their variation of combination of attacks.

Weapon Attachment: After setting up your weapons, you can bring a various of them into the battlefield but the more you bring, the more weight it takes and your balance with speed might be worse.

For everything that you decide to put onto the M.A.S.S. you only need to think about your M.A.S.S.’ weight. That’s the only downside of putting on too much armor and weapons as it will mostly slow you down in exchange of being more sturdy or more powerful. Then after creating the perfect look for your M.A.S.S. you can choose from a variety of combat enhancement 'gears' and 'operating system' to install into your M.A.S.S. These will determine the combat abilities you can wield, adjusting your speed, weight, and everything without having any effect on your appearance.The rest is up to your liking, we don’t want to limit your creativity in creating a M.A.S.S. you like to really use. Go wild!
 

Fighting against you in these missions will be alien lifeforms, not the grotesque one but cool looking ones like these. Most of them are not that strong but beware they come in great numbers and you’ll be overwhelmed if you’re not careful.

Sometimes, you’ll also face an extremely strong opponent, be it a commanding alien or some other mercenaries. Please take care of them for the safety of Earth as well.

 

After finally finishing the last detail in your creation and finalizing your M.A.S.S, you will take on various missions around the world. 

You will be launched and deployed from your hangar straight into battle after briefing and from there, complete your mission in a fast-paced action-filled battlefield, using your optimized arsenal of weaponry.

Mission Dialogue: Throughout missions, you will encounter NPC dialogues on important progress or information that needs to be relayed.

Movement: There are various methods to traverse the missions quickly in the game. Using boosters are one of them.

Melee Combat: Prototype motion of frame movement and melee combat effects. Melee combats will have a strong effect against enemies.

Ranged Combat: Prototype motion of frame movement and ranged combat aiming effects. Sample of plasma weapon with large area of destruction. There are various other customization with your weapons such as explosive or freezing shots.

 

 

While developing as a small team under other developers and publishers, we learnt about each other, growing to become more of a family than a team and gaining experience through our commissioned works. With strong bonds and some coincidences, we have separated and created a new entity that housed everyone from the team together under the same roof living together day and night.

Although we are a new company, the team has been working together on various games and assets for many publishers and developers to use in their own games. What we’ve worked on are products that have been distributed to the world in a manner or the other, and this is speaking from Thailand.The games that we’ve worked on includes MMORPGs, Mobile Games, Rhythm Mobile Games, even VR Games as well. Although we sounds funny and silly when we do things like this, our team leader is a very strict man that won’t allow errors or low-quality works to manifest in our games so we hope that you’ll put your trust in us.

 

For the supporter options, here are both versions of the digital poster. You may choose one. The rest of the tiers will get both colors.

 

 

 

  1. Why Indiegogo campaign?

The reason we’re using crowdfunding as a source of funding is because it’s a great method for us to secure some funds to further develop our framework into a game that we’d like to play. Since we’re doing that, we would like to invite other people to join us in the game, create something that we’d never thought of to create, and have fun with us, and the best way to do that is to let you guys chip in your support and feedback of the game with us so we can improve it while building.

We’d also like to fully commit into game development, not going part-time, taking a few hours after our work to develop a game. No, we’d like to spend at least a third of a day to work on M.A.S.S. Builder and that requires you guys to help support us.

  1. Why $40,000?

Alright, let’s get this straight to the point. Our team is working full time on game development as you are reading this right now, but it's a game commissioned by someone else. We would like to instead, create, work on, and play what we'd seen as truly our game.

With this amount of money, we’ll be able to survive to finish the game within the specified timeframe (with the standards of living and how we live) while also being able to procure what is needed for the completion of the game.

For clarity, we'll breakdown the $40,000 for you to see how they goes into each part of our development process.

  • (40%) Arts and assets: Due to M.A.S.S. Builder being a very customizeable experience, we'd like to create lots and lots of variants of armors and weapons for our players.
  • (30%) Programming: There's lots to programming, creating databases to fulfill each parts of the game, utilizing particles, enemy AI programming, etc.
  • (10%) Sound: Voice overs from professional talents and composers to create the soundtrack for the game.
  • (5%) Content Design: Creating contents to create a world that feels "real" in its own sense with story writing and the settings.
  • (10%) Game Design: Creating additional mechanics that create the "fun" factor in gameplay and balancing numbers in "building."
  • (5%) QA: Quality assurance can help us get rid of possible factor of "unfun" and bugs before the project is released.
  1. Why flexible funding?

This might be a question many of you are asking, and we’re ready to answer it. As we have mentioned above, we’re working full time on game development already and this is a project we’ve started as our liberation for a good while already as well. So for any amount of money that we receive, you can be sure that we’ll finish the game eventually, just not in the time frame that we’ve stated. 

Of course we’ll try to procure more funding in any other ways so that this project can be done as soon as possible and not later than we speculated in deliverance. So let me repeat this to you again, we will finish the game for every of our backers and fans.

  1. What’s the business model?

M.A.S.S. Builder final product will be sold on steam as a purchase once, no subscription model. We’ll continue updating the game with free contents and patches but we’ll tell you honestly that there might be some DLCs available as well after sales and if there are great demands for the game.

  1. Where can I find more information about M.A.S.S. Builder?

For now, we’ve got all existing information available on our social media (Facebook, Twitter) where you are free to send us a private message to talk about things, ask questions, and the likes of those.

Q. Regarding the perks that allow us to design stuffs, when are we getting to do it?

A. For those perks, after the development of the alpha/beta finishes, we will contact you through your e-mail and start designing together with you on those stuffs. This process might take some time so we'll try to do it as soon as possible after we are complete but it should be at least the 2nd quarter of 2018. We'll update you with our builds and designs in our demo before that though so you can get a sense of what's to come and what's to be designed. Maybe faster if we can allocate more resources to that.

Q. How do we help you design those stuffs? How do I send my design in?

A. You can either sketch us a design or find us a reference image for both of them. If you're into 3D modelling, we'll be more than happy for your model.

For armors, since they don't have status or anything, we'll take the image or model, sketch it out in our designs for our 3D artist to use, and have him create it.

For weapons, we'll have you break it into two parts, melee being the hilt and the edge, ranged being the trigger and the barrel, and launchers being the generator/ammo and the launchpad.

Hilts will state how they are held in stances, edges will be how it damages, triggers tell how the weapons are fired (burst? ammo type? stuffs like that) and barrels tells us how the projectile is activated (shoots double or a bullet at a time? maybe a gatling barrel?), and generators tells us what are shot (energy ball of heat, electric discharge?) while launchpad will tell us how each projectile behaves of firing (small pod of 4 or 8 like missiles or maybe a beam discharge?).

Risks in development, challenges to overcome

Okay, you’ve read it this far and want to know how risky this project is. First things, game development takes time to create a very immersive and fun experience for our players. To this point, we all know there are various games that takes forever to be released, or folded projects since there’s not enough money. We’ve already finished designing mechanics and core gameplay features, cutting down one of the most time-consuming workload already so all that’s left is to start the development.

Spreading the word

Thanks for reading until this point, if you liked the project or at least what you’ve just read, please tell your friends, your foes, whoever you’d like to! Just spreading the word about our project is a great help in realizing our game, our dreams, and bring it to life. We’re extremely grateful for the opportunity and support that you gave us.

Thank you very much!

story:
About Me

I had always wanted to make video games from a young age, to the point that I would make drawings of game idea's and give them to the people at Blockbuster, thinking that they could get them to someone to be made.

It was silly but I was a kid. I didn't know any better. Later on in life, I got the writers bug and wrote a 500k word novel in around 3 weeks. I never went anywhere with it but it was something I was and still am proud of to this day.

When I discovered visual novels, I was amazed at how well crafted these stories could be. They contained beautiful artwork, well designed characters, interesting stories and moving dialogue.

I was hooked.

It was at this point that I decided that I would take all of my years tinkering with game engines and the stories I had rattling around in my head to finally create something worth while.

And so, I contacted an artist I was introduced to years ago and got him sketching characters for me and I was amazed at how well he captured the way I envisioned them!

More time passed and I really started cracking down on writing the story. Most of it is still in my head and is slowly flowing onto the page, though. I currently sit at around 30k words and I'm only three acts into the story!

My goal is to have a long, detailed and interesting story with several different endings available to the readers.

I suppose you'd like to have an idea as to what the story is all about?

"Broken Reflections follows the protagonist, a student who has suffered from depression their entire life, who has been sent to a school that specializes in students with illnesses and traumatic pasts.


Upon their arrival, they receive an overwhelming wave of depression, the likes that they have never experienced before, which causes them to do the unthinkable...

Suicide.

After drifting off to what they expect to be their final sleep, the are shocked by the fact they awaken the following morning.


Looking around their room, they see the evidence of their suicide as plain as day, so they know that they didn't simply dream it but after having swallowed all of their medication, they know that they could not have survived... And yet, they did.

The only clues they have are a large, black feather on their desk and a strange pocket watch in their nightstand.

So now they not only have to adjust to their new school but they also experience fragmented memories of that night and recall a tall man in a black coat and hat speaking to them.

While trying to piece together this mystery, they will encounter several others who share a single thing in common.

They are all different and, in that sense, they are all the same.

Who was the tall man?

Did they have a hand in their survival?

And what is this ominous presence that lingers over the school...?"


The issue I'm facing is that, before I can achieve a successful, full crowd funding at the end of the year, I need to be able to get the demo and true trailer ready to go before then.

And considering I am currently working less than 40 hours a week, have bills to get caught up on, as well as living expenses, funding this monster is becoming more than I can afford on my own...

This Is Where You Come In!

What I need is simple. I need enough initial funding to get this thing off the ground and gears moving before I can present the world with something worthy of full funding.

To do that, I need money for character and background art, the soundtrack and special effects for cinematic scenes.

If I can reach the full, $5000 goal, it will give me plenty to work with for what I have planned at the end of the year.

If I can't reach the full amount, then any money I raise will still be helpful in reaching the end of the year goal.

Why This Is Important to Me and Maybe Even You

With the world finally turning their eyes on mental health and understanding how they affect people in their day to day lives, I think a story like this will reach out to everyone out  there who do suffer from illnesses such as these and relate to the characters.

I have several people I know (including myself) who suffer from depression, borderline personality disorder, PTSD, etc... And they all think that this is a great idea and can't wait to see it come to fruition.

For those who want to see what this can become, I'll be offering a few rewards that may catch you eye!

In the end, the future of Broken Reflections is in your hands. If I can't get things ready to go for the end of the year, I'm not sure what direction this project will take. I'll keep working on it, for sure but it's going to take a lot longer than I would like, and a lot longer than you would like, either.

Can't Donate? You Can Still Help!

If you're strapped for money like myself and can't manage to donate, then you can still help out the project by spreading the word to as many people as you can, especially if you're as hyped for this novel as I am!

Don't forget to visit the games Facebook and Twitter accounts to follow this journey with me!

Thanks in advance for any help that you can offer and I look forward to being able to bring you a story that you won't ever forget!
story_txt:
About Me
I had always wanted to make video games from a young age, to the point that I would make drawings of game idea's and give them to the people at Blockbuster, thinking that they could get them to someone to be made.
It was silly but I was a kid. I didn't know any better. Later on in life, I got the writers bug and wrote a 500k word novel in around 3 weeks. I never went anywhere with it but it was something I was and still am proud of to this day.
When I discovered visual novels, I was amazed at how well crafted these stories could be. They contained beautiful artwork, well designed characters, interesting stories and moving dialogue.
I was hooked.
It was at this point that I decided that I would take all of my years tinkering with game engines and the stories I had rattling around in my head to finally create something worth while.
And so, I contacted an artist I was introduced to years ago and got him sketching characters for me and I was amazed at how well he captured the way I envisioned them!
More time passed and I really started cracking down on writing the story. Most of it is still in my head and is slowly flowing onto the page, though. I currently sit at around 30k words and I'm only three acts into the story!
My goal is to have a long, detailed and interesting story with several different endings available to the readers.
I suppose you'd like to have an idea as to what the story is all about?
"Broken Reflections follows the protagonist, a student who has suffered from depression their entire life, who has been sent to a school that specializes in students with illnesses and traumatic pasts.
Upon their arrival, they receive an overwhelming wave of depression, the likes that they have never experienced before, which causes them to do the unthinkable...
Suicide.
After drifting off to what they expect to be their final sleep, the are shocked by the fact they awaken the following morning.
Looking around their room, they see the evidence of their suicide as plain as day, so they know that they didn't simply dream it but after having swallowed all of their medication, they know that they could not have survived... And yet, they did.
The only clues they have are a large, black feather on their desk and a strange pocket watch in their nightstand.
So now they not only have to adjust to their new school but they also experience fragmented memories of that night and recall a tall man in a black coat and hat speaking to them.
While trying to piece together this mystery, they will encounter several others who share a single thing in common.
They are all different and, in that sense, they are all the same.
Who was the tall man?
Did they have a hand in their survival?
And what is this ominous presence that lingers over the school...?"
The issue I'm facing is that, before I can achieve a successful, full crowd funding at the end of the year, I need to be able to get the demo and true trailer ready to go before then.
And considering I am currently working less than 40 hours a week, have bills to get caught up on, as well as living expenses, funding this monster is becoming more than I can afford on my own...

This Is Where You Come In!
What I need is simple. I need enough initial funding to get this thing off the ground and gears moving before I can present the world with something worthy of full funding.
To do that, I need money for character and background art, the soundtrack and special effects for cinematic scenes.
If I can reach the full, $5000 goal, it will give me plenty to work with for what I have planned at the end of the year.
If I can't reach the full amount, then any money I raise will still be helpful in reaching the end of the year goal.

Why This Is Important to Me and Maybe Even You
With the world finally turning their eyes on mental health and understanding how they affect people in their day to day lives, I think a story like this will reach out to everyone out  there who do suffer from illnesses such as these and relate to the characters.
I have several people I know (including myself) who suffer from depression, borderline personality disorder, PTSD, etc... And they all think that this is a great idea and can't wait to see it come to fruition.
For those who want to see what this can become, I'll be offering a few rewards that may catch you eye!
In the end, the future of Broken Reflections is in your hands. If I can't get things ready to go for the end of the year, I'm not sure what direction this project will take. I'll keep working on it, for sure but it's going to take a lot longer than I would like, and a lot longer than you would like, either.

Can't Donate? You Can Still Help!
If you're strapped for money like myself and can't manage to donate, then you can still help out the project by spreading the word to as many people as you can, especially if you're as hyped for this novel as I am!
Don't forget to visit the games Facebook and Twitter accounts to follow this journey with me!
Thanks in advance for any help that you can offer and I look forward to being able to bring you a story that you won't ever forget!

story:
Summary

    I am a Computer Science graduate, and I have always had an interest in video games and creating a world in which you can become a part of a larger experience. I have developed a number of projects to various degrees of complexity, but this campaign is important to me in order to further my skill and press forward with creating more content. I would like to be able to better share my work with others, get feedback from a community, and gain support from those who can share in my enjoyment.

Space Bunnies is a survival adventure game in which you explore different planets and systems and practice diplomacy with various alien species. This started out as a small project, but with strong positive feedback I have chosen to expand it. I hope to continue to have the opportunity to share my creations, and with them, a small piece of joy in how I see this world.

The Goal

    Thus far, I have created a solid prototype for movement and interaction within the space system and individual planets as well as an outline for numerous other systems and content that I would like to add. This project will only be a three month span for further developing a framework for a combat system.

Timeline: 3 Months (January 1st-March 31st)

Develop a Playable Demo

Month 1: Planet Interaction

    Week 1: Character movement (rotation vs planet rotation)

    Week 2: Character Interaction

    Week 3: Enemy Tracking

    Week 4: Enemy Attacking

Month 2: Game Progression Mechanics

    Week 1: In-Game UI and menu

    Week 2: NPC interaction

    Week 3: Event Generation

    Week 4: Save/Load Data

Month 3: Space Combat

    Week 1: Shoot with ship (Different types of firing)

    Week 2: Ship stats

    Week 3: Enemy AI (shooting and defending)

    Week 4: Enemy AI (tracking and evading)

Month 4: End of Project

    Week 1: Clean up

    Week 2: Release Demo

    Week 3+: Evaluate future of project

Every two weeks I will write a review on any progress I am able to make to update any followers I may have. At the end of the project, I will publicly provide an executable demo.

The Impact

    Feedback is extremely important to me, and highly valuable to my progress. If you would like to see this project completed, please share your support. If you have an opinion or would like to be involved, please let me know. Your positive feedback will depend on whether I will be developing Space Bunnies further, or whether I will be entering other directions.

Risks & Challenges

   Time - I have limited time and energy. I have developed a timeline to make my goals clear so I can set my pace and have motivation to continue onward. With each two week period I can determine whether I have met my goals, and decide on whether my timeline may need revised.

   Delays - If I can not meet my goals in time, I may revise my timeline and create a new estimate for when I can fully complete my goal.

   Technology - For as much as I believe I have encountered every issue I possibly could, there are always unforseen obstacles that I will encounter. I may have to revise my solution for an instance of this project as necessary to create a functional product.

Other Links:

Some of these may not work fully yet, as I prepare to get them ready.

Discord: https://discord.gg/89pXyrg

facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/419048352367954/

itch.io: https://littlepinksprite.itch.io/space-bunnies

Patreon: https://patreon.com/littlepinksprite

Portfolio: https://riffleportfolio.wordpress.com/

story:
Let's face it, a lot of today's videos games are time sinks and are violent. Either parents feel they are a bad influence or that a kid is just wasting time that could be better used elsewhere. A lot of adults are indulging in gaming these days too. Games have been proven to help us enhance all types of skills, math skills, memory skills, speed, coordination, etc. We can see that in mental games like Luminocity and educational games regularly designed for children. Intelligently made games have demonstrated that they can definitely influence us in a positive way that carries over into our real lives, so why not make some more?!

What I'm working on, is a fun game where you can lift your spirits as you identify with a depressed character, an avatar you design, who practices and internalizes positive thoughts, feelings and experiences! 

This is a game you can play on a mobile app or on the web. These activities will be equally funny, healthy and appropriate for the young and old. This isn't just for the clinically depressed, we all feel down sometimes. There are 38 million sufferers of depression in America alone. You may know or love someone who feels down, slow and sluggish, suffers from low self esteem, anxiety and/or depression like I do, or know what it's like to have the winter or Monday blues.

This game utilizes all the contemporary behaviors we know to move a person toward positive physical and mental health. Many people are worried about their mental and physical health. They want to make changes but don't know where to start. They don't know where to begin to start a completely new health care regimen. Learning about nutritional requirements, calories, exercising and meditation can seem too overwhelming and hard, making people feel discouraged before they even begin. This game helps them to learn all they need to, in one place, by dipping their toe in the water, a little at a time, with laughs, fun, encouragement, rewards and feelings of validation. Many people are thinking about changing and improving their overall health. Let's keep them thinking about it, and learning about it while not even realizing they are learning. With the right inspiration, people will become motivated and will adapt the behaviors and activities of the game and character to their real lives...keep in mind...people are addicted to these virtual coins/rewards, imagine how good it will feel for them when they are no longer virtual !

What activities will you see in this game?

There are 6 main steps that the world of psychology suggests a person follows for combating depression and anxiety: 
  • Visit a therapist or a support group
  • Express feelings with family and friends whenever possible
  • Try to remain mentally active at work or a job
  • Exercise daily if health permits
  • Have a nutritious diet with ample fluids
  • Learn meditation, yoga or stress relieving exercises 
These steps will be taken by your character in fun exercises that set him up for rewards, consisting of visible improved health, and both coins for a gift shop, and to purchase fun experiences. Just as you can earn these things in real life, you can also earn them in this game. 
In the game, there will be activities based on behaviors that deepen optimism and social connections, behaviors that make positive changes in our lives, enforcing our belief that our behavior really matters. For example, making it a regular practice to write thank you notes and share them, mental activity games designed around nutrition, a few minutes of low impact cardio or practicing meditation. Some of these simple exercises have scientifically proven in studies to create more optimistic, calm and happy people.  These are just some of the activities you will find in this fun, awesome game. 
Will this game solve or remove people's problems? No. However, if you remove all the negatives, that alone does not make a positive/create happiness. Does the game guarantee to cure depression or teach medication is not necessary? No, but it does aim to alleviate mild to moderate depression/anxiety symptoms and move one toward feeling happiness so that medication might not become necessary. People should continue working with their doctor to evaluate their need for medicines...
But we must consider, many prescription drugs are over-prescribed and come with serious potential side effects, which are rarely mentioned by a doctor. These drugs react differently in people, so each depressed patient is truly a guinea pig. In many cases, these drugs make a depressed person worse. Especially in people under 25, we are really gambling with their mental and physical health and safety when we administer anti-depressants. In my photo gallery, I will post side effects of 2 popular antidepressants - fluoxetine (Prozac) and bupropion (Wellbutrin), which you can easily find posted on the web.  We need to have more and safer initial options for the depressed than just going straight to the prescription pad. Healing doesn't have have to feel tedious, it doesn't have to feel like hard work or have to always require an appointment. Following a program for wellness generally does sound dull. Let's change that. Let's present it in a fun, popular way. We're all playing our cellular and web games anyway! Let's just make one that has a positive influence! Like Luminosity is to mental activity games, let this be the game for improving mental health.

The artwork in the image above was done with Windows Paint and is for a mini board game version which you may be able to see better in the gallery photos. With Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop, I can make a more sophisticated appearance and a larger game. I'm just waiting to get a patent on the title to put it on the game.  The board game is a great family game. Not all games have to take forever to finish. This is a quick version you can play while dinner is cooking and great if there is a child in the home with depression.

Contributors of this project will be helping me to spread improved health and happiness within people all around the world.


What I Need & What You Get

5% for marketing.
10% for backers perks
10% for taxes and fees, including third party and currency exchange fees
I need 75% to pay a freelancer to help me program the game, costs for computer art tools and programs for myself, such as Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop and a quality camera to be able to quickly and easily share my artistic ideas, computer art and videos with my freelancing game developer.
This is my first project. I see most others looking to fund a gaming project on indiegogo.com are asking for over $30,000, which tells me I may be underestimating the expenses of creating a game. I may need to bring in the expertise of an additional freelancer for certain programming or the project may take longer than anticipated. Freelancers get paid by the hour after a project is generally finished and updates and fixes continually need to be made. Long hours invested can become costly.
The funds will go toward the making of this game, whether or not I reach my goal. This game must be made. This game needs to be tried and if successful, needs to be accessible to people all over the world with access to technology. Not all people are helped with traditional therapies. Medications work on some, but not all. Many depressed people don't even seek help and live in emotional isolation. Should we just leave them depressed and write them off? No way! The quality of life matters for every person. Traditional therapies still leave the numbers of sufferers of depression and anxiety way too high. We must get innovative! We must get creative!

The Impact

Both depressed people and non-depressed people can hear a chronic, negative voice in their head, discouraging them in all ways. Here's a chance to get people listening to a positive voice. The more they play the game, the more opportunities they have to reset their mind with positive messages. Imagine how the world will change when suddenly more people are thinking and feeling more positively!  Of course there are many self help and daily affirmation books out there, but depressed people are not often motivated to read or do things they may think of as tedious, overly challenging or boring...but gaming is easy and fun. Gaming is popular with everyone these days, it can reach so many.


Risks & Challenges

If there are risks and obstacles along the way, I will just be reminded that I am in real life and not a virtual reality game. What will I do? Look to see how others have handled the situation before me, present my snags to knowledgeable people, ask for feedback and as usual, be perserverant and move forward. The only problem I foresee having, is needing to bring on one additional game developer or needing a little more time to complete the game's program. I would give updates here throughout the process and will ultimately add in a customized scrapbook of the game's varied artwork and photos with inspirational sayings as a perk for people willing to make a pledge.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help....

You've read about my mission to create this game, a game with a cause, a game for good, please leave me some feedback or questions to help me make a better presentation. My twitter name is @TherapeuticGame

Do you know someone who likes to write articles about social causes or gaming? Share my link! Have a twitter or Facebook account? Share my link! Indiegogo has easy share tools. The more people there are who know about my campaign, the better!

story:
Our Mission:

Our Mission is to provide the most advanced and easy to use software for Joining and Creating eSports tournaments along with intuitive player profile management.

Distribution of Funds

Understanding where these funds go is a vital part of our philosophy of an open book policy. All funds go in development cost and software needs.
$12,000 Basic Platform Development
$5,000 Security Enhancements
$5,000 Hardware Cost
$10,000 5 Year Cost of Operations
$10,000 Reserve Cash on Hand
$8,000 Game Integration Development 

The Features:

Player and Team Management
Finding players to join a team can be a difficult task and managing them can be even more difficult. Sovereign Gaming League's website application allows users to create an organization with multiple teams playing multiple games. A stylish team profile page makes it easy to keep your organization informed and up to date on upcoming events. Adding media to your team or player profile makes you more attractive to potential sponsors.

Fair-Play Features
Sovereign Gaming League will allow you to play in tournaments according to your own skill set. With a complex equation but simple mechanics, the Sovereign Gaming League platform will help auto match you into tournaments.

Create Your Own Tournament
E-Sports is a growing industry with a lot of untapped potential. Whether you are a major electronics manufacturer or a community enthusiast, Sovereign Gaming League's tournament platform allows you to easily manage your own event and provide great advertising opportunities.

API Integration

Game developers will love having tournaments integrated into the games they create. With Sovereign Gaming League API integration, users can be notified in-game for an upcoming match or be connected directly to their opponent without complicated coordination. Scores can be automatically uploaded and added as part of the players profile.

Gamer Connections
Getting together with other players in your area can be a lot of fun. Sovereign Gaming League helps you connect with players nearby and also allows you to organize gaming events. 


Worldwide Community
Sovereign Gaming League will be initially released in English however full language translations and support will be provided with future patches to the software.

The Timeline:

Early features will release as early as July 2015, with other features patched in as they are fully developed. Full completion will be expected mid-2016.


Join the Team:

Excited about eSports then this is your opportunity to join the crew of volunteers. Sovereign Gaming League is looking for shoutcasters, programmers, and game moderators to join in building the biggest gaming community in the world.
