Scores can be automatically uploaded and added as part of the players profile.Gamer ConnectionsGetting together with other players in your area can be a lot of fun. Sovereign Gaming League helps you connect with players nearby and also allows you to organize gaming events. 
Worldwide CommunitySovereign Gaming League will be initially released in English however full language translations and support will be provided with future patches to the software.The Timeline:Early features will release as early as July 2015, with other features patched in as they are fully developed. Full completion will be expected mid-2016.
Join the Team:
Excited about eSports then this is your opportunity to join the crew of volunteers. Sovereign Gaming League is looking for shoutcasters, programmers, and game moderators to join in building the biggest gaming community in the world.

story:
Putting the “Shooting” in “Troubleshooting”

This October, enter the PC as antivirus software and fight against an unending cyber menace!  We’re bringing old-school shooters to the next generation and adding a Rogue-like mode to the mix for the most tenacious shooter fans!



Deeply inspired by early FPS legends and their fast-paced run-and-gun gameplay, "Infinite Recursion" seeks to recapture the feeling of impending Doom that makes players Quake with fear as they navigate uncharted levels filled to the brim with merciless foes.




Early FPS levels might start out uncharted, but they can only stay that way for so long.  After a while, traversing the same abandoned facilities or hellish pits becomes second nature, and the need to rely on instinct is replaced by the ability to learn every surprise the levels hold.  To keep the experience perpetually fresh, "Infinite Recursion" uses procedural generation to make every level uniquely treacherous, so keeping your wits about you never becomes outdated.



Story Told Through Gameplay: Years ago, the only way to tell a story in a video game was through gameplay.  Exposition and world-building and mission objectives would all have to be conveyed without the use of cutscenes and long speeches, leading to an experience that felt like one big adventure.  This is how “Infinite Recursion” will tell its story.  Minimal dialogue, minimal cutscenes, and minimal interruption.  It’s your adventure -- your story -- from beginning to end.


Fast-Paced Action: “Infinite Recursion” takes us back to when a shooter was a run-and-gun adrenaline rush filled with enemies and bullets and a distinct lack of mercy on both ends.  We’re not saying a slow and methodical cutscene-filled morality-questioning modern shooter is a bad thing; all we’re saying is that sometimes, it’s nice to just play a game.

Weapons: It wouldn’t be an FPS without tons of weapons ranging from “lethal” to “more lethal”, and we’ve gone all-out in designing some pretty swell “more lethal” weapons to call our very own.  Do you like lava?  How about lightning?  How does shooting them from a gun sound?  The answer is “Magnificent.”




Story-Mode: The story of “Infinite Recursion” takes place in a personal computer.  You take on the role of Vanguard Version 4.5, the newest antivirus software on the market, who has just been installed to hunt down and delete malicious software, but viruses aren’t the only enemies you’ll find waiting for you.  Outdated programs and crazed hackers wreak havoc throughout the system, and something even more nefarious lurks toward the end of your journey. In this mode, there is a set number of levels and bosses, tied together with checkpoints and a minimalist, gameplay-centric narrative.

Infinite-Mode: Infinite-Mode pits the player against an unending labyrinth of viruses and hackers with far more variety than Story-Mode can offer with its finite levels.  As the true test of players’ tenacity and skill, Infinite-Mode also removes all checkpoints, giving the player only one chance to get the farthest they can before their demise.  How long will your software last before becoming obsolete?


Power-Ups: Throughout levels, 4.5 can find upgrades to boost skills, such as his speed, health, and fire-rate.  These upgrades are scattered on every floor, so be sure to check each room thoroughly if you find yourself wanting for an edge.

Alternate Characters: 4.5 “Ninja” is the latest and fastest antivirus program in the system, but he isn’t the only one.  By playing through "Infinite Recursion", you’ll unlock different characters to use in Infinite-Mode, each with their own unique starting traits and play-styles.  Which one will you make it farthest with?



Licenses are expensive, but they’re necessary to build and distribute the final version of our game.  We’ve come so far with our development, but we can’t finish by ourselves.  As a start-up company, we can’t afford these licenses.  That’s why we need you.  With your support, we’re not just a start-up company.  We’re a community of gamers that remembers the thrill of classic shooters and wants to see it again, and it’s that community that can see our very first project through to completion.

Our game is meant to reawaken the nostalgia deep within older gamers while showing the younger generation the golden age of the FPS.  This comes with the inherent risk of trying to stay true to the titans we’re honoring while also adding a few new features to appeal to a new era.  Keeping this balance between loyalty and originality is no easy task, but with community feedback and testing, it is well within reach.



“Infinite Recursion” is well on its way to completion, but what if we told you 100% was just the beginning?  If we get more funding than our campaign requires, we’ll be able to start putting the extra pledges toward extra content.  The original game is meant to be a single-player experience on the PC, but it could be so much more if you give us your support!






Before you pledge, you’re probably thinking to yourself, “What’s in it for me?”  Well, we’ve got you covered with a plethora of neat perks, some of which are limited in stock and exclusive to the IndieGoGo campaign.


Special Backer Credit - $5

You were generous enough to give us your time and money, and as such, you deserve a special place in the credits as a backer!

Digital Copy of the Game - $10

You’ll get a code to download the full digital version of “Infinite Recursion” for the PC upon release, plus you still get backer credit!

Digital Soundtrack - $15

You’ll get a code to download the full “Infinite Recursion” soundtrack in digital form upon release, plus all previous rewards!

Digital Artbook - $20

You’ll get a code to download the “Infinite Recursion” artbook, containing everything from early concept to finished designs for characters and worlds, plus all previous rewards!

Early Access Beta - $25

You’ll get a code to download the Beta version of “Infinite Recursion” while we work on final updates and changes before the game’s official launch, plus you get all the previous rewards, too!

Virus Invasion Screensaver - $35

If you’ve never noticed viruses infecting your computer due to the power of your antivirus program (or the sneakiness of the viruses), then you’ll enjoy this System CorRuptivity Electronic EmulatioN and SimulAtion Via Enhanced Reality (SCREENSAVER, for short), which will let you experience a [totally fictional] invasion of viruses right on your computer screen!  Not to mention you still get all the previous rewards.

SIGNED & LIMITED Poster - $50

Have yourself a big ol’ wall-hugging picture to remember your generosity by!  We’ve only got so many of these, so get them while they’re still here.  This is the first of the physical perks, but it still comes with all the previous rewards!

"Infinite Recursion" Poster - $50

Don’t worry if you missed the limited signed poster.  You can still get yourself a big ol’ standard wall-hugging picture to remember your generosity by!  It still comes with all the previous rewards that aren’t signed and limited, so no worries!

SIGNED & LIMITED Game - $60     

You’ll be mailed a signed physical copy of “Infinite Recursion” for the PC upon release, plus you’ll still get all the previous rewards!

Physical Game - $60     

We might be out of signed copies, but you can still be mailed a standard physical disc copy of “Infinite Recursion” for the PC upon release, plus you’ll still get all the previous rewards (not including SIGNED & LIMITED items)!

Physical Soundtrack - $75     

You’ll be mailed a physical disc copy of the “Infinite Recursion” soundtrack upon release, in addition to all previous rewards (not including SIGNED & LIMITED items)!

SIGNED & LIMITED Game and Tee - $100    

You’ll be mailed an “Infinite Recursion” T-shirt, and instead of the regular physical copy of the game, you’ll be mailed a signed physical copy of “Infinite Recursion” for the PC upon release, plus you’ll still get all the previous rewards (not including other SIGNED & LIMITED items or other physical game copies)!


"Infinite Recursion" Tee - $100    

You’ll be mailed an “Infinite Recursion” T-shirt when the game releases.  In addition, you’ll still receive all the previous rewards (not including SIGNED & LIMITED items)!

SIGNED & LIMITED Artbook - $200    

You’ll be mailed a signed physical copy upon release, plus you’ll get all the previous rewards (not including other SIGNED & LIMITED items)!

Physical Artbook - $200    

Even if you missed out on the signed and limited version, you can still be mailed a standard physical copy of the “Infinite Recursion” artbook upon release, plus you’ll still get all the previous rewards (not including SIGNED & LIMITED items)!

3D Game Logo Statue - $300    

Your generosity will earn you a 3D-printed 4” version of the “Infinite Recursion” logo, which is going to look great next to your computer as you pour hours and hours into the game it represents!  And before you ask, yes: this reward comes with all the previous rewards (not including SIGNED & LIMITED items).

3D Emote Statue - $500    

Your spectacular generosity will earn you a 4” Emote figurine!  Put him next to your computer when you play “Infinite Recursion” so that he can watch as you brutally delete his in-game brethren!  This reward, as usual, comes with all the previous rewards (not including SIGNED & LIMITED items).

3D Character Statue - $750    

Your amazing generosity will earn you this physical representation of the digital representation of the fictional representation of antivirus software (i.e. you get an 8” statue of the game’s main character), plus all previous rewards (not including SIGNED & LIMITED items)!

3D Emote King Statue - $1,000  

He’s like the Emote, but bigger, and he’s less common, so that makes him much more important.  Regally so.  Your unfathomable generosity will earn you a whopping 8” figurine of this royal pain to place beside you while you obliterate his minions, cook dinner, or sleep.  He’s very adaptable, and he comes with all the previous rewards, too (not including SIGNED & LIMITED items)!

Meet the Team (Limited to USA) - $2,500  

Your indescribable generosity will actually coax us out of our office to meet you personally, mostly out of confusion that such a benevolent soul could exist somewhere in this vast, flawed world.  Come October (or TBD, if that doesn’t work), you’ll be invited to an insider’s peek at the game’s development, as well as dinner with the makers of “Infinite Recursion”.  This still includes all the previous rewards (including SIGNED & LIMITED items).

Be a Producer & Make an Enemy - $5,000  

With this breathtaking amount of generosity, you’ll buy yourself a grand old Associate Producer credit on the project, and you’ll be able to work with our team to create your own enemy to be included in the finished game, and that’s still in addition to all the previous rewards (including SIGNED & LIMITED items)!

Executive Producer Credit - $10,000 

There are no adjectives that can adequately describe this level of generosity.  As such, anyone giving this much money will earn an Executive Producer credit on the game, and will get every single reward previous to this one, including SIGNED & LIMITED items.



This is the financial break-up for the initial $25,000 we're asking for:

Any funding beyond the first $25,000 goes toward our stretch goals.



Money means nothing without people who want to share our vision.  The more people we can reach, the bigger our following can become and the farther our vision can spread, so if you think old-school shooters still have a place in the modern era, be sure to share our campaign on social media (by clicking the links below), and anywhere else you can think of.  We won’t forget all your help!

We’d also love to be featured on the number one PC gaming platform, so show your support for us on Steam Greenlight!

story:
1) WhatWhat is it all about?

We are working on a new fun game, which should make people laugh at parties. The game is a “board game” in your pockets. Unlike typical board games it has a lot more options. It allows up to four teams of players on one device (min. 4 players = 2 teams). In the game one member of the team always performs a word (by pantomime, singing, drawing or description) and his/her playmate(s) tries to guess it.

 

 

The game was made in reaction to a lack of good party games played on one device. Its one and only goal is to make people laugh.

Thanks to various settings and packs of words you are able to play the game exactly according to your wishes. For example you decide to play only with music theme word pack and perform only by singing and the whole game gets to a completely new level. Or you can choose only movie pack and perfom by pantomiming some famous movie scenes.

The game can also represent perfectly practical and useful tool for learning foreign languages. Players can choose different language settings for menu and for words in the game. We already have the game in English, French, German, Russian, Spanish, Polish, Czech and Slovak and hopefully there will be more languages in the future. It’s also great for children with word packs aimed at them.

 

 

1.1) The main features:

•  Many words, it will take a long time to go through all of it

•  You can play with two, three or four teams (unlimited number of team members)

•  Pantomime, drawing, singing and description of various words

•  Intuitive and simple to play

•  Can be used as a practical tool to improve foreign language

•  Many languages (EN, DE, FR, RU, ES, PL, CZ, SK)

 

 

2) How to play this game (RULES)

The game is for 2, 3 or 4 teams (min. 2 players for a team). The number of players in one team isn’t limited, but two players are recommended.

Game fields have 4 colors which determine how the word must be “performed” (= type of game). Red fields mean pantomime, blue ones description by giving a definition of the word, green ones drawing and yellow ones singing.

If you need any help during the game, use the help button ("i"), we hope you will find your answer.

There could be more hands on one device which could cause incorrect/accidental touches, if this happen use the return button in the right top corner of the screen.

Before every game you set the number of teams and their colors, the time limit for guessing the right word, and the number of game fields. In the next two steps you can also choose which packs of words you want to activate and what types of game you want to play. 

At the beginning of every game all teams are on the start field. First team presses the “PLAY“ button and chooses one of the words from the list. Every word has a different number which tells you how many fields you will move forward if you guess it correctly. After pressing the word you have chosen, you have 5 seconds supported by the sound alert to get ready for your performace. If you need to check the word, you can use the slider. In the game mode screen there are also two buttons, a red one, which you press when you fail or break any rule, and a green one for being successful. Both being successful or unsuccessful means it’s the other team’s turn and everything repeats. After each round players in one team switch (the one who was guessing in the last round, will perform in the next round etc.). This will continue until the first team gets to the end. Then you can choose whether you want to let other teams finish the game, repeat the same game or exit to the menu.

(Word) description means that you can talk during the time limit, give definitions of the word and try to guide your playmate(s) to guess the right word. You can’t use the root of the given word.

Singing doesn’t necessarily mean you have to sing or hum a real song or a melody; you simply have to try to sing the definition of the word you would use in an ordinary description.

Pantomime is about using your own body in an attempt to help your playmate guess the word.

For drawing you must have a paper and a pencil. It’s not allowed to write any letters, you can only draw.

 

3) How and why we are working on this game

Once upon a time I was sitting with my flatmates in the living room. Everything has been already said, all drinks were drunk, all pubs were closed at the time and we wanted to do something. Accidentally we had no games to play, but all of us had a smartphones. Even after some research I couldn’t find any playable game and I realized I could make one…  About year and a half passed by when I finaly had some time to work on the game (on the bus, on the train, at boring classes in school) creating hundreds and hundreds of words to guess.

 

 

After some time a friend of mine introduced me Jan Šíma, who was excited by the idea so we decided to cooperate. I am responsible for all the graphics, all the text (not at all for the translation) and promo. Jan is programing Android and iOS version.

 

 

It was a long journey to get to this point where we are right before the finishing line. There are thousands of words in 8 languages, about 10 pages of text in 8 languages each and third version of graphic which should be very easy to operate on bigger screens of tablets and also smaller screens of smartphones.

 

4) Reasonable questions

So why are we asking for funding when it‘s almost done?

The more players are involved the better the game gets (for the reason scroll down).

We want to attract as many players as possible and with a little help from you we can create some ads, which we can’t afford at this point. Also we want to find the answer for the most important question – Is there enough players interested in this type of game? We try to make no compromises and make it truly the best game for multiple player on one devices. So please, give it a try… :)

 

 

Also we have to pay the rent, food, drinks and we expect to work 3 months full time now only on our game to finish it and to provide some basic support and fix bugs. To be able do it as good as we want it to be done we need some help with funding.

Why more players mean better game?

We wanted the game to adjust the level of difficulty so every time you guess any word and you either fail or succeed the game will remember it. When you connect to the Internet it will upload your results and download results from other devices and that will form sets of words from the easiest to the hardest ones to guess. It means that the words which move you one field forward should be much easier than the ones which move you four fields forward (this function going to be launch later next year (2017)).

 

5) Funding and other ways to help

We are very grateful for every dollar from any contributor, so you can ask us for "anything". We are open to hear any of your opinions and feedback as well :)

So what can you get...

For $1 USD A special THANKYOU!

 

Besides of a good feeling you have by supporting this project your name will be mentioned in the credits of the game and you will receive an online certificate for being a part of all of this.

For $3 USD BETA version immediately!

As soon as we recieve your support, we will send you a BETA version with all the packs for free. (This version will be available only for couple of months)

+all the previous (name in credits, online certificate)

For $8 USD Be part of the TEAM

For your support we will give you chance to create content for all the other players. You can add 10 more words into the game (we let them translate to all the languages). Words cannot be against good manners :)

+all the previous (name in credits, online certificate, BETA version)

$15 USD Get it FULL

You will get full version of this game with all of the standard packs of words as soon as it's possible :) (Full game does not include erotic pack of words).

+all the previous (name in credits, online certificate, BETA version, 10 words)

$20 USD For the big BOYS and GIRLS

You will get full game with all the packs including EROTIC pack. From our experience this is the most hilarious pack of all!!! :)

+all the previous (name in credits, online certificate, BETA version, 10 words, full game)

 

5.1) Other ways to help

If you are not feeling into sending some money but you still like our game, please let people around you know about it. You can share this campaign, follow us on facebook or any other social network.

                 

 

 

6) Goals on Indiegogo

We have some plans with our game and some of them are quite BIG :) And we would like to move quicker with your help, so here are few promises...

If we reach our goal of $1000

We are planning to release Android version till the end of February and iOS till the end of February for iPads and during spring for iPhones.

If we reach $1500

We will add some other languages according to your comments and wishes.

If we receive more than $2000

We will translate the game into much more languages! :)

 

7) Thanks

Thank you very very much if you decide to contribute or if you just had enough energy to get here at the end. There might be (and probably are) some mistakes in English and we are sorry for that. But all the English and other languages in the game has been revised twice by native speakers so that should be much better.

Thanks one more time, and hopefully - Have fun with our game! :)
 
Adam Svoboda and Jan Šíma
story_txt:
1) WhatWhat is it all about?We are working on a new fun game, which should make people laugh at parties. The game is a “board game” in your pockets. Unlike typical board games it has a lot more options. It allows up to four teams of players on one device (min. 4 players = 2 teams). In the game one member of the team always performs a word (by pantomime, singing, drawing or description) and his/her playmate(s) tries to guess it.  The game was made in reaction to a lack of good party games played on one device. Its one and only goal is to make people laugh.Thanks to various settings and packs of words you are able to play the game exactly according to your wishes. For example you decide to play only with music theme word pack and perform only by singing and the whole game gets to a completely new level. Or you can choose only movie pack and perfom by pantomiming some famous movie scenes.The game can also represent perfectly practical and useful tool for learning foreign languages. Players can choose different language settings for menu and for words in the game. We already have the game in English, French, German, Russian, Spanish, Polish, Czech and Slovak and hopefully there will be more languages in the future. It’s also great for children with word packs aimed at them.  1.1) The main features:•  Many words, it will take a long time to go through all of it•  You can play with two, three or four teams (unlimited number of team members)•  Pantomime, drawing, singing and description of various words•  Intuitive and simple to play•  Can be used as a practical tool to improve foreign language•  Many languages (EN, DE, FR, RU, ES, PL, CZ, SK)  2) How to play this game (RULES)The game is for 2, 3 or 4 teams (min. 2 players for a team). The number of players in one team isn’t limited, but two players are recommended.Game fields have 4 colors which determine how the word must be “performed” (= type of game). Red fields mean pantomime, blue ones description by giving a definition of the word, green ones drawing and yellow ones singing.If you need any help during the game, use the help button ("i"), we hope you will find your answer.There could be more hands on one device which could cause incorrect/accidental touches, if this happen use the return button in the right top corner of the screen.Before every game you set the number of teams and their colors, the time limit for guessing the right word, and the number of game fields. In the next two steps you can also choose which packs of words you want to activate and what types of game you want to play. At the beginning of every game all teams are on the start field. First team presses the “PLAY“ button and chooses one of the words from the list. Every word has a different number which tells you how many fields you will move forward if you guess it correctly. After pressing the word you have chosen, you have 5 seconds supported by the sound alert to get ready for your performace. If you need to check the word, you can use the slider. In the game mode screen there are also two buttons, a red one, which you press when you fail or break any rule, and a green one for being successful. Both being successful or unsuccessful means it’s the other team’s turn and everything repeats. After each round players in one team switch (the one who was guessing in the last round, will perform in the next round etc.). This will continue until the first team gets to the end. Then you can choose whether you want to let other teams finish the game, repeat the same game or exit to the menu.(Word) description means that you can talk during the time limit, give definitions of the word and try to guide your playmate(s) to guess the right word. You can’t use the root of the given word.Singing doesn’t necessarily mean you have to sing or hum a real song or a melody; you simply have to try to sing the definition of the word you would use in an ordinary description.Pantomime is about using your own body in an attempt to help your playmate guess the word.For drawing you must have a paper and a pencil. It’s not allowed to write any letters, you can only draw. 3) How and why we are working on this gameOnce upon a time I was sitting with my flatmates in the living room. Everything has been already said, all drinks were drunk, all pubs were closed at the time and we wanted to do something. Accidentally we had no games to play, but all of us had a smartphones. Even after some research I couldn’t find any playable game and I realized I could make one…  About year and a half passed by when I finaly had some time to work on the game (on the bus, on the train, at boring classes in school) creating hundreds and hundreds of words to guess.  After some time a friend of mine introduced me Jan Šíma, who was excited by the idea so we decided to cooperate. I am responsible for all the graphics, all the text (not at all for the translation) and promo. Jan is programing Android and iOS version.  It was a long journey to get to this point where we are right before the finishing line. There are thousands of words in 8 languages, about 10 pages of text in 8 languages each and third version of graphic which should be very easy to operate on bigger screens of tablets and also smaller screens of smartphones. 4) Reasonable questionsSo why are we asking for funding when it‘s almost done?The more players are involved the better the game gets (for the reason scroll down).We want to attract as many players as possible and with a little help from you we can create some ads, which we can’t afford at this point. Also we want to find the answer for the most important question – Is there enough players interested in this type of game? We try to make no compromises and make it truly the best game for multiple player on one devices. So please, give it a try… :)  Also we have to pay the rent, food, drinks and we expect to work 3 months full time now only on our game to finish it and to provide some basic support and fix bugs. To be able do it as good as we want it to be done we need some help with funding.Why more players mean better game?We wanted the game to adjust the level of difficulty so every time you guess any word and you either fail or succeed the game will remember it. When you connect to the Internet it will upload your results and download results from other devices and that will form sets of words from the easiest to the hardest ones to guess. It means that the words which move you one field forward should be much easier than the ones which move you four fields forward (this function going to be launch later next year (2017)). 5) Funding and other ways to help
We are very grateful for every dollar from any contributor, so you can ask us for "anything". We are open to hear any of your opinions and feedback as well :)
So what can you get...
For $1 USD A special THANKYOU!
 
Besides of a good feeling you have by supporting this project your name will be mentioned in the credits of the game and you will receive an online certificate for being a part of all of this.

For $3 USD BETA version immediately!
As soon as we recieve your support, we will send you a BETA version with all the packs for free. (This version will be available only for couple of months)

+all the previous (name in credits, online certificate)
For $8 USD Be part of the TEAM
For your support we will give you chance to create content for all the other players. You can add 10 more words into the game (we let them translate to all the languages). Words cannot be against good manners :)

+all the previous (name in credits, online certificate, BETA version)
$15 USD Get it FULL
You will get full version of this game with all of the standard packs of words as soon as it's possible :) (Full game does not include erotic pack of words).

+all the previous (name in credits, online certificate, BETA version, 10 words)
$20 USD For the big BOYS and GIRLS
You will get full game with all the packs including EROTIC pack. From our experience this is the most hilarious pack of all!!! :)

+all the previous (name in credits, online certificate, BETA version, 10 words, full game)
 
5.1) Other ways to help
If you are not feeling into sending some money but you still like our game, please let people around you know about it. You can share this campaign, follow us on facebook or any other social network.
                      
6) Goals on Indiegogo
We have some plans with our game and some of them are quite BIG :) And we would like to move quicker with your help, so here are few promises...
If we reach our goal of $1000
We are planning to release Android version till the end of February and iOS till the end of February for iPads and during spring for iPhones.
If we reach $1500
We will add some other languages according to your comments and wishes.
If we receive more than $2000
We will translate the game into much more languages! :)
 
7) Thanks
Thank you very very much if you decide to contribute or if you just had enough energy to get here at the end. There might be (and probably are) some mistakes in English and we are sorry for that. But all the English and other languages in the game has been revised twice by native speakers so that should be much better.

Thanks one more time, and hopefully - Have fun with our game! :)
 
Adam Svoboda and Jan Šíma

story:
What Is EliteGamingLIVE?

EliteGaming LIVE is an after-school program that provides a safe, positive environment for kids to play and compete in a video game league. Our goal is to give students the same benefits for participating that traditional student athletes enjoy, recognizing and rewarding their achievements, building team spirit and encouraging community support by educating both parents and students on careers in gaming and technology.

EliteGaming LIVE is a bootstrapped, self-funded, startup currently approved in 14 schools within the Indianapolis area. With your help we can expand to bring positive team gaming experiences to many more. 


A Positive After-School Environment for Kids, With Real Academic And Social Benefits

The EGL team ensures the after school events—from practice to qualifying through to the championships—are conducted in a safe, constructive environment. We regularly witness new friendships forming organically, special needs students competing and excelling, and marked increases in classroom performance, overall school engagement, and behavior. We request that participants maintain a ‘C-’ average or above in their schoolwork and behave respectfully in class to qualify. Parents and teachers alike consistently remark on how much better behaved in class—and even at home—their kids become when participating in EGL.


Changing Attitudes To Video Games And Gaming

Video gaming is often treated with suspicion by parents and teachers alike, and we understand why. At home, kids can find themselves playing online in uncontrolled or unsuitable environments that have the potential to be harmful or socially negative and even abusive. EGL knows that’s far from the whole story and that gaming can be a positive experience that can promote many of the same values and benefits of traditional team sports, such as mutual respect, team spirit, positive reinforcement and greater confidence. By encouraging the parents and teachers to attend the events and support their kids and students, we’re giving both groups the opportunity to see gaming as something that can be a positive force.


How It Works 

The students and schools that participate in our program are in a city-wide competition. A student’s main goal is to compete within their school and earn an EGL Championship invitation. Top performing students at each school on the program get personalized invitations to compete for cash prizes, apparel—and soon (with your help), scholarships—at the EGL Championship events held in Winter and Spring of each school year.

We have developed a comprehensive 'EGL LiveScore' point system, which grades each student on more than just their gaming prowess; students earn LiveScore points by not only playing video games but also by learning about careers dealing with but not limited to coding, video game development, video game design, and web development. Online exercises and critical writing requirements facilitate the educational aspect of EliteGamingLIVE.


Why We Need Your Help

For over two years our small but dedicated team has grown the Elite Gaming LIVE program independently. We have grown from a one school pilot program, to 14 approved schools in that short timespan. Although we are minimally compensated by some schools, those who are less well funded have received our full program free of charge. This campaign is all about improving the quality of the program, expanding the reach by being able to add many more schools, and introducing the program to new territories. Our goal is to grow from those 14 schools today to over a hundred schools by the end of 2016 and make this a nationwide program.


Your contribution will go directly to expanding the EGL program and will be used to:

  • Purchase needed equipment (PCs, PlayStations, Wii U, monitors, etc)
  • Bring in more staff (to run concurrent programs at schools in different areas)
  • Cover increasing costs for event set-up and transportation of equipment
  • Create a College Scholarship Fund 
  • Provide cash prize incentives and better prizing for competitors, including a schools trophy
  • Create better marketing and event materials to grow awareness of EGL within the school system
  • Bring game developers into schools to talk to students about careers in gaming and technology
  • Cover the legal and filing fees required to convert Elite Gaming LIVE, LLC into a registered 501(c) Not-For-Profit


Stretch Goals


23K 

  • Award the first EliteGamingLIVE Scholarship Award to a participating student!
  • ‎Support after-school programs for up to 20 schools simultaneously
  • Execute promotional plan within participating schools without compromise 
55K

  • Support after-school programs for up to 30 schools simultaneously
  • Award 3 EGL College Scholarships to participating students in 2015
90K

  • ‎Award 10 EGL College Scholarships to participating students in 2015
  • Hire part-time staff
  • Increase prize pool for students by 500%
  • Overhaul and redesign ELITEGAMINGLIVE.COM website (more pages, information and leagues)
‎140K

  • Support after-school programs for up to 40 schools simultaneously
  • Hire full-time staff 
  • Increase award amounts for ‎10 EGL College Scholarships to participating students 
  • ‎Purchase company transportation

Any funds raised over and above the $140,000 will be split between the costs of running the EGL program and increasing the EGL College Scholarship Fund. The more funds we raise, the more students we can provide this outlet to and the better we can support participating students in their higher education aspirations.

story:
What you have to know about DreamSnatcher

You are a tiny alien with a very special spaceship, powered only by the dreams of sleeping pals. As cocktails and beer are very rare in space you have decided to go on the long journey to the only decent bar around -- The Space Bar.

However the way to your cold delight isn’t that easy:

There are asteroids all over your route and your spaceship only has a limited amount of energy. Filling stations would not help. So you have to stop by now and then at sleeping planets to drain their dreams regain power for your ship. Not enough, nightmares will haunt you if your running out of power and you are lost in space FOREVER! muhahaha … Nevertheless if you would make your way to the spacebar, celebration is yours!

So don’t waste time, get in your spaceship and DO IT!

Ah, the spaceship:

Wouldn’t be that funny if there would only be one spaceship, wouldn’t it? So the game offers three different kinds of ships at startup:

1. The Cruzer

Middle weighted spaceship and with a well balanced speed to mileage ratio. This is your vehicle of choice if you are the guy taking few risks

2.  The Camper

The name says it all … just with much less mileage.

3.  The Runabout

Everone wants to have one, right? So there you go! But be aware of the asteroids...just saying.

DreamSnatcher Setup

You will find yourself in front of a game featuring a level editor and highscore system. Different levels from different users can be accessed via a server as well as the corresponding highscores. So you can show off with your friends, no worry about that.

Starting the level of your choice you are thrown somewhere in space with no more than a little rocket acting as your compass, because be honest - without compass in space? No way!

What is DreamSnatcher?

DreamSnatcher is a competitive arcade game. You are moving your spaceship by clicking behind it and boost it that way, like in asteroids. Liked Asteroids? Then you will love DreamSnatcher.

Combined with appealing artwork and catchy sounds DreamSnatcher combines everything a good game needs - not forgetting the spaceships.

Don’t dream - perk up!

story:
School and Student ultimate in Russia is only beginning to develop. However, some of these girls and boys already participate in several European and World championships.

  • EYUC2011 Wroclaw, Poland - 11 place OPEN
  • WJUC2012 Dublin, Ireland - 11 place OPEN, 11th place Women
  • EYUC2013 Cologne, Germany 12 place - Open, 14th place - women
  • WJUC2014 Lecco, Italy - 22 place OPEN, 7 place WOMEN

      Over the past year the ruble against the euro has fallen dramatically, making trips to international tournaments for the Russian teams are much more expensive. This is particularly felt by students and pupils who have not yet earned money and are forced to ask their parents.

      This year the participation of  Russian Juniors Teams in EYUC-U19 is really insure because of the high cost of the trip.

Team fee = 1000 Euro 

Player fee = 50 Euro (x20 players in each team)

      We had 3 potential teams but eventually because of money we have only women U19, and even this team will reach up EYUC  only if we collect the money to pay their fees. Our Federation of Flying Disc have no opportunity to pay for any team.


We ask to help only to juniors. All the coaches will pay for themselves because we are adults and we have a job in addition to which we have voluntary engaged with Juniors Ultimate.


Other Ways You Can Help:

Please let your friends know about this! 

Thanks in advance! And see you at EYUC-2015!

story:
My name is Andrew Schulz, I am a obsessive gamer since earth! I have always been addicted to RPG and shooter games.

You ever played a game and wish you could change something about it?   ME TOO! 

I entered college to pursue my dreams and then life happened! Literally... I had a baby boy and my direction changed from obsessive gamer to dad needs to pay them bills! I have no problem supporting my family with my income but have no extra cash to invest in my passion.

Your donations will go to graphical and audio overhauling. This includes textures, zombie skins, player skins, equipment skins, gun skins, animations, music, sound effects, decorations and more! The game will function without these things , but I am a perfectionist! I want a polished, great looking , explosive launch! It is so much more fun to see things blow apart rather than just fall over.

If we don't meet our goal we will STILL be pushing this title out. You will get access to the game and we will continue to build on it until we reach our mission goals. The "Flare" can come later!

I want to bring this title to life and give back to the community. I plan to use the support to expand my team to provide the constant updates, add-on, extra in game flare, and sound track this title deserves. Being an independent developer allows me to extend my full attention and love into this title. Come help mold ZombieZ into an explosive, fast paced, survival shooter game.

ZombieZ is geared toward 1-4 players LAN and has online multiplayer capabilities. Enter the que for unique Death match, survival, and FFA modes. Engage in quests, scavenge, survive hordes and defeat unique bosses and encounters for amazing reward!

With your donation:

$2 - you will have access to our beta testing and be able to submit your ideas and feedback for us! Your input matters me!

$5 - Beta access + a copy of the game when it launches.(Deadline set for October 2017)

$10 - Beta Access + a copy of the game + your name in the credits as a cherished donator.

$15 - Beta Access + a copy of the game + your name in the credits as a cherished donator + a free copy to give a friend.

$25 - All the above + a limited addition ZombieZ tee shirt.

$50 - All the above + help design a monument in our post apocalyptic world.

$100 - All the above + we will let you design a playable character.

$200 - All the above + we will let you design and name a boss to be used in the game!!

Please help us get the word out and share our story! We will be making constant updates with our progress and hope you will help us build the hype!

$10 - Beta Access + a copy of the game + your name in the credits as a cherished donator.
$15 - Beta Access + a copy of the game + your name in the credits as a cherished donator + a free copy to give a friend.
$25 - All the above + a limited addition ZombieZ tee shirt.
$50 - All the above + help design a monument in our post apocalyptic world.
$100 - All the above + we will let you design a playable character.
$200 - All the above + we will let you design and name a boss to be used in the game!!
Please help us get the word out and share our story! We will be making constant updates with our progress and hope you will help us build the hype!

story:
Short Summary

Michigan Chess Festival LLC (MCFLLC) has been organizing significant chess tournaments in the metropolitan Detroit Area since 2011, which have been positively reviewed in online chess publications across the world. The Director of MCFLLC has received the Special Services Award from the United States Chess Federation, the membership organization for chess players in the USA. The Friendship Games will acknowledge and celebrate the improved relations between the USA and Cuba by welcoming some of the best chess players from Cuba, the United States and many countries around the world to metro Detroit for the tourney, which will take place October 28-November 1, 2015.

The Friendship Games will take place at the same time and place as a significant "scholastic" chess tournament that will include K-12 aged students from metro Detroit, Windsor, the Midwest, and some from even farther away. These avid young chess players will have their tournament experience, and perhaps even their lives, enriched by meeting and watching some of the best players from around the world compete in a major chess tournament. And all participants will get to participate in a tournament marking an important and dramatic change in world relations.

A report on the first tournament organized by MCFLLC appeared online in the United States Chess Federation's online magazine: http://www.uschess.org/content/view/11474/645/

A report on MCFLLC's 2012 tournament appeared here: http://www.westmichiganchess.com/reports/Reports/2012MichiganChessFestival.aspx

Your contribution will support The Friendship Games!

What We Need & What You Get

The Friendship Games is expensive to organize. We are bringing about 10 Grandmasters to the tournament, at an average cost of about $1,000. The venue and other costs are significant. The prize fund of $11,000, while not large for an event of this significance, is more than entry fees will likely generate. So, the goal of $17,000 is aimed at helping MCFLLC get near the break even level.

Contributors will get the satisfaction of supporting an important chess tournament that not only will have impact in the spheres of chess and diplomacy, but will also support and enrich the experience of hundreds of young chess players from Detroit, Michigan, Canada, and across the USA.

And contributors can receive some really cool perks!


The Impact

Every formal competitive chess game begins with ... a handshake. And that's how every game ends.

Each competitor, whether at The Friendship Games or a concurrent tourney, will be present at an event where people from around the world, mainly from the USA, but significant numbers from Cuba and Canada, as well as others from Ecuador, India, China, Italy, the Philippines and other countries will express the simple and profound act of sportsmanship reflected in a handshake.

 

Risks & Challenges


The Friendship Games <will> take place.

But the short time between the improvement of relations between the USA and Cuba, and the weekend set for the scholastic tournament, made it nearly impossible to <both> organize The Friendship Games, and secure adequate funding. Since neither MCFLLC nor its Director are weathy, this creates a "sustainability" problem. Your contribution to this campaign will help fund The Friendshp Games, and support MCFLLC's ability to go forward.

Thank you so much for your help.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 
Please spread the word about The Friendship Games on social media, and make use of the indiegogo share option.

story:
Get Tiffany

Get Tiffany was an online flash based game that encouraged up-to four players to compete against each other to garnish the attention of a girl named Tiffany. Players could make moves such as giving Tiffany a gift or tripping a competing player.

Get Tiffany reached peak popularity in the early 2000s and remained a vibrant community for over 13 years. Unfortunately, the game failed to make a stand in the modern tech world and Get Tiffany ultimately meet its demise, leaving a large dedicated community behind.


The Plan

Since Get Tiffany's inception, the way people interact with games has changed dramatically. Today, the vast majority of individuals interact with games on a mobile device rather than a web browser as in years past.
The plan is to redevelop Get Tiffany for both iOS and Android mobile platforms using the latest technologies and trends. By redeveloping Get Tiffany on mobile platforms, the game will be able to reach a larger audience, thus growing the community and creating a thriving gaming experience.
  • License Get Tiffany from the original copyright owner.
  • Redevelop Get Tiffany from the ground up for mobile devices
  • Deliver Get Tiffany beta ~ 1/17

Get Tiffany Today

Check out some of these Get Tiffany resources to learn more about the game.

  • Get Tiffany Website
  • Get Tiffany Group
  • Sample Orignal Gameplay
  • Sample Orignal Gameplay 

Funding Breakdown

Funding of this campaign will be used strictly for the redevelopment of Get Tiffany. This includes:

  • Licensing Fees
  • Infrastructure 
  • Marketing
  • Development

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share our campaign across social media. We can't get the word out without supporters like you! Let's make #GetTiffany happen.

This campaign has been posted with permission from the original copyright owner. 
If for any reason the campaign fails to fund, committed funds will be used in any further attempts to bring Get Tiffany into fruition.

story:
Where can I play Keen?

Register here and download the Demo (check your email)!

Keen is a Super Slidey Dungeon Crawling Puzzle Action Adventure!

Guide Kim, a grumpy little girl raised by her grandmother to save the world on her journey to stop an evil corporation from destroying her village.

Innovative controls and fluid gameplay allow players to choose their own pace, whether fast as a hack'n'slash or methodic as chess.

It’s fresh gameplay to a classic genre - moving and attacking are the same thing!

 

Keen's main innovation lies in its turn-based movement and attack mechanics. Slide our tiny hero vertically and horizontally to move her around puzzly rooms, or to slash through enemies with her mighty blade. Combat relies on precision-planning of enemy placement - a fresh take on the tactics genre.

  • 6+hours of NON-FILLER content
  • Unveil Kim's story as she tries to save the day!
  • Discover secret items, unlock new gadgets and get special powers!
  • Slash your way through more than 20 unique enemies! Also...boss battles!
  • BIG, maze-like dungeons, spanning from mysterious forests, dark catacombs, top-secret underwater labs, orbital military outposts, and pretty much anywhere fiction can lead us!
  • Special collectibles that can be combined into perks and powerups such as telekinesis, teleport, deploying traps and many others. 





 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Click here to download and play the current pre-alpha demo with ½ to 1 hour of gameplay (depending on the player's skills). We are asking for your support to make it a full game as described by the key features above.

All the resources you provide – after due taxes – will go entirely to the development of the game: cool art and animation, amazing levels, polished programming and epic music.

Why a Flexible Campaign?

We'll deliver Keen no matter what. The Flexible Campaign simply allows us to create more, with your insight and participation!

 

In a remote village where everyone is given a specific role, Kim was chosen as their guardian. Peace reigned for centuries, and the warrior role was a mere tradition tracing back to ancient times of conflict.

Soon after Kim turned twelve, a distress call was sensed by her trainer - her own, adorable grandmother - who ordered her to protect the village against an impending attack.

Kim was sent to fight without even knowing what violence was. Following a trail of brainwashed minions and high-tech robot soldiers, she would soon find herself in the middle of a world-domination plot carried on by an evil corporation.


 

 

Keen art is all about immersion. Hand-drawn, detail-rich worlds with occasional visual gags aim at telling a story without using words. We're crafting our assets to be as tasty as possible!

 

"Keen is not a bad idea."
-- Steven Hansen, Destructoid

 

"Managed to catch my attention and awaken an addictive interest."
-- Bruna Penilhas, IGN Brasil

 

"It might just be the hidden gem that you didn’t know you were looking for!"
-- Amy Graves, Square Enix

 

"Quite interesting. I like it very much!"
​-- Piotr Iwanicki, SUPERHOT

 

"We're keen on this adventure puzzler."
-- Jenna Bensoussan, Gamer Portal

 

We've already been approved on Steam Greenlight AND the Square Enix Collective!
